0a8443c0ba0e81fa.title: ICD-10-CM/PCS Course Writer - Remote Eligible
0a8443c0ba0e81fa.desc:
Are you looking for a high energy, strategic, and fast-paced position as an ICD-10-CM/PCS Course Writer? Join Relias, the company changing lives throughout the world by helping healthcare organizations improve their clinical and financial outcomes! 
 For 11,000+ health care and human service organizations, Relias helps clients deliver better clinical and financial outcomes by elevating the performance of teams. We help organizations across the continuum of care get better at maintaining compliance, developing staff and promoting consistent, high-quality care. Our platform employs assessments to reveal specific gaps in skills and addresses them with personalized and engaging learning, choosing from 7,000+ online courses that meet accrediting board, state and federal requirements. We are passionate about our products and our clients; what we deliver and the impact we have on the world is truly something you can be proud to represent. Join us and make a difference. 
 WHAT CAN RELIAS OFFER YOU? 
 
 Fantastic health and wellness benefits package, including an outstanding 401k match, a flexible PTO program, and a generous and inclusive parental leave policy. Additionally, Relias pays for the employee portion of the monthly healthcare premium! 
 Flexible work environment with onsite and work from home options – you choose when you want to come into the office! 
 Active Employee Resource Groups open to all employees! 
 Comprehensive onboarding program – a great introduction to our company, customers and culture! 
 Growth and career advancement opportunities! 
    
 20%+ annual employee promotion and transfer rate 
 Multiple development program options – leadership development, professional development curriculums, and Nanodegree options in both technology and data science 
 Professional development gained from conference attendance and participation in organizations like NC Tech 
 
 
 
 WHAT YOU’LL DO :  
 
 Create, write and develop new e-learning courses and edit existing content in one or more of Relias’ verticals 
 Design application-based and outcome-driven realistic case studies to illustrate key concepts in course material 
 Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in your specialty area and work with external SMEs in other areas 
 Collaborate effectively with internal departments who are involved in the course development life cycle 
 Manage multiple priority projects efficiently and effectively 
 
 
   
 YOU’VE GOT WHAT IT TAKES IF YOU HAVE: 
 
 3 - 5+ years of experience in ICD-10-CM/PCS, CPT/HCPCS, inpatient/outpatient hospital or professional fee coding 
 Certification (AHIMA, AAPC) in medical coding, required 
 Clinical Documentation Integrity (CDI) certification (ACDIS, AHIMA, or AAPC) or 3+ years of experience in CDI, preferred 
 3-5+ years of experience in revenue cycle management, a plus 
 LPN or RN licensure, a plus 
 Strong writing and communication skills; ability to write for various audiences and in various styles 
 Computer/Technical literacy (Microsoft Office, internet browsers, etc.) 
 Experience in training development/delivery 
 
 
 
 
 Relias is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free workplace 
 
 
 
 Company:  Relias LLC 
 Country:  United States of America 
 State/Region:  North Carolina 
 City:  Morrisville 
 Postal Code:  27560 
 Job ID:  263898

a229d15c0f473c8a.title: Senior HR Data and Reporting Analyst
a229d15c0f473c8a.desc:
Overview: 
  
   The Senior HR Reporting & Data Analyst will be responsible for extracting, analyzing, and transforming HR data into meaningful reports, dashboards, and recommendations. You will collaborate closely with HR leaders, cross-functional teams, and stakeholders to shape data-driven HR strategies and initiatives.
  
 
   
 
 
 The Ideal Candidate 
 
 
  You have experience building complex people analytics reports and dashboards  
 You possess strong analytical and consultative skills, with a passion for crafting creative solutions  
 You have experience in delivering insightful HR data to leaders 
 
   
 
  If this sounds like you, we invite you to keep reading and apply!
  
 
 
  Please note:  This role will be remote eligible, but this candidate must reside in the Greater Orlando area for monthly meetings and/or other requirements as needed (around 5-10%)
   What You'll Do: 
  
 Data Management : Gather, consolidate, and maintain HR data from multiple sources, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. 
  Report Generation : Create and maintain advanced HR reports, dashboards, and scorecards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. 
  Data Analysis : Analyze HR data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive strategic decision-making in areas such as recruitment, retention, and employee engagement. 
  Data Visualization:  Create visually compelling and easy-to-understand data visualizations and presentations for HR and executive audiences. 
  KPI Tracking : Develop and monitor key HR performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of HR programs and initiatives. 
  Ad-Hoc Analysis : Conduct ad-hoc analyses in response to HR inquiries and provide actionable recommendations. 
  Data Insights : Translate data findings into clear and concise insights that guide HR and organizational strategies. 
  Data Governance : Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and establish data governance best practices within the HR function. 
  Collaboration : Collaborate with HR business partners and IT to understand data needs and requirements, ensuring alignment with business goals. 
  Process Improvement : Identify opportunities to streamline and improve HR processes through data-driven insights and recommendations. 
  Documentation:  Maintain documentation for HR reporting processes, data definitions, and data sources. 
  What's in it For You?: 
  
   To help you make the best decision for your personal growth, it’s important to us to share a glimpse of what we offer our top asset, our people:
  
 
  Competitive base salary 
  Generous 30+ Days Comprehensive Paid Time Off Package inclusive of Paid Time Off, 10 Company Holidays, 2 Floating Holidays, 5 Sick Days, and 2 Volunteer Days 
  Health benefit options with you in mind; 5 affordable medical plan options with rates based on your salary, company paid HSA contribution with eligible HSA plan selection, 2 dental plan options offering orthodontia coverage and 3 cleanings per year, and 2 vision plan options 
  Company match 401(k) plan – 50% up to 6%! 
  Support of your fitness wellness goals! We offer up to 75% off at over 11,000 gyms and fitness centers 
  Opportunity to prioritize your mental health with 24/7 access to licensed therapists 
  Pet benefits & discounts 
  Access to our Employee-led Resource Groups (ERGs) that lend a voice to the variety of demographics represented throughout AssuredPartners 
  What You'll Need: 
  
 Minimum 4 years’ experience designing and managing programs involving workforce data analysis, HR metrics 
  Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field or equivalent relevant experience. 
  Proven experience in HR data analytics and reporting, with a track record of developing and implementing successful data-informed strategies. 
  Proficiency in data analysis tools such as BI Cognos, Excel, SQL, Python, R, or similar platforms. Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik is highly desirable. 
  Solid understanding of HR processes, metrics, and best practices. Experience in HRIS implementation and data integration is a plus. 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to draw meaningful insights from complex data sets. 
  Excellent communication and presentation abilities, with the capacity to convey technical information to non-technical audiences. 
  Project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and handle multiple projects simultaneously. 
  Strategic mindset and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for HR process improvement through data analysis. 
  Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment. 
 
  Physical Requirements:  
 
 Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer. 
  Grow, with us: 
  
   AssuredPartners is committed to embracing diversity, equity and inclusion to create a workplace that welcomes and thrives on the unique experiences, perspectives and contributions of all team members. AssuredPartners is bringing the best people and most diverse talent forward to drive growth, innovate and think bigger!

ba374c0ac3cb3e10.title: Machine Learning Engineer
ba374c0ac3cb3e10.desc:
Job Description 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         Location: 
         
 
         Norfolk,VA,US 
         
 
 
 
         Remote Work: 
         
 
         Yes 
         
 
 
 
         Job Number: 
         
 
         R0179182
         
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         Machine Learning Engineer
           The Opportunity: 
  As a machine learning engineer, you’re excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set, and you’re fascinated by the possibilities presented by IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open new opportunities. As a machine learning engineer at Booz Allen, you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence, we need you to help find the answers in the data. On our team, you’ll use your programming skills and data engineering knowledge to create real-world impact. 
 
  You’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop algorithms and systems and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn sets of disparate data points into objective answers to help clients make informed decisions. Ultimately, you’ll provide a deep understanding of the data, what it all means, and how it can be used. 
 
  Work with us as we use data science for good. 
 
  Join us. The world can’t wait. 
 
  You Have: 
 
  3+ years of experience working in a professional environment 
  Experience with data analytics and data visualization tools, including Qlik, Tableau, or Power BI 
  Experience with scripting languages, including SQL, Python, or R 
  Experience with briefing techniques and methods, and delivering findings to non-technical audiences, including senior military or government leaders 
  Knowledge of operations research techniques, including probability and statistical methods 
  Ability to clean and build analytical data sets or pipelines from existing sources, when data engineering resources aren’t available 
  Ability to obtain a security clearance 
  Bachelor’s degree 
 
 
  Nice If You Have: 
 
  Secret clearance 
  Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Operations Research, Management Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering preferred; Master’s degree in Economics, Operations Research, Management Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering a plus 
 
 
  Clearance: 
  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. 
 
  Create Your Career: 
 
  Grow With Us 
  Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms. 
 
  A Place Where You Belong 
  Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time. 
 
  Support Your Well-Being 
  Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home. 
 
  Your Candidate Journey 
  At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us. 
 
  Compensation 
  At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page. 
  Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $73,000.00 to $166,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.
          
  Work Model  Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely. 
 
  If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility. 
  If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role. 
 
 
  EEO Commitment 
  We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

3c3143d9efec141f.title: Brokerage Ops Specialist
3c3143d9efec141f.desc:
Company Description 
 
 
 
     It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay/Clearpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 47 million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible.
     
  Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.
     
  Check out our locations, benefits, and more at cash.app/careers.
    
 
 
 
 
  Job Description 
 
 
  We've recently introduced Cash App Investing and now you can instantly buy stock in your favorite companies with as little as $1 using our free fractional trading feature! We're looking for a world class talent to join our broker-dealer subsidiary, Cash App Investing LLC. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who has deep experience in brokerage operations. 
  You will: 
 
  This role reports to a brokerage operations accounts lead. 
  Provide subject matter expertise on strategic initiatives related to brokerage functions. 
  Document standard operating procedures and job aids and update as needed. 
  Identify areas for process improvement and work toward implementation with respective teams. 
  Willing to work and get comfortable with ambiguity in a fast paced environment. 
  Works closely with peers to provide support in functional areas of operation and provides feedback 
  Completes daily brokerage operations tasks in best practice with firm written supervisory procedures and operational processes. 
  Reviews and actions accounts in accordance with firm policy and procedure. 
  Collaborates with lead, peers, and cross functional teams to identify areas of opportunity and risks. 
  Performs daily operational processing functions and maintains records in accordance with firms Written Supervisory Procedures. 
  High-level understanding of SEC / FINRA regulations that pertain to the subject matter. 
  Collaborates with engineering, support, and product teams to facilitate improvements and increase efficiency within the current back office structure for the broker-dealer’s risk operation. 
 
 
 
 
 
  Qualifications 
 
 
  You have: 
 
  5+ years of experience in brokerage operations. 
  FINRA Licenses: Series 7 & 63 required. 
  Brokerage operations generalist, you have worked in various functions of a brokerage operations team which may include accounts, risk, fraud, trading, etc. 
  Functional experience with Looker / Tableau or other data analytics tools. 
  Technical experience scaling processes or managing projects. 
  Knowledge and respect for SEC/FINRA regulatory and compliance rules and regulations. 
  Highly organized and detail oriented. 
  Team player and willing to jump in and help others on a regular basis. 
  Someone who thrives in a highly collaborative and fast-paced environment. 
  Well versed in collaborating with peer disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Data Science, Compliance etc 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
  A passion for our mission of economic empowerment through serving the underserved 
 
 
 
 
 
  Additional Information 
 
 
  Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.    Zone A: USD $94,400 - USD $115,400  Zone B: USD $87,800 - USD $107,400  Zone C: USD $80,300 - USD $98,100  Zone D: USD $70,800 - USD $86,600 
 
  To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information. 
  Full-time employee benefits include the following: 
 
  Healthcare coverage (Medical, Vision and Dental insurance) 
  Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account 
  Retirement Plans including company match 
  Employee Stock Purchase Program 
  Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance 
  Paid parental and caregiving leave 
  Paid time off (including 12 paid holidays) 
  Paid sick leave (1 hour per 26 hours worked (max 80 hours per calendar year to the extent legally permissible) for non-exempt employees and covered by our Flexible Time Off policy for exempt employees) 
  Learning and Development resources 
  Paid Life insurance, AD&D, and disability benefits 
  Additional Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources 
 
  These benefits are further detailed in Block's policies. This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans. 
  US and Canada EEOC Statement 
  We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. 
  We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible.  Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our  I+D page . 
  Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis. 
 
 
  Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Company Description
   It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic ecosystem, developing unique financial products, including Afterpay/Clearpay, to provide a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our 47 million monthly active customers. We want to redefine the world’s relationship with money to make it more relatable, instantly available, and universally accessible.    Today, Cash App has thousands of employees working globally across office and remote locations, with a culture geared toward innovation, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Cash App operates. No matter the location, we tailor our experience to ensure our employees are creative, productive, and happy.    Check out our locations, benefits, and more at cash.app/careers. 
 
 
 
 Job Description

We're looking for a world class talent to join our broker-dealer subsidiary, Cash App Investing LLC. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who has deep experience in brokerage operations.

0b984c170e7349b9.title: Senior Actuarial Analyst
0b984c170e7349b9.desc:
About Accolade 
 Accolade (Nasdaq: ACCD) provides millions of people and their families with an exceptional healthcare experience that is personal, data driven and value based to help every person live their healthiest life. Accolade solutions combine virtual primary care, mental health support and expert medical opinion services with intelligent technology and best-in-class care navigation. Accolade’s Personalized Healthcare approach puts humanity back in healthcare by building relationships that connect people and their families to the right care at the right time to improve outcomes, lower costs and deliver consumer satisfaction. Accolade consistently receives consumer satisfaction ratings over 90%. For more information, visit accolade.com. 
 Role overview 
 The  Sr   Actuarial Analyst  is responsible for supporting the reporting and savings calculations for various customers within a Market Segment (i.e. Enterprise, Strategic, Mid-Market, Health Plan, etc). This reporting will showcase Accolade’s value & outcomes and will be communicated to their manager, their peers and other internal partners such as Customer Partnerships or Operations. They will create ad-hoc reporting as directed and analyze data to identify new variances or areas of opportunity. 
 A day in the life… 
 
 Support analytics & reports that produce key metrics, and highlight areas where Accolade creates value and identify new opportunities for value creation. 
 Work with Product Management teams to develop & outline the requirements for reporting needs, support the construction of reports and validate that final reports meet needs and provide guidance on how to use those reports to key partners. 
 Using analytic and technical skills, identify opportunities and design solutions to better automate Actuarial processes or to compare/contrast results across Accolade’s book of business. 
 Support customers with customized analysis, unique to their population or health programs and communicate those findings both internally and externally. 
 Support monthly production analysis of Accolade’s Savings results, including validating financial reconciliation, analyzing results for outlier patterns, and communicating summarized results to internal and external partners. 
 Analyze healthcare spend and utilization patterns to uncover drivers of results with large and small populations. 
 Evaluate the programs provided by Accolade’s partners for the impact they have on cost and utilization. This would include telemedicine, second opinion services, cost transparency, etc. Create reporting and communicate results. 
 
 What we are looking for… 
 
 Bachelor’s Degree in a field such as: Actuarial Science, Risk Management, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field. 
 Associate in Society of Actuaries preferred. 
 3+ years of experience working with analyzing claims and healthcare data. 
 Excellent Excel & PowerPoint skills. 
 Good/Excellent SQL skills. 
 Working knowledge of AWS Redshift. 
 Good written and interpersonal communication skills. 
 Strong technical skills with deep understanding of actuarial concepts and ability to apply them to work product. 
 Independent worker: courage, decision quality, listening, drive for results, customer and client focus, integrity and ability to deal with ambiguity. 
 Consistently demonstrate ability to influence and negotiate with internal partners. 
 The ability to organize, manage and prioritize multiple projects at one time. 
 Inquisitive, analytical, problem-solving in nature. 
 Data-driven, detail-oriented and fact-based; focused on getting the best answer for customers and clients. 
 Hands-on, action-oriented style. 
 Proven ability to roll up your sleeves and make a contribution quickly. 
 A team player capable of working effectively with individuals throughout the organization. 
 
 Hiring Range 
 $90400-$103300 
 Annual 
 Actual compensation packages within that range are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, certifications, and specific location. 
 Benefits 
 
 Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits, including access to Accolade Advocacy, Accolade Care, and Accolade EMO. 
 HDHP medical plan with generous employer contributions towards an HSA 
 401(k) Retirement Plan with matching employer contributions 
 Open Time Off 
 Generous Holiday Schedule + 5 floating holidays 
 18 weeks of paid parental leave 
 Subsidized commuter benefits programs 
 Virtual access to coaching, self-care activities, and video-based therapy and psychiatry through Ginger 
 1 Volunteer days per year 
 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) w/ employee discount 
 
 We strongly encourage you to be vaccinated against COVID-19. 
 What is important to us... 
 Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is: 
 We find joy and purpose in serving others 
 Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons. 
 We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful 
 Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way. 
 We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done 
 Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there. 
 We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare 
 We're curious and act big -- not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time. 
 Accolade is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to advancing an inclusive environment for all qualified applicants and employees. We provide employment opportunities, without regard, to any legally protected status in accordance with applicable laws in the US. We are committed to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience. 
 Accolade, Inc., PlushCare, Inc., and Accolade 2ndMD LLC will never ask you to pay to get a job. Anyone who does this is a scammer. Further, we will never send you a check and ask you to send on part of the money or buy gift cards with it. These are also scams. If you see or lose money to a job scam, report it to the Federal Trade Commission at ReportFraud.ftc.gov. You can also report it to your state attorney general. 
 To review our policy around data use, visit our Accolade Privacy Policy Page. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 
 Accolade 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Pay: $90,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance 
 Life insurance 
 Paid time off 
 Tuition reimbursement 
 Vision insurance 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 Monday to Friday 
 
 Supplemental pay types: 
 
 Bonus opportunities 
 
 Work Location: Remote

3ea48f57ba1c7105.title: Quality Analytics Manager (Remote Option Available)
3ea48f57ba1c7105.desc:
Competitive Compensation & Benefits Package! 
  Position eligible for – 
 
  Annual incentive bonus plan 
  Medical, dental, and vision insurance with low deductible/low cost health plan 
  Generous vacation and sick time accrual 
  12 paid holidays 
  State Retirement (pension plan) 
  401(k) Plan with employer match 
  Company paid life and disability insurance 
  Wellness Programs 
 
  See attachment for additional details. 
 
  Office  Location:  Flexible for any of our office locations; Remote option available 
  Projected Hiring Range:  Depending on Experience 
  Closing Date:   Open Until Filled 
 
  Primary Purpose of Position: 
  As the  Quality Analytics Manager  you will lead the Quality Analytics Team delivering advanced analytic insights, custom and self-service BI reporting to the enterprise. 
 
  We are seeking a talented leader who will develop a high-performing team that executes predictive analytics, data modeling and visualization, and enterprise-wide reporting, using complex, high-volume, structured and unstructured datasets. The position reports to the Sr. Manager or Quality Analytics. 
 
  The Quality Analytics Manager works closely with business and clinical departments to deliver tools, analysis, and reports. 
 
  Role and Responsibilities: 
 
  Develop and direct an effective team that leads advanced analytics, data science, enterprise-level dashboards, and performance monitoring. 
  Provide thought leadership and operational support for emerging and existing capabilities, develop best practices, and drive the process of creative thinking and solutions while directing the change and adoption of new processes and technologies. 
  Establish the development, adoption, and adherence of tool best practices across the organization, including the development and sharing of tool utilization, quality, and continuous improvement plans. 
  Lead and grow teams that will provide a consistent pattern of delivery of customer-centered improvements and innovation while guiding the professional and technical development of direct reports. 
  Collaborate with peers to set peer review, quality assurance, high-quality service, consultation, and products to customers by understanding their business needs and developing a seamless transition of work processes across business and clinical departments. Maintain knowledge of competing projects and programs across departments and outside areas of accountability. 
  Continually seek and consider innovative solutions to business problems and customer needs and apply as relevant in support of the organization's mission, culture, and philosophy. 
 
 
  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
 
  Excellent analytical, strategic planning, quality management and project management skills 
  Strong organizational and time management skills required to schedule, meet and maintain critical deadlines and routine reporting demands 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  Excellent computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office products 
  Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with leadership, staff, stakeholders, state and federal officials 
  Ability to effectively plan, organize, direct, coordinate and evaluate business operations including a broad range of diverse functions 
  Ability to exercise sound judgment, make effective decisions and resolve problems involving complex and sensitive areas 
  Ability to recognize and sensitively manage cultural diversity issues and interactions with various and diverse members of staff and the community 
  Ability to work collaboratively and effectively to develop processes and protocols, to analyze data and solve problems 
 
 
  Education/Experience Required: 
 
  Bachelors' degree in business, finance, computer science, information technology, or a related area or four years of equivalent work experience. (Required) 
  Five years' experience leading analytic and reporting teams, including five years of experience planning, implementing and deploying internal business systems. (Required) 
  Five years of people management/leadership experience. (Required) 
  Five years of experience working with health plan data analytic & reporting systems (Required) 
  An aptitude top partner effectively with technical departments in the development and maintenance of business systems. (Required) 
 
 
  Other requirement: 
 
  Must live in North Carolina or within 40 miles of the NC border 
 
 
  Education/Experience Preferred: 
 
  Experience participating with senior management and cross-functional teams to establish strategic plans and objectives. (Preferred) 
  Experience working in an automated, transaction-based environment. (Preferred) 
  Solid technical knowledge of business systems and reporting tools. (Preferred)

45aa603f6f50de45.title: Lead Credit Risk Analyst
45aa603f6f50de45.desc:
At Braviant, we believe in hiring great talent and offering them the flexibility to achieve great results unbounded by geography. Braviant is offering a fully remote option for anyone in the U.S. who wants to join our team and help us grow. We also have an office space in the heart of downtown Chicago for those who prefer to get out of the house and collaborate with some colleagues in person.
  
 
 
  Who we are: 
 
 
   Braviant is a leading provider of tech-enabled credit products that combines breakthrough technology and cutting-edge machine learning to transform how people access credit online. Our next-generation approach to lending reduces credit barriers and creates a Path to Prime to help millions of underbanked consumers build credit history, reduce their cost of borrowing, and take control of their personal finances. Braviant has been named multiple times to the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies and has been recognized as a Best Place to Work by Crain’s Chicago, BuiltIn Chicago and American Banker.
  
 
 
  The Role: 
 
 
   Our Analytics team is looking for a Lead Credit Risk Analyst to drive the credit and marketing strategies for our Consumer Lending Products. This role will be instrumental in initiating, analyzing, implementing and monitoring new analytics strategies to drive profitable growth. We are seeking a lead analyst with strong technical and critical thinking skills who enjoys solving complex business problems through developing analytical insights. This is a fast-paced and constantly evolving role with significant impact on the business.
  
 What you'll be doing: 
 
  Monitor both digital leads and portfolio marketing channel performance through appropriate daily, weekly, and monthly reporting, including the development of any new reporting based on gaps or new product offerings 
  Create strategies for implementation of predictive models such as targeting criteria for Lead provider offers, approve vs. decline cutoffs, and verification requirements for various customer segments 
  For existing customers, customize risk-based loan offer terms (approval amount, pricing, and term) based on conversion and defaults; develop retention strategies and improve lifetime customer value 
  Collaborate with the Data Science team to define requirements and use-cases for solutions that can rank order customers by attributes such as likelihood to default, accept an offer, and overall profitability 
  Analyze and identify opportunities to further the execution of our disciplined growth strategy that balances short-term vs. long-term profitability and appropriately mitigate credit risk 
  Design multivariate tests to ensure continuous optimization of our Leads and Portfolio marketing strategies 
  Collaborate with the Product team to document the requirements for any new strategies or pricing recommendations to take an idea from conception through deployment and monitoring 
 
  What you'll bring: 
 
  5+ years of relevant work experience in an analytical role 
  Strong data analysis skills using SQL, Python and Excel with pivot tables. 
  Bachelor’s Degree in an analytical field of study: mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc. 
  Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills and comfort with making data-driven decisions 
  Comfortable with ambiguity and possess a ‘figure it out & get it done’ mentality 
  Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities with a sense of urgency 
  Great verbal and writing communication skills 
  Highly self-motivated in a fully remote working environment 
 
  What makes you stand out: 
 
  Prior experience working in online consumer lending industry 
  Master’s degree in an analytical field of study 
  Deep understanding of statistics & data science 
 
 
  What it's like to work here: 
 
 
   We're about achieving results while having fun along the way. We believe in solving problems together and building on each other’s ideas. Our teams are comprised of smart, curious individuals and we encourage everyone to think like an owner, take initiative and drive their careers. Our broad roles provide tremendous opportunities for individuals to acquire new skills, gain exposure to all areas of the business, and quickly see their impact at Braviant. Want to learn more? Check us out on Glassdoor, BuiltIn and our Newsroom

e3cd4aba952ade1c.title: Solution Architect (FT)
e3cd4aba952ade1c.desc:
Solution Architect 
 
 (Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply) 
 
 
 Role Overview 
  BDR Solutions, LLC is seeking a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team.
  
 
  The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. 
  This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. 
  The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager. 
 
 
  Responsibilities: 
 
 
  Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into the written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations. 
  Apply analytics, problem-solving, and communication skills to identify best-fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposals to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets. 
  Architect and design innovative, cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements. 
  Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility. 
  Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and business and technical solutions standards. 
  Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients. 
  Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies. 
  Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal. 
  Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings. 
  Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs 
  Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments. 
  Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meeting, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews. 
  Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes. 
  Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner. 
  Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development. 
 
 
  Required Minimum Qualifications 
 
 
  Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.). 
  In-depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation 
  Experience leading technical discussions including the ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership

  High level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint). 
  Proven excellent oral and written communication. 
 
 
  Ideal Experience: 
 
 
  Proven experience working in a highly fast-paced environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3. 
  Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)

   In addition, U.S. citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.

325eea92372c07ee.title: People Analytics Senior Research Consultant
325eea92372c07ee.desc:
The Coca-Cola Company's mission is to refresh the world and make a difference. In support of this mission, we are looking to grow our People Analytics team, to help us execute data analyses and produce meaningful insights in support of our internal clients and stakeholders. This role reports to the Director of People Analytics in the People Insights, Culture, and Strategy, center of excellence. 
 
  In this role you will focus on providing subject matter expertise and analytics consultation to a variety of stakeholders, anchoring to the strategic imperatives of the Chief People Office, and will be expected to execute targeted research related to how HR will enable the long-term objectives of the business. You will also work to identify research/insights necessary to inform future strategy. Key areas of work include (but are not limited to): creating measures to assess organizational health across the enterprise, identifying links between people metrics and critical business outcomes using data and statistics, informing people-related decisions with well-designed research, supporting workforce planning efforts. This role will also be responsible for maintaining a lens on external research and metrics, analytics trends, and benchmarking to inform continued innovation and best practices within the People Analytics team. The successful candidate will have a strong research and data analysis acumen, strong consulting skills, and an understanding of how to package insights with storytelling for stakeholders. 
 
  Location:  Atlanta, GA (Global HQ) or Remote (U.S.-based) 
 
  What You’ll Do for Us: 
 
  Develop project/research plans to address business questions or objectives, including partnering with others to execute the appropriate analyses and communicate findings to key partners. 
  Deliver end-to-end people analytics projects; develop a project plan to address objectives, execute statistical analyses that are appropriate for answering the business question, articulate insights and implications from the data/analyses, and leverage storytelling to influence and communicate insights to key partners, HR leaders, and/or other strategic decision-makers. 
  Conduct advanced statistical analyses to answer strategic questions in the areas of talent development, employee engagement, performance management, assessments, etc. 
  Draw connections between various data sources and translate them into an integrated story/solution to elevate people decisions. Build deliverables to capture stakeholder attention and turn insights into action. 
  Partner with others in People Analytics to proactively identify business and client needs/desires beyond the face value of initial requests; proactively identify opportunities that can drive greater organizational impact through insights supported by data. 
  Bring new thinking and innovative workforce insight best practices, based on professional experiences and from external sources. 
  Build and maintain consulting skills through training courses, mentoring/coaching, and interactions with clients. 
 
 
  Qualifications & Requirements: 
 
  BA/BS degree required, MA/MS/PhD preferred, in Industrial-Organizational Psychology, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Labor Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related field with a focus on advanced statistical analysis and research. 
  3-5 years in a relevant role with applied research and/or consulting experience (e.g., Organizational Effectiveness, HR Metrics/Analytics, Data Science, Talent Analytics, Market Research). 
  Experience performing advanced analytics/conducting applied research in an applied setting. 
  Consultative capabilities and experience, particularly in managing stakeholder expectations and interpreting client needs. 
  Intermediate abilities in statistical techniques (e.g., correlation, regression, ANOVA), research design, psychometrics. 
  Familiarity with survey item development, scale development, survey analysis methodologies, and interpretation. 
  Proficient in the use of statistical software (R/RStudio, SPSS) and Microsoft Office tools; familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) and HR systems (e.g., Workday). 
  Strong communication/presentation skills, both written and verbal; can translate complex analyses into “plain language”. 
  Ability to draw critical insights from metrics/data and communicate through a client-centric lens, including identifying recommendations based on data. 
 
 
  Base Salary:  $128,000 - $153,000 – Base pay offered may vary depending on geography, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, depending on the position, are offered. 
  Skills:  Consulting; Survey Development; Storytelling; Statistical Analysis; People Analytics; Data Analysis
   Our Purpose and Growth Culture:  We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.    We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

d3d034b5c2bfa543.title: PKPD Modeling & Simulation Scientist
d3d034b5c2bfa543.desc:
We are always looking for team members who share our vision of using information in a quantitative way to develop therapies that defeat disease. We are obsessed with learning and we have a passion to participate in the growth of our scientific disciplines. We believe that as we learn and grow, we are responsible to share openly with the community. 
 Our Mission:  At Metrum Research Group, we are driven to improve health and defeat disease, particularly where there are unmet needs. We provide innovative solutions at the intersection of data, science, and technology to generate key insights that impact biomedical decision-making. 
 If you share our passions, we would love to hear from you! 
 Metrum Research Group offers a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package. 
 MetrumRG is seeking a talented  PKPD Modeling and Simulation Scientist  with a  minimum of 3 years of experience  to join our team. We know that the key to our company's success is the happiness and well-being of our team. Our goal is to provide a work-life that is engaging, rewarding, and fun. 
 
 Qualified individuals will contribute to fighting diseases through strategic collaborations with our customers in biomedical research, development, and post-marketing programs for new drugs, biologics, devices, and diagnostics. M&S scientists will be expected to develop and implement quantitative, data-driven pharmacometric strategies for knowledge integration and decision-making to guide customer drug development programs. Scientists will also contribute to internal and external reporting and publication of results and will be expected to continue to develop skills and knowledge in biomedical modeling and simulation. 
 
 Responsibilities   
 
 Lead interactions with biomedical industry collaborators 
  Develop strategies and conduct modeling and simulation to support biomedical decision making 
  Develop population pharmacokinetic (PK), pharmacodynamic (PD), exposure-response, disease progression, and/or systems pharmacology models 
  Apply models to support decision-making through Monte-Carlo simulation 
  Perform model-based meta-analysis of therapeutic area summary-level data 
  Perform quality control of modeling and simulation analyses 
  Prepare technical reports, manuscripts, and presentations 
 
 Requirements and Skills   
 
 Required: Strong proficiency with a scriptable modeling and simulation language (e.g. R, MatLab, Python) 
  Desirable: Advanced expertise with domain-specific modeling software (e.g. NONMEM, ADAPT, Monolix) and Bayesian modeling software (e.g. Stan, JAGS, OpenBUGS) 
  Desirable: Experience with Shiny, Markdown, LaTeX, unix/Linux, subversion, git 
  Desirable: A strong understanding of statistical analysis of longitudinal, landmark and repeated-measures, continuous or categorical data, within a multi-level hierarchy 
 
 Education and Experience   
 
 Required: M.S. or Ph.D. Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Pharmacometrics, Pharmacokinetics, Bioinformatics, Chemical or Biomedical Engineering, or related quantitative field 
  Required: Minimum three-year experience PKPD modeling and simulation, post-graduate degree 
  Desirable: Direct experience with quantitative analytics in biomedical applications 
  Desirable: Basic understanding of drug, biologic, device, or diagnostic research and development process 
 
 Physical Demands 
 
 The job frequently requires working at a computer terminal, standing or sitting, and the ability to operate a computer with proficiency. 
 Work Environment 
 The work environment is quiet with no adverse conditions. 
 Metrum Research Group participates in E-verify. 
 
 Metrum Research Group is an equal-opportunity employer 
 .

08b2f819c4b57628.title: Director of Client Services
08b2f819c4b57628.desc:
Director of Client Services 
 
  Eastport Analytics is looking to fill a newly created role for a Director of Client Services. This individual enjoys hands on management, building processes, and engaging with clients. We are looking for a successful leader who enjoys the opportunity to make an impactful difference in a small established thriving company. You will play a central role in the firm’s next chapter of growth and success.
   
  As a Director, you will oversee Eastport’s client program managers, subject matter experts, analysts, and technical staff engaged in developing and delivering to our client accounts. You will help our client account managers and technical teams to be successful in working collaboratively to assess client needs, deliver insights, and crystallize solutions.
  
 
 
 Here is what you will be doing: 
 
 
 Serve as the primary manager for building and maintaining relationships while delivering insights to clients. 
 Lead the client account managers in effectively leveraging available technology and other resources to address client needs. Responsible for the development, growth, and success of the client account managers. Evaluate skills and develop staff in client engagement management and account development. 
 Collaborate with senior engineering leadership on leveraging technical staff to translate client needs into delivered capabilities. Oversee the delivery team to develop, execute, and implement project milestones. 
 Determine appropriate analytics objectives, scope and methodology and actively participate in decision making with client's management to understand the broader impact of current decisions & possible solutions. Responsible for proposal development and may present proposals to clients. 
 
 
 
 Direct engagement with clients responding to requests, providing regular status updates, ensuring delivery and mission impact. 
 Build and execute client service strategies to optimize internal support and increase efficiencies to enable client teams to provide the best client experience. 
 Develop and execute an account development plan which includes networking, new client development and client expansion activities. 
 
 Supervisory responsibilities: 
 
 
 Direct and manage the day-to-day activities of the client facing and technical team. 
 Oversee staffing, skill/professional development, and retention. 
 Provides constructive and timely performance evaluations for the front line leadership team. 
 
 
 
 As an ideal candidate, you will have: 
 
 
 Hands on experience with end-to-end data and analytics insights delivery. 
 Thorough business understanding of data science applications and the ability to communicate with key decision makers and stakeholders. 
 Proven history working with advanced analytic technologies-data management/exploitation, visualization, reporting and the like. 
 
 
 
 
 To qualify for the role, you will have: 
 
 
 Demonstrated ability to work with clients on federal government contracts including how to identify new opportunities, procure and manage the capture proposal development efforts. Highly desirable, experience in federal law enforcement agencies-Treasury or Justice department, specifically IRS and DOJ. 
 Ten plus years of manager-level experience including demonstrated ability to coach and mentor in account development and client engagement. 
 Fifteen plus years of professional related experience, ideally in Consulting or IT Services managing IT projects of different sizes valued at $3M-$10M. 
 Communication skills with the ability to listen and understand the questions and develop and deliver clear insights. 
 Experience in leading teams while tackling a high level of uncertainty, multiple stakeholders & tight timelines. 
 Experience working with IT implementation programs (not necessarily the technical approach but rather how to procure and manage). 
 Bachelor’s degree in related field and preferably Masters in related field or equivalent experience. 
 Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance which requires either US Citizenship or Legal Permanent Resident Status (LPR). 
 
 
 
 
 About Eastport 
  Federal law enforcement and compliance professionals face constantly evolving challenges, and are inundated with data about these challenges. At Eastport, we work closely with clients to deliver the insights needed to understand these behaviors, so our clients can focus on driving compliance and building better cases. Our talented technical staff of analysts, engineers, data scientists, architects, and consultants work closely with clients to define the analytics required; improve the breadth, depth, and fidelity of information available; deliver actual insights; and build insight delivery into the client business processes.
  
 
  Eastport Analytics is an established small thriving MD based company who has 21+ years of success. We are looking for an individual who can make an impact in taking us to the next chapter of success. Check us out at www.EastportAnalytics.com. Come join our team! We offer competitive compensation with a full benefits package including full medical, dental, and vision health insurance, life, short and long-term disability, 401k program, flexible spending account, radical flex time and generous leave, quarterly discretionary performance-based bonus program, professional development opportunities, employee assistance program, fun quarterly events, and a work-life balance culture. The compensation for this role will include an incentive bonus.
   
  Eastport Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to an individual’s race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, religion, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as an individual with a disability. Reasonable Accommodations will be made to individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.
