d06b15047b265ae8.title: Client Engagement Manager (Remote based in US Central or Western)
d06b15047b265ae8.desc:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way. As a member of our team, you can too. 
  We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components:  Client. Team. Win. Innovate. 
 
 
   We actively look for prospects who:
   
 
 Are passionate about client success. 
 Enjoy collaborating with others. 
 Strive to exceed expectations. 
 Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions. 
 
 
 
  Job Description: 
 
  We are seeking a  Client Engagement Manager (Remote based in US Central or Western)  at  Pitney Bowes. 
 
  The wage range for this position is $87,000 - $109,000, with the actual pay dependent on your skills and experience as they relate to the job requirements and the location where you will be performing the job. This role is eligible for a quarterly bonus. 
 
  Summary of Position  
 As a Client Engagement Manager, you will function as a Trusted Advisor to our mid-market customers, responsible for ensuring their success. In this role, you will be responsible for retaining and growing our client base with a focus on Ecommerce Delivery, Returns, and Fulfillment. The role will have close direct interaction with our clients’ businesses, operations, and product leaders as well as Pitney Bowes’ internal teams who will support you in defining solutions and delivering on initiatives to realize growth, revenue, and cost savings. Individuals should have a consistent track record of consultative sales, the ability to solve complex problems, a strong understanding of e-commerce and shipping landscape, and a willingness to embrace a fast-paced, dynamic logistics and technology company. 
 
  What You will Do: 
 
  Build and nurture relationships across accounts to solidify our partnership and commitment to the customer while penetrating the account deeper. 
  Ensure that customers derive maximum value from their investment with Pitney Bowes, identify new opportunities, and collaborate with other Pitney Bowes teams to optimize client experience and performance. 
  Monitor customer operational performance and health indicators. Proactively identify issues, collaborate with other teams, and drive open issues to resolution. 
  Monitor renewal dates and growth opportunities and translate them into strategies for success. 
  Work collaboratively with Sales and Pitney Bowes executives, effectively network within accounts to help customers achieve their objectives. 
  Identify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals, build and execute risk mitigation plans or escalate as needed. 
 
 
  Responsibilities 
 
  Increase value, retention, customer satisfaction, and expansion of Pitney Bowes’ footprint. 
  Attain client revenue and growth targets. Work closely with clients and Pitney Bowes teams on growth and operational initiatives to ensure accurate and timely execution. 
  Maintains up-to-date knowledge of client strategies, marketplaces, shipping and e-commerce trends, and competitive landscape. 
  Develop deep end-to-end knowledge of Pitney Bowes network, physical, and digital solutions. 
  Liaison between client and internal cross-functional teams to ensure timely and successful delivery of solutions and services to meet client needs. 
 
 
  Background 
 
  Solid background in the e-commerce ecosystem and specifically the post-purchase experience 
  5+ years of work experience in a client-facing role focused on the mid-to-enterprise level merchant base with proven track record managing. 
  Bachelor of Arts / Bachelor of Science or equivalent 
 
 
  Navigate customer organizational structures to identify and build relationships with executives and stakeholders. 
  Ability to prioritize, multitask, and perform effectively in a highly dynamic work environment. 
  Effective at leading and facilitating executive meetings. 
  Proficient at being prescriptive and driving action-oriented meetings. 
  Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to navigate conflict and foster honest dialog. 
  Ability to quickly grasp and distinctly explain technological and business concepts. 
  Analytical skills with the ability to distill information from multiple sources, analyze and present in meaningful ways to the business for action. 
  Experience in managing and negotiating contracts. 
  High tolerance for change, the ability to be effective in fast-paced business environment, and an aptitude for managing multiple projects and priorities and connecting the dots between them. 
 
 
  Our Team: 
  Ecommerce logistics. Only easier. Pitney Bowes Global Ecommerce is our fastest growing business segment. Our focus on the consumer and shipper experience - driven by innovative technology and consultative insights - has uniquely positioned us as the trusted partner for ecommerce brands and shippers. 
 
  Our best-in-class services include ecommerce fulfillment, delivery (domestic and cross-border), and returns that help merchants drive conversions, customer satisfaction and lasting loyalty. These solutions build better order experiences through data science-based innovation and consultative support that help make clients’ jobs easier. Ranked by Internet Retailer as a Top Carrier, Top Fulfillment Service Provider, and the #1 International Ecommerce Provider, we are the preferred ecommerce logistics partner for over eight hundred brands and shippers. 
 
  We will: 
 
 
 Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career 
 Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas 
 Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization 
 Offer comprehensive benefits globally   (PB Live Well) 
 
 
  Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace. 
  Women/Men/Veterans/Individuals  with Disabilities/LGBTQ+   are encouraged to apply. 
  All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

90027aa3ff4ec46c.title: Associate Director, MarTech Product Manager - Global Web
90027aa3ff4ec46c.desc:
At Alcon, we are driven by the meaningful work we do to help people see brilliantly. We innovate boldly, champion progress, and act with speed as the global leader in eye care. Here, you’ll be recognized for your commitment and contributions and see your career like never before. Together, we go above and beyond to make an impact in the lives of our patients and customers. We foster an inclusive culture and are looking for diverse, talented people to join Alcon.
  
 
 
   Alcon is looking for an Associate Director – MarTech Product Manager - Global Web, reporting to the Senior Director, Digital Marketing Technologies, who will drive the strategy, planning, and execution of the next generation of Alcon’s global marketing web technology stack, delivering capabilities to enable personalized and detailed experiences for our prospects and customers at every touchpoint. This role will be instrumental in leading cross-functional teams to develop and implement an extensible and data-driven approach to our web and omni-channel orchestration and personalization capabilities. This is a highly technical product manager and innovative problem solver who will partner across engineering, architecture, data science, and marketing partners to solve sophisticated business and customer needs and shape global web transformation through a scalable platform powered by data and Intelligence.
  
 
 
   In this role, a typical day will include:
  
 
   Essential Job Functions / Accountabilities:
  
 
  Partner with marketing leadership and multiple cross-functional teams to create and implement the unified and forward-thinking web capability blueprint positioning us as a leader for our healthcare providers and consumers 
  Develop requirements for designs system, modules, and templates for a variety of segments and audiences using quantitative and qualitative data to advise hypotheses and recommendations 
  Collaborate across the technology and partner organizations to create and regularly refine product vision, strategy, and roadmaps to accelerate capability maturity 
  Coordinate projects throughout the lifecycle, from planning through technical and creative dependencies, production, QA, launch, and post-launch analysis 
  Champion a customer-centric approach to deliver exceptional user experiences and enhance value 
  Lead cross-functional scrum team to prioritize and complete product roadmaps and initiatives 
  Create a network throughout the organization to effectively communicate and align on priorities, remove friction, and increase decision making velocity 
  Be bold and evangelize web capability, drive consensus, and champion increased velocity and path to value 
  Establish and continuously measure web product(s) critical metrics, gauge impact and advise product strategy 
  Develop and optimize marketing operations frameworks and drive product adoption using well-crafted trainings and playbooks 
  Establish and continuously improve a community of practice for the web product and platform management; coach and mentor team-members 
  Drive a high-performance culture through thorough product management craft, bold vision, effective internal and external partnerships, and effective delivery 
 
 
 
   What You'll Bring To Alcon:
  
 
   Key Requirements/Minimum Qualifications:
  
 
  Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school +15 yrs; Assoc.+11 yrs; M.S.+4 yrs; PhD+3 yrs) 
  The ability to fluently read, write, understand, and communicate in English. 
  7 years of related experience 
  5 Years of Proven Leadership 
  7+ years of experience in web product management, marketing, e-commerce or similar role 
  Deep understanding of web technologies across content management (Acquia/Drupal/Site Studio, Adobe Experience Manager, Headless CMS) web analytics (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Amplitude, Quantum Metric), attribution/tracking (Kochava, Oktopost, etc.) experimentation & personalization (Optimizely, Movable Ink, Acoustic, etc.), and digital asset management (Widen, Viva, Canto, etc.) 
  Expertise in SEO and SEM standard methodologies 
  Understanding of technical SEO including sitemaps, meta tags, JavaScript indexing, linking, redirects, keyword research, etc 
  Broad leadership experience in MarTech product and platform management, driving large scale growth initiatives and digital transformation specializing in global web capabilities 
  Strong ability to develop and champion a product vision, strategy, and roadmap for a product area in support of customer needs and business goals 
  Confirmed experience in building web platform capabilities to support sophisticated personalized customer experiences 
  Advanced thinking in the application of AI/Gen AI in the marketing domain 
  Confirmed leadership and communication skills, the ability to influence and inspire change in a matrixed globally diverse environment 
  A reputation for being an impactful, creative problem solver with a passion for innovation and a track record for delivering high quality and timely results 
  A high degree of fluency in technology and data and the architecture of an integrated CX ecosystem 
  Understanding of marketing and performance marketing principles and strategies 
  Deep knowledge of how marketers leverage data and intelligence to power highly relevant digital experiences and hands on experience in the web platform capabilities to enable it 
  Skilled in evaluating the competitive landscape, identifying compelling solutions, analyzing technologies, and assessing the importance of emerging platforms and tools 
  5+ years of people management experience with a track record of mentoring and developing impactful teams. Support all aspects of IT career and capability development to meet the needs of Alcon, including attraction, retention and development of diverse technical talent, in the organization. Ensure robust career development, performance management, and succession planning 
  Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills; ability to craft cases, influence and communicate the vision and motivate people at every level 
 
 
 
   Preferred qualifications:
  
 
  Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, engineering, or equivalent 
  7+ years of product management experience with technically complex, platform products operating at significant scale and solve complex business challenges, with a focus on web 
  7+ years designing and delivering premier orchestration and channel activation products that solve complex organizational challenges 
 
 
 
   How You Can Thrive At Alcon:
  
 
  Benefit from a growing, innovative environment. 
  Sharpen your current skills and gain exposure within different areas of the business. 
  Focused and strategic growth and development opportunities. 
  Join Alcon’s mission to provide outstanding, innovative products and solutions to improve sight and improve lives! 
  Work hours: Standard Hours, Monday - Friday (On-site or Remote) 
  Travel Requirements: 5% 
  Relocation assistance: Yes 
  Sponsorship available: Yes 
 
 
 
   #li-dni
  
 
 
   Alcon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Alcon takes pride in maintaining a diverse environment and our policies are not to discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Alcon is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please send an email to alcon.recruitment@alcon.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

edc37bad2120e1ee.title: Senior Director, Clinical Project Management
edc37bad2120e1ee.desc:
Job Overview  Provide senior oversight to Project Lead Teams or corporate initiatives for project productivity, delivery and quality resulting in strong financial performance and customer satisfaction. Work with teams to focus on leveraging deep therapeutic expertise and IQVIA solutions to drive operational excellence and strategic leadership with our customers. Direct and manage an assigned team of Project Lead managers and leaders who lead teams or support studies or programs to make sure quality, time and budget deliverables are met to the Sponsor’s satisfaction and in accordance with SOPs, policies and practices. Ensure employees are trained and individual development is aligned and in place to meet project and organizational needs. Attract, develop and retain talent. 
 
   Essential Functions
   
 
 Manage staff in accordance with organization’s policies and applicable regulations. Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work appraising performance and guiding professional development rewarding and disciplining employees addressing employee relations issues and resolving problems. Approve actions on human resources matters. 
 Work with individual staff to make sure all study management and project deliverables are completed as per the contract, to achieve quality deliverables on time and within budget and in accordance with SOPs, policies and practices. As their first point of contact, provide effective and timely consultation/guidance to employees on issue resolution. 
 Coach and mentor employees around project planning, project review, risk management and problem solving to ensure global alignment of work practices across the team through the adoption and use of all process and technology tools and improvements by employees. 
 Obtain and provide regular feedback to employees from other project team members and key stakeholders to assist in personal and professional development. May attend project team meeting in order to support development needs. Identify skill and competency gaps at the individual level and work to craft development plans that will close the gaps. 
 Ensure direct reports demonstrate working knowledge of EAC, baseline and change control in terms of scope, budget, schedule and risk/ issue management. 
 Train the Project Lead management team on process and procedures. Ensure required trainings are completed on time. 
 Complete and discuss the Project Lead competency framework with each direct report. 
 Actively engaged with the review of project performance dashboard for tracked information. Follow up with direct reports to ensure system and metrics compliance. 
 Review metrics and ensure required updates are made in IQVIA systems to ensure accurate and timely reporting is available to senior management. 
 Proactively manage risks linked to resourcing, project and/or individual needs with other management and leadership team members to manage study issues and obstacles. 
 Work with individual staff to identify any quality issues within the study and provide coaching on resolution of issues, including implementation of corrective and preventative action plans and escalation. 
 Provide technical expertise and/or clinical project management experience to assigned staff for training and process improvement efforts. 
 Lead and/or actively participate in corporate initiatives 
 Act as a departmental cross-functional liaison and/or change agent 
 Provide technical expertise and project management experience. 
 Provide consultation to clients on drug development process, strategy, and plans as needed. 
 Act as a Project Management liaison with other groups within IQVIA. 
 
 
 
   Qualifications
   
 
 Bachelor's Degree Life sciences or related field Req 
 Requires broad management knowledge to lead cross-regional teams, and well as the ability to influence others outside of own job area regarding policies, procedures, and goals. Req And 
 Requires 15 years of clinical research experience including 9 years of leadership experience, multi-regional and global focus. Req Or 
 Equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Req Or 
 Knowledge of clinical trials - In depth and skill in applying applicable clinical research regulatory requirements i.e. Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines. Strong understanding of the Clinical Research industry and the relevant environments in which it operates. 
 People Management - Proven ability to manage a team and work through others in a global environment to deliver results to the appropriate quality and timeline metrics. Provides others with a clear direction delegates work appropriately and fairly, motivates and empowers others, monitors/manages performance and provides feedback and coaching; recruits, develops and retains staff of a high caliber.; 
  Effective mentoring and training skills, fostering learning and knowledge sharing with colleagues.
    Effective team-management skills.
   
 
 Collaboration - Ability to work across geographies displaying high awareness and understanding of cultural differences, as well as establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients. 
 Leadership - Ability to manage competing priorities. 
  Excellent customer service skills and demonstrated ability to understand customer needs, have difficult conversations with internal stakeholders and customers as well as negotiate solutions.
    Strong ability to balance operational and strategic priorities.
    Knowledge of financial tracking and accounting methods and skill in applying them.
    Excellent judgment and decision-making skills.
   
 
 Organization - Demonstrated learning agility and openness to learning and keeping own knowledge and skill set current and evolving. 
  Excellent organization and problems-solving skills.
    Strong presentation skills.
    Strong understanding of other IQVIA functions.
   
 
 Communication - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including good command of English language. 
  Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers and clients.
   
 
 Results Oriented - Demonstrated ability to deliver results to the appropriate quality and timeline metrics. 
 IT Skills - Strong software and computer skills, including MS Office applications. 
 IQVIA Core Competencies - Strong ability to demonstrate all IQVIA competencies (Client Focus, Collaboration, Communication, Innovation, Ownership). 
 
 
 
  IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com 
 
  We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe 
 
  As the COVID-19 virus continues to evolve, IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status

237a05a115f597d0.title: Engineering Manager - Scrum Master and Release Management
237a05a115f597d0.desc:
Engineering Manager -   Scrum Master and Release Management 
  Remote or Redwood City, CA – Full Time 
  About AutoGrid Systems 
  At AutoGrid, you will join a team helping to accelerate the world’s transition to a clean, affordable and reliable energy system. We’re a growing and award-winning clean-technology company driving the fundamental transformation of the electrical grid into a distributed, decarbonized and digitized network of connected assets. You will collaborate with a team of world-class software, data and energy experts working at the forefront of advanced data science, artificial intelligence, machine learning and high-performance computing. With more than 3,000 megawatts of flexible capacity under contract with energy companies around the globe, our solutions give you an opportunity to make a real-world impact. If you are passionate about using technology to improve society and love a fun, fast-paced work culture with opportunities for continuous learning and advancement, you will love AutoGrid. 
  We continuously create an inclusive environment and welcome people from all walks of life. We are empowered to do our best and innovate, while living our unique life and work. Together, we dare to disrupt and turn our bold ideas into reality. 
  Description 
  The Engineering team is looking for an experienced leader to own and improve the team’s Agile ceremonies, collaboration and code release process. 
  Responsibilities 
  Engineering Release Management:  Oversees, organizes and continually improves the Software Development Engineering team internal release processes. Owns, organizes, and improves process for tracking engineering releases separately from external product releases with increasing automation. Creates ongoing visibility into code ready for production environments from multiple teams. Works with sprint teams to understand, highlight and communicate cross-team dependencies for releases, then highlights, communicates and works to mitigate associated risks. Works with Product and Project teams with ongoing collaborative process for their planning of releasing new features to clients. 
  Agile Process and Ceremonies:   For multiple teams working on complex deliverables: schedules, facilitates and reports agreed upon scrum ceremonies, including Refinement, Sprint Planning, Stand Ups, Demos, Sprint or PI Reviews, and Retrospectives. Assist Product Managers with backlog management and Team Leads with technicalstories/subtasks. Facilitates story estimation and feature development through encouraging small, iterative work, and value delivery. Facilitates the team in successful completion of agreed upon commitments through communication including rapid impediment identification, removal, and/or escalation. Ensures Scrum events are successful, consistent, and consistently provides high value across the Engineering organization. 
  Tracking and Reporting : Uses reporting as a tool to assist in inspecting and adapting with the team sprint over sprint. Introduces new metrics and analysis to the team to continuously improve performance and delivery. Enables helpful reporting like velocity and roadmaps by teaching and encouraging teams in best practices for estimating effort and time, effectively grouping and tagging work for reporting and highlighting improvement opportunities from reviewing iterations. 
  Agile Practices:  Supports multiple Agile teams with implementing effective Agile disciplinary practices. Encourages transparency and team self-organization as appropriate within the process, protects sprint boundaries as appropriate for establishing and maintaining velocity of high-quality work. Encourages adoption of additional ceremonies to improve adherence to Agile practices using inspect and adapt approach with the team. Coach the team to influence adherence and improvement of Agile rituals and practices. Ensures team process evolves within organizational guidelines and standards of practice. Uphold, defend, coach and mentor Agile values and principles. 
  Coaching and Culture:  Encourages team cohesion, empowerment, and ownership of commitments. Encourage, support, and guide continuous improvement of the team, its products, and processes. Explains and simplifies complex information to others; leads the coordination of information to ensure ongoing process or program execution. Good listener who creates a culture of unity, ownership, and empowerment enabling the team to improve their process while working on critical deliveries. 
  Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree required. 
  Scrum Master Certification required. 
  4-6 years professional experience with strong competency with the various tools, systems, procedures and best practices of Agile methodologies. 
  Professional expertise working within several software development lifecycle methodologies. 
  Expert in application of Agile processes and best practices. 
  Successful change agent, advocate for Agile process with an eye for how to apply process improvements to diverse organizations. 
  Experienced ‘servant leader’, facilitator, coach, mentor, teacher, impediment remover. 
  A proven track record successfully implementing projects using Agile methodologies in addition to strong project management skills. 
  Excellent communication, problem solving skills, and capable of strong technical understanding. 
 
  Bonus Points 
 
  Experience with and knowledgeable in AWS, Azure, DevOps, SAFe, PI Planning, Managing international scrum teams, Agile Transformation Processes, Python, Golang, microservice architecture. 
  Experience with organizing internal engineering software release process across multiple teams for an international client-facing product. 
  AWS Certification. 
  Hands-on software-development experience.

7ff3bab6ea028ff5.title: Senior Product Manager
7ff3bab6ea028ff5.desc:
About The Team 
 
  We are looking for a Senior Product Manager with experience building machine learning to deliver the next generation of collaboration products. This is a central role on a new product team to explore green field opportunities, building exciting new products and features to establish Zoom's presence as a leader in ML and AI. 
 
  About The Role 
 
  Discover and work on Zoom's existing product line where machine learning can unlock massive value for end-users, managing the product life cycle, from discovery to prioritization to execution. 
  Experience working closely with Sales organization and salesa stack for outbound and forecasting 
  Develop strategy for high-growth opportunities and build new products iteratively to either demonstrate market fit and accomplish those opportunities or fail fast and move on to new areas of interest. 
  You will represent the voice of the customer for a variety of segments and persona to build products targeting specific use cases. 
  Manage stakeholders and coordinate efforts throughout the business to balance level-of-effort, risk, and opportunity size to prioritize product portfolio. 
  Determine scope with a viciousness for end-user value, using an experimental method to disconfirm or confirm hypotheses about product and feature value. 
  You will drive and influence essential decisions to build a culture where machine learning is considered upfront in design, engineering, and marketing. 
 
 
  About You 
 
  5 + years of experience building software-as-a-service, data science, or analytics products. 
  Bachelor's degree or relevant years of work experience 
  Experience working across the sales stack 
  Business and technical know-how, articulate a business case at the executive level, harnessing data to improve decisions. 
  Background in Machine Learning, Speech recognition, Natural Language Processing, or Artificial Intelligence and high comfort level for data and analytics. 
  Experience working in an Agile environment with engineers and designers, including story mapping, grooming, and feature prioritization. 
  Experience collaborating cross-functionally to deliver solutions from ideation through go-to-market. 
 
 
  Salary Range or On Target Earnings: 
 
  Minimum:  $111,900.00
  
  Maximum:  $249,700.00
  
  In addition to the base salary and/or OTE listed Zoom has a Total Direct Compensation philosophy that takes into consideration; base salary, bonus and equity value. 
 
  Note: Starting pay will be based on a number of factors and commensurate with qualifications & experience. 
 
  We also have a location based compensation structure; there may be a different range for candidates in this and other locations. 
 
  About Us 
 
  Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best video product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinars. 
 
  We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment. 
 
  Explore Zoom: 
 
  Hear from our leadership team 
  Browse Awards and Employee Reviews on Comparably 
  Visit our Blog 
  Zoom with us! 
 
 
 
  We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Zoom is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. 
 
  We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records and any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a medical condition, or if you need assistance accessing our website or completing the application process, please let us know by emailing us at careers@zoom.us.

c80911e52bb88d3b.title: Senior Scientific Cloud Consultant (Remote)
c80911e52bb88d3b.desc:
BioTeam  is a well-established scientific computing consulting company that helps science and healthcare organizations cure diseases and save lives by making science and technology more accessible to them. If you are passionate about having an impact on science and helping make the world a better place, and you also like problem-solving and working in highly collaborative, diverse, and creative teams of people, BioTeam is the place for you. We’re a highly employee-centric company that values a diversity of backgrounds, experiences, and cultures and the strengths that those differences bring to us as a company and the solutions we come up with for our clients. Our work is challenging but satisfying, and we have fun doing it. All roles at BioTeam are client-facing and involve up to 25% overnight domestic travel. 
 
  Working at the intersection of science, data, and advanced technology, BioTeam helps accelerate science by offering strategic and transformational professional services that support modern data-intensive research. Our clients hire us when they aren’t sure what to do next, making our engagements interesting, unique, challenging, and highly compelling. We offer services that cover advanced infrastructure for science, data science and strategy, software and analytics for science (including AI), and data production in laboratories. 
 
  BioTeam is a mission-driven company that highly values its clients and works with them as strategic partners to help them succeed. We focus primarily on life sciences, biomedicine, and healthcare, with a client list that includes government agencies, Fortune 500 pharmaceutical and biotech companies, as well as leading hospitals and research labs across the country. For more information about BioTeam and to see examples of our work, visit bioteam.net. 
 
  Our goal is to make our employees feel taken care of: 
 
 Competitive base:  $140,000 - $155,000  (with potential for a bonus) 
 
 
 Completely virtual organization, which means you can work remotely from your  home office  (when not traveling to client sites) * 
 Opportunity to contribute significantly to a growing company with the potential for growth to a senior or leadership role 
 100% of your health & dental premiums for you & your family covered, effective day one 
 100% of your short-term, long-term disability and life insurance covered 
 Employer contributes annually to 401K, effective day one 
 
 
 BioTeam's roles are remote and can be filled within any of the following states: CA, CO, DC, FL, MA, MD, MO, NC, NH, NY, NJ, PA, TN, TX, WA, VA. 
 
 
  Job Summary 
  Are you a technology expert with a passion for modernizing IT infrastructure to support life sciences and healthcare research? Do you love solving complex technical and organizational challenges collaboratively with clients and team members? Do you enjoy leading diverse teams of smart and creative people? BioTeam has an exciting opportunity for you as a  Senior Scientific Cloud Consultant ! 
 
  As a Senior Scientific Cloud Consultant, you'll lead the development and implementation of cutting-edge, science-driven, Cloud-based technology solutions for our clients. From pre-sales scoping to design, implementation, testing, and maintenance, you'll help clients achieve their scientific mission with objective, technology-neutral infrastructure for science. 
 
  To excel in this role, you'll need to be a subject matter expert in Cloud technologies and practices. You'll work closely with clients to discover requirements and design, deploy, and manage advanced cloud-native data platforms, high performance computing (HPC) and storage systems, and other relevant computing infrastructure. Your deep curiosity about the latest advances in biomedical science and prior experience supporting scientific environments is a plus. 
 
  If you're passionate about collaboratively solving complex problems that advance science with custom technology solutions, apply now for the Senior Scientific Cloud Consultant role at BioTeam! 
 
  Key Responsibilities 
 
  Technical Expectations 
 
 Develop solutions to address scientific computing needs that can work for either all-cloud or hybrid environments 
 Communicate cloud and data platform design practices to help guide and influence scientific practices. 
 Use modern cloud development practices, such as “infrastructure as code” 
 Train scientists and technical professionals on cloud concepts and best practices related to scientific computing 
 Provide thought leadership to the industry in the form of blog postings, whitepapers, and speaking engagements 
 
 
 
  Consulting Expectations 
 
 Act as Cloud and Data Platform subject matter expert to provide day-to-day project coordination, planning, and implementation of multiple projects 
 Participate in initial tech review calls and clarify specific requirements of each project, including project scope and objectives, budget, determining the necessary project resources, and technical feasibility 
 Lead or participate in the drafting of project proposals and manage the lifecycle of internal and client document review until the proposal is approved 
 Troubleshoot a variety of issues and collaborate with team members on solutions 
 Ensure successful delivery of solutions that meet client expectations 
 Act as the technical point of contact for clients ensuring communication throughout the implementation and execution of a project 
 
 
 
  Background and Experience 
 
 
 
  Degree in science or engineering fields, with a preference for a focus on bioinformatics, data architecture, or data engineering for life sciences or a related discipline; graduate degree preferred or a combination of education and experience 
 10+  years of experience in software development with at least  5 years  working in the  cloud in a scientific environment required 
 
 
 Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and/or Microsoft Azure experience 
 Cloud certification and/or certification in systems administration or a related field is a plus 
 
 
 Extensive experience leading complex scientific IT projects and project teams 
 Passion for technology & science with a desire to stay up to date on the state-of-the-art in your field 
 Excellent communication skills and the demonstrated ability to build rapport with both external clients and internal team members 
 Organizational and time management skills with exceptional follow-through 
 Proactive and innovative, able to adapt to change quickly 
 Cognitive thinking skills that can assess and adapt to the various needs of a diverse stakeholder population 
 Experience and desire to work remotely with approximately  25% domestic overnight   travel 
 Must be currently authorized to work in the United States and have or be able to qualify for government and customer security clearance 
 
 
 
  Work Environment 
  This job operates in an office environment, both in shared and home locations. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. 
 
 
  Physical Demands 
  This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to move files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand as necessary. 
 
 
  The Company does not seek salary history information from applicants.  The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

7dc7d7002b66a05c.title: Application Architect (.Net & Azure)
7dc7d7002b66a05c.desc:
About Kanini 
 Kanini provides Agile Software Development, Cloud Computing, Data Science, and Location Intelligence services to public and private organizations. We have successfully served our clients in government, finance, transportation, utility, and software industries since 2003. 
 Why you should join 
 Working at Kanini is flexible and personal. We are a highly motivated, collaborative team experimenting with the latest technologies. We are committed to everyone having a healthy work/life balance, and we provide extensive mentorship and training resources to help you succeed. 
 Kanini is looking for a Solution Architect who has a deep experience working in .Net, MVC, Azure development, Azure Service bus, Azure functions, Azure logic apps 
 Responsibilities 
 
 Designing, developing, implementing, and releasing high quality custom software solutions using Scrum. 
 Applying the very best technical agile patterns and practices when building custom software solutions. 
 Collaborating frequently with customers to provide technical consultation and assistance; and working with these customers to build software solutions that add the most value to their business. 
 Working under some supervision from a Solution Architect or Delivery Leader, but will be expected to work independently on complex, non-routine tasks and projects - many unique to our customers' organizations. You may interact with end users and other technical personnel to identify and correct issues. 
 Maintaining continuous, open, consistent professional communication with customers, peers and team members. Openly listen to others and confirm understanding to ensure everyone is on the same page. 
 Proactively looking for ways to keep all time productive and will use non-customer time for personal training, internal projects and administrative tasks. 
 Working on project teams consisting of both customers and other team members. 
 Be committed to making a positive impact on our clients' engagements. 
 Working closely with team members on quality-related activities. 
 Leading and mentoring junior developers through projects. 
 
 Qualifications 
 
 Experience working on large enterprise application integrations. Deep understanding and delivering solution using common messaging patterns 
 Experience with Enterprise Service Bus/Azure Service Bus preferred 
 Deep understanding and experience with agile development practices, including unit testing and continuous integration. 
 Willingness to take on additional responsibility to ensure team success and quality solutions. 
 Team player that understands how your own work is important to the team's success. 
 Ability to multitask across different projects. 
 Become a partner and trusted advisor to clients, advising on best-fit technologies and best practices. 
 Good knowledge of Scrum – if you don’t have this, you should possess a willingness to learn and adopt it quickly. 
 Familiarity with object serialization to one of the following: XML, JSON, BSON. 
 Database development skill using SQL Server or Oracle or equivalent. 
 Working knowledge of object oriented design, patterns and practices. 
 A deep understanding of the .NET platform. 
 Experience with the ASP.NET MVC. 
 System integration experience using either SOA techniques and ASMX or WCF (or equivalent). 
 Exposure to an ORM such as Entity Framework or NHibernate or equivalent implementation. 
 Windows server or Azure development experience and/or UNIX/Linux development experience. 
 Queuing experience using MSMQ (or equivalent). 
 Development experience using HTML5/CSS/JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS or Ember or equivalent. 
 Professionalism to include written and oral communication and the ability to communicate collaboratively in front of a whiteboard. An ability to understand your audience and adjust your communication style appropriately. 
 Ability to learn business concepts quickly. 
 A desire to constantly learn and share new knowledge, whether this is reading a book and posting a review on our Yammer, or giving a lunch-and-learn on the hottest new JavaScript library. 
 Data transform knowledge using ODI or SSIS. 
 A caring attitude – care about what you do, who you do it with and how you’re going to be successful in the end. 
 8+ yrs. professional software development experience. 
 Solid working knowledge of four or more of the following technologies: 
 Authoring APIs compliant to REST standards 
 Development using HTML5/CSS/JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS or Ember or equivalent 
 Development using Silverlight or WPF Jquery 
 Domain-centric architectures such as DDD or Onion 
 
 –Kanini Software Solutions, Inc. does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, gender, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, family status, disability status, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity. If you have a disability, please let us know if there is anything we can do to improve the interview process for you; we’re happy to accommodate. 
 Kanini Software Solutions, Inc., 25 Century Blvd., Ste. 602, Nashville, TN 37214 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Pay: $140,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year 
 Work Location: Remote

443c5198d43314ce.title: Senior Cyber Defense Engineer
443c5198d43314ce.desc:
The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods. Through our work, we are committed to contributing to a sustainable future, both for fashion and for our employees. Authenticity is a core component of our business; we value it in our products and we celebrate it across our teams by encouraging every TRR employee to bring their REAL authentic selves to work each day. We're hiring, and we'd love for you to join our dynamic team! 
 
  The Information Security team mission is to build and protect stakeholder trust - customers, employees, investors - in our business, especially where technology is involved. Security at TRR has a unique value in reinforcing trust in the stewardship that is core to the business. We do this by guiding the right organizational security risk decisions and partnering with technology and business teams. We bring integrity, knowledge, and a passion for technology. 
  We are looking for a cyber defense analyst to support our enterprise cyber defense program. This is a technical hands-on role in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. You'll be working with various application and system owners to report, review, triage vulnerabilities, as well as to drive remediations and to improve our current processes by driving the configurations and integration efforts. Come join us in building better security for a company that lives its values of ecology, economy, and quality 
  What You Get To Do Every Day 
 
 Monitor the SIEM for suspicious events and anomalous activity 
 Provide timely detection, identification, and alerting of possible attacks/intrusions, anomalous activities, and misuse activities and distinguish these incidents and events from benign activities 
 Ability to configure data pipelines in the cloud and transport data into data lakes for analysis 
 Configure and integrate SaaS tools, EDR, firewalls to centralize the vulnerability management program 
 Ability to code against APIs (data extraction), write scripts and automate workflows is a plus 
 Document and manage cyber events in ticketing systems 
 Assist in incident response procedures. 
 Review, triage vulnerabilities, and drive remediation efforts across IT, engineering and product teams 
 Management vulnerability remediation lifecycle 
 Track, report and improve the vulnerability remediation process 
 Configure logging, capture and analyze cyber events from technologies such as Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), firewalls, endpoint protection, web/email filtering, cloud hosting environments etc. 
 Perform event correlation using information gathered from a variety of sources within the enterprise to gain situational awareness and determine the effectiveness of an observed attack 
 
 What You Bring To The Role 
 
 Minimum 5 years in relevant experience with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Data Science 
 Proficiency with Python programming language 
 Experience with SIEM, configuring and maintaining threat use cases 
 Very good understanding of EDR, vulnerability scanning tools, writing queries (SQL) 
 Comfortable working in the Mac/Unix/Linux environment 
 Familiarity with EDR tools 
 Familiarity with common security vulnerabilities (CVE/CVSS) and the ability to judge their severity and impact on the business 
 Participation in on-call rotation periodically which may involve non-traditional working hours 
 Cloud certifications and familiarity with AWS, GCP 
 Malware Analysis 
 Setting up HoneyPots and sniffers 
 Eagerness to be hands-on with cybersecurity tools and assist with configuration tasks 
 Cybersecurity certifications ISC2, GIAC, SANS 
 
 
 
  The expected salary range for this role is $134,222 - $170,000. To determine starting pay we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location and an evaluation of a candidate's skills, experience, market demands, and internal parity. Additionally, salary is just one component of TRR's total rewards package. Depending on role, employees may also be eligible for a bonus program, incentive pay and benefits. 
  GHR8294 #LI-AA10 #LI-Remote 
 
 
  The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, resale luxury goods, with more than 30 million members. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have hundreds of in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by thousands of brands across numerous categories—including women's and men's fashion, fine jewelry and watches, art and home—in support of the circular economy. We make selling effortless with free virtual appointments, in-home pickup, drop-off and direct shipping. We do all of the work for consignors, including authenticating, using AI and machine learning to determine optimal pricing, photographing and listing their items, as well as handling shipping and customer service. At our 13 retail locations, including our twelve shoppable stores, customers can sell, meet with our experts and receive free valuations. 
 
  The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records.  At TRR, People Come First. That's why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our Diversity Equity and Inclusion program  here .     Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

0df48d321f51c62d.title: Solution Architect, Principal
0df48d321f51c62d.desc:
General information 
       
 
 
 
 
 
 
        Country 
        
 United States  
 
 
 
        City 
        
 Remote Location  
 
 
 
        Department 
        
 Development  
 
 
 
        Job ID 
        
 36419  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
       Description & Requirements 
       
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Solution Architect is responsible for researching, documenting, and configuring the HC Golden Tenant as well as maintaining current data for Cloudsuite Healthcare. This role requires deep functional knowledge of Supply Management in the Healthcare Industry. It is highly collaborative with Solution Consulting, Strategy, Product Management, Consulting, and an offshore team supporting data automation and quality assurance. The golden tenant is the Healthcare prescriptive solution used in product demonstrations and in Infor Services deployments. 
  A Day in The Life Typically Includes: 
 
  Managing the build of new functionality and supporting ongoing configurations, for the Supply Management golden tenant.  
 Creating and maintaining Supply Management demo transactional data as necessary to support use cases demonstrated by Solution Consulting and Infor Services Business process walkthroughs with implementing clients. 
  Collaborating with Finance, HRT/Payroll and WFM Architects for the Golden Image as well as Industry Strategists, Solution Consulting, Product Management and Solutions and Innovation to define new or to modify existing builds.  
 Providing input to Product Management on new feature requirements and capabilities. 
  Collaborating with and mentoring the offshore resources supporting Supply Management capabilities and automated data and QA for the golden image.  
 Inventory control and migration of content from Test to Demo to Golden Tenant as required 
  Owning resolution for all RequestX tickets that are related to Supply Management in the golden tenant. 
 
  Basic Qualifications: 
 
  ERP lead consulting experience with Supply Management Infor ERP products or equivalent experience with a Healthcare provider 
  Supply Management functional practitioner knowledge in a Healthcare setting.  
 Experience leading and ability to collaborate and mentor functional skills with employees that have less functional depth.  
 Experience with complex sales or delivery engagements  
 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
  BA/BS Degree 
  MBA 
  “Big 4” Consulting or equivalent experience 
  Job Location: US Remote (Alpharetta, GA, Dallas, TX, St. Paul, MN)
         
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         About Infor
         
 
 
  Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
         
 
          For more information visit www.infor.com
         
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         Our Values
         
 
 
  At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.
         
 
 
  We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.
         
 
 
  Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law.
          
 
 
 
 
         At Infor we value your privacy that’s why we created a policy that you can read here.
         
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
         This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

46ec004c1ecab561.title: Associate Director – MarTech Product Manager
46ec004c1ecab561.desc:
At Alcon, we are driven by the meaningful work we do to help people see brilliantly. We innovate boldly, champion progress, and act with speed as the global leader in eye care. Here, you’ll be recognized for your commitment and contributions and see your career like never before. Together, we go above and beyond to make an impact in the lives of our patients and customers. We foster an inclusive culture and are looking for diverse, talented people to join Alcon.
  
 
 
   Alcon is looking for an Associate Director – MarTech Product Manager, reporting to the Senior Director, Digital Marketing Technologies, who will drive the strategy, planning, and execution of the next generation of Alcon’s global marketing (CX) technology stack, delivering capabilities to enable intelligent and flawless experiences for our prospects and customers at every touchpoint. This role is a highly technical product manager and entrepreneurial problem solver who will partner across engineering, architecture, data science, and the business to solve complex business and customer needs and craft global digital marketing transformation. This role will focus on building e2e GTM capabilities through a scalable platform powered by data and Intelligence.
  
 
   In this role, a typical day will include:
  
 
 
   Essential Job Functions / Accountabilities:
  
 
  Partner with marketing, product, platform, and engineering teams to conceive, prioritize and deliver elite MarTech capabilities that empower our marketing teams and customers aligned to business goals 
  Develop and implement a forward-thinking marketing technology ecosystem strategy that aligns with our business goals and positions us to be a leader in the industry 
  Collaborate across the technology and partner organizations to create and regularly refine product vision, strategy, and roadmaps to accelerate capability maturity. Foster a customer-centric approach to deliver exceptional user experiences and enhance value 
  Lead scrum team to prioritize and complete product roadmaps and initiatives 
  Create a network throughout the organization to optimally communicate and align on priorities, remove friction, and increase decision making velocity 
  Be daring and evangelize MarTech capability, drive consensus, and champion increased velocity and path to value. Establish and continuously measure product critical metrics, gauge impact and advise product strategy 
  Develop and optimize marketing operations frameworks and drive product adoption demonstrating well-crafted trainings and playbooks 
  Establish and improve a community of practice for the MarTech product and platform management; coach and mentor team-members 
  Drive a high-performance culture through meticulous product management craft, bold vision, effective internal and external partnerships. Direct reports are in multiple time zones so working hours should be adapted for 1:1s and team meetings. 
 
 
 
   What You'll Bring To Alcon:
  
 
   Key Requirements/Minimum Qualifications:
  
 
  Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school +15 yrs; Assoc.+11 yrs; M.S.+4 yrs; PhD+3 yrs) 
  The ability to fluently read, write, understand, and communicate in English. 
  7 years of related experience 
  5 Years of Proven Leadership 
  Broad leadership experience in MarTech product and platform management, driving large scale growth initiatives and digital transformation 
  Strong ability to develop and champion a product vision, strategy, and roadmap for a product area in support of customer needs and business goals 
  Validated experience in building MarTech capabilities to support sophisticated orchestration across owned and paid channels (e.g. email, web, push, SMS, social, sales, and service) 
  Sophisticated thinking in the application of AI/Gen AI in the marketing domain 
  Validated leadership and communication skills, the ability to influence and inspire change in a matrixed globally diverse environment 
  A reputation for being an impactful, creative problem solver with a passion for innovation and a track record for delivering high quality and timely results 
  A high degree of fluency in technology and data and the architecture of an integrated CX ecosystem 
  Understanding of marketing and performance marketing principles and strategies 
  Deep knowledge of how marketers leverage data and intelligence to power highly relevant digital experiences and hands on experience in the platform capabilities to enable it 
  Skilled in evaluating the competitive landscape, identifying compelling solutions, analyzing technologies, and assessing the importance of emerging platforms and tools 
  Deep understanding of a wide range of marketing technologies and platforms, including CRM, journey orchestration, measurement and attribution, personalization, experimentation, media ad platforms, content management, and AI-driven solutions 
  Acquia/Drupal/Site Studio, Widen, Adobe, Google Analytics, Tealium Tag Management, etc. 
  Salesforce Marketing Cloud including Email Studio, Mobile Studio and Journey Builder, Adobe Campaign, etc. 
  Tealium, Quantum Metrics, Segment, etc. 
  Optimizely, Amplitude, Movable Ink, Acoustic, etc. 
  5+ years of people management experience with a record of mentoring and developing impactful teams. Support all aspects of IT career and capability development to meet the needs of Alcon, including attraction, retention and development of diverse technical talent, in the organization. Ensure robust career development, performance management, and succession planning 
  Excellent leadership and social skills; ability to persuade, communicate the vision and motivate people at every level 
 
 
 
   Preferred qualifications:
  
 
  Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, engineering, or equivalent 
  7+ years of product management experience with technically complex, platform products operating at significant scale 
  7+ years designing and delivering premier orchestration and channel activation products that solve complex organizational challenges 
 
 
 
   How You Can Thrive At Alcon:
  
 
  Benefit from a growing, innovative environment. 
  Sharpen your current skills and gain exposure within different areas of the business. 
  Focused and strategic growth and development opportunities. 
  Join Alcon’s mission to provide outstanding, innovative products and solutions to improve sight and improve lives! 
  Work hours: Standard Hours, Monday - Friday (On-site or Remote) 
  Travel Requirements: 5% 
  Relocation assistance: Yes 
  Sponsorship available: Yes 
 
 
 
 
 
  #li-dni
