218b77002bd52f4f.title: Senior Director, Revenue Management Operations & Forecasting
218b77002bd52f4f.desc:
Sonder (Nasdaq: SOND)  is revolutionizing hospitality through innovative, tech-powered service and inspiring, thoughtfully designed accommodations combined into one seamlessly managed experience. Officially launched in 2014, Sonder is making a world of better stays open to all with a variety of accommodation options — from rooms to suites and apartments — found in 40+ cities spanning 10 countries and three continents. Sonder's innovative app empowers guests by making self-service features and 24/7 on-the-ground support just a tap away. From simple self check-in to boutique bathroom amenities, we bring the best of a hotel without any of the formality. 
  The Revenue Management team is uniquely positioned to drive Sonder's success and profitability. The team creates and implements data-driven revenue strategies to optimize business performance, and is responsible for ongoing management of pricing and inventory. 
  Our approach to Revenue Management at Sonder is different from what you'll find in many traditional hospitality roles, and the company places a premium on the impact of this team. If you're looking for a high visibility, high impact role that emphasizes rigorous data-led decisions, solving problems from 0-1, and a high bar for operational excellence, this role may be right for you! 
  AT SONDER YOU WILL: 
 
 Be responsible  for driving strong RevPAR results (i.e. growing revenue compared to comps) 
 Define, operationalize and oversee  the pricing and revenue strategies for all Sonder markets, property types, and customer segments 
 Lead and develop  a team of 2 leaders, who each oversee teams of portfolio revenue managers, and a Senior Analyst, Revenue Strategy, Performance & Forecasting 
 Design and lead  cross-functional projects that unlock new revenue capabilities, including new customer segments (ie. Sales), new features (ie. Upgrades/Overbooking), and new ancillary (non-room) revenue streams 
 Manage global deployment  of the RM Ops team to maximize efficiency 
 Conduct oversight  to ensure accurate bi-weekly, quarterly and annual revenue forecasts for the entire company, in coordination with the Finance team 
 Define and drive delivery  of performance targets 
 Communicate performance  results to executive leadership, including disaggregation of drivers 
 Organize and coordinate  your team's operating model to maximize revenue impact, in line with Sonder's RM model of operational excellence 
 Develop the framework and lead  the analysis that informs tactical pricing, lever utilization, and revenue decisions 
 Partner  with stakeholders in Sales, Marketing, and Operations to drive market-level revenue performance 
 Design and implement  pricing experiments and initiatives 
 Create and deliver  presentation materials which communicate results to key stakeholders 
 Co-develop solutions and enhancements  with Engineering and Product teams in developing in-house, revenue management software 
 Hire and onboard  new Managers, RM Operations 
 
 WHAT WE LOOK FOR: 
 
 Bachelor's degree or Master's degree with 10+ years experience in a quantitative, strategy, or consulting role 
 5+ years experience team management and development 
 Top performer in the Revenue Management discipline or expert in hospitality 
 Passion for driving business impact and leading high performing teams 
 Experience in leading cross-functional projects end-to-end 
 Creative thinker who devises novel approaches to problem solving 
 Excellent communication and storytelling skills 
 Elite analytical skills, including a demonstrated ability in analyzing and presenting data, using Excel/Sheets, SQL, Tableau, R, Python, or related software 
 Fluency in data science techniques and application of statistics to solve problems is strongly preferred 
 
 #LI-Remote 
 
  We also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at: 
 
 Competitive compensation   
 Generous stock plan   
 Medical, dental and vision insurance (where applicable)   
 Flexible vacation   
 Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders   
 A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!   
 Workplace flexibility (for remote-specified positions only) #ABetterWaytoWork   
 
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status or other protected classes.

ed01fbe2a9a3d50d.title: Senior Manager - Project Management, CPG Analytics experience
ed01fbe2a9a3d50d.desc:
Company Description
   Location: US-Remote 
  #REFID686316 
 
 
 
 Job Description
   In 100 countries around the world, NielsenIQ provides clients the most complete understanding of how the FMCG market evolves and what consumers buy. As a global leader in measurement and information, we believe providing our clients a precise understanding of the consumer is the key to making the right decisions - decisions that can lead to profitable growth. At NielsenIQ, we’re always innovating to keep pace with emerging market trends and the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer. 
  The primary role of the RTM (Route to Market Americas) Senior Manager is to lead client engagements which deliver analytics solutions for NielsenIQ client organizations. This includes delivering insights, recommendations and tools to our clients related to pricing, promotion, distribution and/or merchandising strategies and executional tactics. The RTM Senior Manager will collaborate closely with account teams and the modeling COE to share project requirements and ensure success project delivery with powerful insights and recommendations. RTM projects include, but not limited to Forecasting, Test/Control analysis, Localization, Penetration, Trial Generation and Custom models. 
  The RTM Senior Manager will be responsible for all aspects of executing analytic engagements including conducting analysis of results, simulating client plans, creating deliverable materials, and supporting presentation/training/tool deliveries. This position is off-site and occasional travel may be required. 
 
  Responsibilities: 
 
  Lead the execution and delivery of analytic engagements to meet clients’ research objectives 
  Ensure pro-active insights and action-oriented solutions are delivered to the client by being an expert in your solutions and data/insight storytelling, with an ability to explain methodology behind all key analytical consulting to client 
  Manage timelines and priorities both internally and externally, sometimes consisting of moving targets and conflicting deadlines 
  Creatively find ways to enhance the capabilities of our team through process improvements, best practices, skills development/coaching or cross-functional initiatives 
  Drive client value through the successful implementation and ongoing usage/integration of analytic solutions 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications
  
 
  Expertise in manufacturer sales functions (Category Management, Key Account Analytics, Headquarters Sales, etc.) 
  Strong logic, deductive reasoning, problem solving and critical thinking skills 
  Skilled communicator, including group presentations and storytelling 
  Demonstrated mastery in data analysis & application to client business issues 
  Demonstrated strength in maintaining positive client relationships in complex situations & resolving client issues with the ability to interface with client executives (VPs, Directors, Account Leads, etc.) 
  Strong project management skills 
  People management skills to promote a positive work environment and associate skills development 
  Able to work collaboratively with internal & external teams 
  Strong sense of urgency and accountability to drive client outcomes 
  CPG industry knowledge, experience and acumen 
 
 
  Background and Technical Skills: 
 
  Bachelor's degree required 
  MBA or advanced/analytics degree preferred 
  8-10 years of relevant experience in Market Research, Consumer Packaged Goods, Consulting, Analytics, and/or Category Management 
  Strong analytic background and knowledge of statistical or data science methodologies and applications 
  Strong Marketing/Research background 
  Knowledge of NielsenIQ data assets desirable 
 
  Additional Information
  
  About NIQ 
  NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. 
  NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com. 
  Want to keep up with our latest updates? 
  Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook 
 
 
  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 
  NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. 
  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. 
  Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/ 
  NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

8a4a4065ec7f42e4.title: Senior Staff AI Research Scientist for Generative AI (REMOTE)
8a4a4065ec7f42e4.desc:
Why engineering at Stryker? 
  At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development. 
  Need another reason to apply?  Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team:   https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team 
  We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting  stryker.com 
  Our benefits include bonuses; commissions; healthcare; insurance benefits; retirement programs; stock based plans; family and parenting leaves; tuition reimbursement; wellness programs; onsite fitness centers and cafeterias; discount purchase programs; and service and performance awards – not to mention various social and recreational activities. 
 
  Who We Want: 
 
  As a valued member of Stryker’s AI innovation unit, you will work alongside trailblazers, industry visionaries, innovators, and inventors who are committed to bringing computer vision, AI/ML and digital innovation to the operating room and other healthcare settings. 
 
  You’ll contribute to fast-paced cycles of innovation and develop core technologies that power a wide array of Stryker’s solutions, including: surgical robotics and navigation, image-guided surgery, treatment selection, outcome assessment, and clinical decision intelligence. You will apply your core skills across a range of deployment platforms spanning from mobile applications, cloud services, and SDKs to embedded systems, edge devices, and mixed reality (XR) platforms. You will have an opportunity to work across a wide variety of therapeutic areas ranging from orthopaedics and neurosurgery to emergency care and operating room safety and efficiency – plus many more. 
 
  As a  Senior Staff AI Research Scientist , you will play a crucial role in driving business impacts and delving deep into the complexities of computer vision and deep learning problem-solving. This high-visibility opportunity is a perfect match for technical leaders who are passionate about making a tangible difference in the AI healthcare landscape. 
 
  Don't miss this exceptional chance to leave a lasting mark on healthcare technology. Apply now and harness your expertise to revolutionize AI-driven medical innovation! 
 
  What You Will Do: 
 
  Technical Responsibilities 
 
 
  Lead research that enables learning the semantics of multimodal data (images, video, text, audio, speech, and other modalities) as well as apply multimodality learning to medical data (EHR, CT Scans, X-ray, MRI, etc). 
  Work towards long-term ambitious research goals, while identifying intermediate milestones 
  Explore the new opportunities that generative AI, Large Language Models, and foundation models unlocks in healthcare and identify practical applications of these new technological advances to improve standard of care. 
  Develop and implement novel AI algorithms and models, fine-tune and optimize foundation models, develop deployment mechanisms and guardrails for these models. 
  Work and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, CV engineers, and healthcare professionals, to translate latest advances in AI into scalable solutions. 
  Stay abreast of latest developments in AI and machine learning, particularly in generative models, foundation models and LLMs. 
  Publish research findings in top-tier journals and conferences and represent Stryker in the AI research community. 
 
 
  What You Will Need: 
 
  Basic Qualifications: 
 
 
  Bachelor's degree in software engineering/ Computer Science or related discipline with 6+ years of work experience OR Master’s in relevant disciplines with 4+ years of experience OR PhD degree in relevant disciplines with 2+ years of work experience. 
  Publications in machine learning, AI, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data science, or related technical fields. 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications: 
 
  At least 3 years of experience in AI research, with a focus on generative AI and LLMs. 
  Proven work experience in a university or industry lab(s), in a lead role with primary emphasis on AI research 
  Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Huggingface etc. 
  Experience in writing reusable, scalable, test-driven and well documented codebase. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex research findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
  Bonus for:
    
  Prior experience developing AI applications using LLM 
  Academic publication in ML/AI conferences / journals such as CVPR, ICCP, ICCV, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR etc. is a plus. 
 
 
 
 
  $ 109k  - $ 232k  salary plus bonus eligible + Benefits (Health, Vision, Dental, 401K, Tuition Reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program, Wellbeing Program, Employee Stock Purchase Program). This information reflects the anticipated salary range for this position based on current national data. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors. 
 
  About Stryker 
  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better.  
 The company offers innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopedics, and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 100 million patients annually. 
  More information is available at stryker.com

5b7bdb16b6c10629.title: Principal Product Manager - Consumer
5b7bdb16b6c10629.desc:
Job Profile: 
  
  Vista Tech  plays a vital role in the Vista group operations by delivering and accelerating comprehensive technology solutions across all brands. Vista’s end-to-end and click-to-flight solutions offer the industry's only comprehensive flight booking platform, seamlessly integrating global operations, and leveraging AI and machine learning to optimize pricing and fleet movement. Comprised of the Product Management, Engineering, and IT teams, Vista Tech’s mission is to enhance transparency and accessibility in private aviation through the development of the world's largest digital private aviation marketplace. In achieving this, Vista Tech always ensures the utmost safety and efficiency for FLIGHT CREW, EMPLOYEES and Members, while fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
  
 
 
  About the team 
  The Product Management team at VistaGlobal is a centralized function that includes Product, Data Science, And Analytics. We take ownership and are accountable for getting things done. Through curiosity, learning, and coaching, we grow as individuals and teams. As one of our product leaders says, We are a problem solving club. #One team
    This role sits close to the Sales growth and Lifecycle business team. This team is the heart of VistaGlobal working on membership growth, retention of the most demanding clients on the planet. As a Tech enabled business, we rely on technology to provide scalable solutions to future needs of the Sales & Client Services team to help delight our customers.
  
 
 
  What’s in it for you 
  We will never box you in a role - if you are hungry to solve problems, we have ample opportunities for you to grow. You will be working on some really challenging problems of the private aviation industry right from refining the customer journey with the client services team to launching internal platforms to enable the sales team. You will be working with Design, UX, Data Engineering, Data Science Team, Engineering, Product teams, Leaders from Sales & Marketing to convert ambiguity into structure. 
  Your Responsibilities: 
  
 Define strategies, develop product roadmap, write one pagers and Product Requirement documents to align stakeholders and lead successful execution of initiatives to enable lifecycle initiatives and Increase in Consumer engagement.  
 Partner with business teams to identify their pain points, convert into requirements, and collaborate with UX, Business, Data team to define an iterative solution to the problem statement.  
 Create user stories and provide other required input and direction to the engineering team; own the backlog and keep the team fully engaged building the highest priority features and enhancements. 
  Perform build vs buy analysis for critical tooling, and develop, integrate platforms to enable the Sales, and marketing team to delight our clients, fuel membership growth, increase customer retention.  
 Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to define data models, analytics reports, and Data Science team to answer questions to business problems. 
  Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience: 
  
 Minimum 5 years as a Product Manager at a technology enabled business company, ideally in a Growth focused role - you have a bias towards action.  
 Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets using SQL and experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI and Tableau. In short you are a data junkie and speak SQL as your second language.  
 Collaboration and teamwork with empathy and compassion is a must to Partner with various business teams and multi-functional analytics & reporting teams (Engagement & Retention, Finance, Engineering, Product, and Marketing) to understand the business use cases and help with product prioritization.  
 You are metric influenced and you have phenomenal communication and storytelling skills with data, with the ability to optimally navigate, mediate and cultivate partnership and consensus. 
  Experience building a product roadmap and working with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver exceptional business impact.  
 Analyze, quantify, and articulate trade-offs of product roadmap features Strong verbal communication and presentation skills to senior leaders and Business stakeholders. 
  Strong analytical skills with ability to query data from various systems to solve problems  
 Have written one pagers and PRDs to convert ambiguity into structure and align stakeholders. You excel at go to market strategies. 
 
 
 
  Bonus Points:  
 
 
 Know how of AI/ML  
 If you have worked at a growth role before MBA Preferred or Mathematics or Statistics or Engineering as one of your degrees 
  Experience working on: Braze, Marketing Cloud, SFDC Sales and opportunity management , SAP order to cash process, Tableau, Oracle BI, Segment.io, Snowflakes  
 Experience working at a consulting company such as McKinsey, BCG, Bain, PWC, KPMG etc.

f08c7497d7e60651.title: Radiology Solutions Technical Lead
f08c7497d7e60651.desc:
We are seeking a Technical Product Leader, to drive the development, deployment, and success of our cutting-edge AI-powered healthcare Radiology solutions tailored to the radiology industry. This role plays a crucial part in bridging the gap between technology, business, and engineering to ensure the seamless integration of software, systems, and products. 
 
 
 Develop and execute a holistic strategy aligning technical capabilities with market needs and business objectives in the radiology AI domain. 
 Lead the ideation, design, and development of AI-powered products for radiology diagnosis and treatment. 
 Conduct thorough market research to identify customer pain points, competitive landscape, and emerging trends to inform product development. 
 Provide overarching technical direction to software and system engineering teams, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and cutting-edge technologies. 
 Create and communicate a comprehensive product roadmap outlining feature enhancements, system improvements, and integration efforts. 
 Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI, radiology, and healthcare technology, exploring opportunities for innovation. 
 Foster collaboration among cross-functional teams, including radiologists, software engineers, system engineers, and data scientists, to ensure seamless product development and delivery. 
 Ensure user-centered design principles are integrated into the development process, resulting in intuitive and effective user experiences for healthcare professionals. 
 Define and oversee the architecture of software systems, infrastructure, and networking components to ensure scalability, security, and performance. 
 Lead and mentor diverse engineering teams, fostering innovation, collaboration, and skill development. 
 Implement quality control measures across software development, system architecture, and product features to ensure high standards of performance, reliability, and security. 
 Ensure products and systems adhere to healthcare regulations, such as HIPAA, and maintain data privacy and security. 
 Collaborate with external vendors, partners, and contractors to leverage specialized expertise and resources for product development. 
 Oversee optimization efforts to improve system performance, scalability, and uptime, ensuring a seamless experience for users. 
 Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to gauge the success and impact of products and systems, using data-driven insights to guide improvements. 
 Manage budgets related to product development, engineering, and research activities, optimizing resource allocation for maximum efficiency. 
 Continuously assess and refine development processes, methodologies, and tools to improve efficiency and effectiveness. 
 Requirements: 
  
 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Management or equivalent. 
 At least 10+ years of proven experience as a product leader with a track record of partnering with engineering, design, data science, and business functions to deliver successful projects at scale. 
 Strong understanding of Radiology and Healthcare industry trends. 
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 
 Exceptional leadership and team management abilities. 
 Demonstrated success in product development and innovation. 
 Knowledge of healthcare regulations and data privacy standards, such as HIPAA. 
 Budget management and resource optimization expertise. 
 
 
 The Technical Product Leader plays a pivotal role in driving innovation, technical excellence, and customer satisfaction within the dynamic and critical field of AI within radiology solutions. 
 
 If you are passionate about shaping the future of healthcare technology and possess the skills and vision to lead our product development efforts, we encourage you to apply. Join us in making a meaningful impact on the radiology industry and improving patient care through advanced AI-driven solutions. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic team!

1b7fe4881f5ef409.title: Senior Test and Evaluation Engineer
1b7fe4881f5ef409.desc:
Position Description : 
  
   If you love engaging with high profile and challenging financial projects supporting the U.S. Department of Defense, Serco has a great opportunity for you! The 
   Senior Test & Evaluation Engineer  will be part of a dynamic team supporting major systems acquisition, research and engineering on behalf of the Office of the Secretary of Defense at the Pentagon and Mark Center offices in nearby Alexandria, Virginia. You will support the senior-executive Director in the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OUSD(R&E)). Bring your expertise and collaborative skills to make a positive impact on the security of our nation!
  
 
  You will be part of a team responsible for highly consequential engagements with stakeholders impacting national security and the defense capabilities of the United States. You will work closely with customers and other Serco teams to deliver quality solutions, recognized by DoD and industry as outstanding contributions in engineering program and risk management across the Defense enterprise. 
 
  This position is contingent upon your ability to maintain/transfer your active DoD Top-Secret with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance. 
 
  In this role, you will: 
 
  Provide scientific and engineering technical assessment of proposed prototypes and experimentations. 
  Provide a quantitative/qualitative analysis of technologies from the technological industry base, services, and Government laboratories. 
  Validate prototypes and experimentations utilizing proven scientific analytical  methods and high-fidelity modeling to confirm key performance parameters design specifications of prototypes. 
  Provide technical recommendation and reports on the rapid acquisition deployment of prototypes. 
  Review prototypes and experimentation proposals with recommendations but deliver findings in the form of technical reports, briefings, and executive summaries. 
  Provide subject matter expertise with experience in the following technical areas: 
 
  Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning  
 Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) & Electronic Warfare (EW)  
 Space and Stratosphere capabilities  
 Information Operations  
 Demonstration and Experimentation of key prototypes to assess the engineering design, risk, specification of a prototype in an operational but relevant environment to facilitate transition of the residual capability. 
 
  Qualifications: 
   To be successful in the role, you will have: 
 
  Active DoD Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance 
  Master's degree in Physical Sciences (Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Robotics, Computer Architecture and Machine Learning, etc.). 
  10+ years’ experience test positions, specifically formal Developmental Test/Operational Test, and full-time testing of emerging technologies. 
  Military or OSD experience. 
  Additional technical background in one or more of the technical areas: 
 
  Cyber  
 Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning. 
  Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) & Electromagnetic Warfare (EW). 
  Space and Stratosphere. 
  Information Operations. 
  Demonstration and Experimentation. 
 
  Experience leading classified programs at the SCI level or above. 
  Experience in data collection and experimentation utilizing proven scientific and analytical methods and high-fidelity modeling to confirm the key performance parameters, design, and specifications of prototypes. 
  Must understand performance metrics and integration into existing platforms and capabilities to include operational DOTMLPF. 
  Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing, to draft clear, concise reports (often dealing with highly complex technical issues), to maintain effective working relationships, and to provide technical guidance and briefings.  
 Strong oral and writing communication skills and the ability to work effectively with other program offices, other USG and DoD agencies, and senior US and foreign government officials at a variety of venues. 
  Ability to independently plan and complete assignments; alerting the supervisor only when problems arise that would delay project or mission accomplishments. In addition, conflicts, controversy, or highly political issues are referred to the supervisor. 
  The ability to travel up to 10%. 
 
 
  If you are interested in supporting and working with the Department of Defense (DoD) and a resolute Serco team, then submit your application now for immediate consideration. It only takes a few minutes to change your career! 
 
  Military Veterans and Spouses encouraged to apply!  Company Overview : 
  
   Serco Inc. (Serco) is the Americas division of Serco Group, plc. In North America, Serco’s 9,000+ employees strive to make an impact every day across 100+ sites in the areas of Defense, Citizen Services, and Transportation. We help our clients deliver vital services more efficiently while increasing the satisfaction of their end customers. Serco serves every branch of the U.S. military, numerous U.S. Federal civilian agencies, the Intelligence Community, the Canadian government, state, provincial and local governments, and commercial clients. While your place may look a little different depending on your role, we know you will find yours here. Wherever you work and whatever you do, we invite you to discover your place in our world. Serco is a place you can count on and where you can make an impact because every contribution matters.
  
 
 
  To review Serco benefits please visit: https://www.serco.com/na/careers/benefits-of-choosing-serco. If you require an accommodation with the application process please email: careers@serco-na.com or call the HR Service Desk at 800-628-6458, option 1. Please note, due to EEOC/OFCCP compliance, Serco is unable to accept resumes by email.
  
 
 
  Candidates may be asked to present proof of identify during the selection process. If requested, this will require presentation of a government-issued I.D. (with photo) with name and address that match the information entered on the application. Serco will not take possession of or retain/store the information provided as proof of identity. For more information on how Serco uses your information, please see our Applicant Privacy Policy and Notice.
  
 
 
  Serco does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies without being a contracted approved vendor. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Serco and will not be obligated to pay a placement or contract fee. If you are interested in becoming an approved vendor at Serco, please email Agencies@serco-na.com.
  
 
 
  Serco is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

d6970138daf0ebd4.title: Senior HPC and Storage Consultant (Remote)
d6970138daf0ebd4.desc:
BioTeam  is a well-established scientific computing consulting company that helps science and healthcare organizations cure diseases and save lives by making science and technology more accessible to them. If you are passionate about having an impact on science and helping make the world a better place, and you also like problem-solving and working in highly collaborative, diverse, and creative teams of people, BioTeam is the place for you. We’re a highly employee-centric company that values a diversity of backgrounds, experiences, and cultures and the strengths that those differences bring to us as a company and the solutions we come up with for our clients. Our work is challenging but satisfying, and we have fun doing it. All roles at BioTeam are client-facing and involve up to 25% overnight domestic travel (expect 4-5 days of travel per month). 
 
  Working at the intersection of science, data, and advanced technology, BioTeam helps accelerate science by offering strategic and transformational professional services that support modern data-intensive research. Our clients hire us when they aren’t sure what to do next, making our engagements interesting, unique, challenging, and highly compelling. We offer services that cover advanced infrastructure for science, data science and strategy, software and analytics for science (including AI), and data production in laboratories. 
 
  BioTeam is a mission-driven company that highly values its clients and works with them as strategic partners to help them succeed. We focus primarily on life sciences, biomedicine, and healthcare, with a client list that includes government agencies, Fortune 500 pharmaceutical and biotech companies, as well as leading hospitals and research labs across the country. For more information about BioTeam and to see examples of our work, visit bioteam.net. 
 
  Our goal is to make our employees feel taken care of: 
 
 Competitive base:  $140,000 - $155,000  (with potential for a bonus) 
 
 
 Completely virtual organization, which means you can work remotely from your  home office  (when not traveling to client sites) * 
 Opportunity to contribute significantly to a growing company with the potential for growth to a senior or leadership role 
 100% of your health & dental premiums for you & your family covered, effective day one 
 100% of your short-term, long-term disability and life insurance covered 
 Employer contributes annually to 401K, effective day one 
 
 
 BioTeam's roles are remote and can be filled within any of the following states: CA, CO, DC, FL, MA, MD, MO, NC, NH, NY, NJ, PA, TN, TX, WA, VA. 
 
 
  Job Summary 
 
  Are you a technology expert passionate about modernizing IT infrastructure to support life sciences and biomedical and clinical research? Do you love solving complex technical and organizational challenges collaboratively with clients and team members? Do you enjoy leading diverse teams of smart and creative people? BioTeam has an exciting opportunity for you as a  Senior HPC and Storage Consultant ! 
 
  As a Senior HPC and Storage Consultant, you'll lead the development and implementation of cutting-edge, science-driven, on-premises and hybrid high-performance computing (HPC) and storage technology solutions for our clients. From pre-sales scoping to assessment, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance, you'll help clients achieve their scientific mission with objective, best-fit infrastructure for science. 
 
  To excel in this role, you'll need to be a subject matter expert in HPC, and scientific storage and computing practices. You'll work closely with clients to discover requirements and design, deploy, and manage high-performance computing (HPC) and storage systems, scientific networks, processes, and other relevant computing infrastructure. Your deep curiosity about the latest advances in biomedical science and prior experience designing and managing science-focused HPC, storage, and computing systems are key. 
 
  If you're passionate about collaboratively solving complex problems that advance science with custom technology solutions, apply now for the Senior HPC and Storage Consultant role at BioTeam! 
 
  Key Responsibilities 
 
  Technical Expectations 
 
 Develop solutions to address scientific computing needs using on-premises, cloud, or hybrid HPC, storage, and networking technologies 
 Communicate scientific computing and storage design practices to help guide and influence scientific practices 
 Use modern HPC and storage design practices, including composable infrastructure patterns, environmental controls, and provisioning best practices 
 Train scientists and technical professionals on HPC and storage concepts and best practices related to scientific computing 
 Participate in internal knowledge sharing through discussion, guidance, presentations, and documentation 
 Provide thought leadership to the industry in the form of blog postings, whitepapers, and speaking engagements 
 
 Consulting Expectations 
 
 Act as an HPC and storage subject matter expert to provide project strategy and support deliverables on multiple concurrent projects 
 Participate in initial technical review calls and clarify specific requirements for each project, including project scope and objectives, budget, determining the necessary project resources, and technical feasibility 
 Lead or participate in the drafting of project proposals and manage the lifecycle of internal and client document review until the proposal is approved 
 Work highly collaboratively with client stakeholders and team members throughout consulting projects 
 Ensure successful delivery of solutions that meet client expectations 
 Act as the technical point of contact for clients ensuring communication throughout the implementation and execution of a project 
 
 
 
  Background and Experience 
 
 
 
  Degree in science or engineering fields, with a preference for a focus on scientific computing for life sciences, bioinformatics, or a related discipline; graduate degree preferred or a combination of education and experience 
 8+  years of hands-on experience in designing, deploying, and managing HPC and scientific storage 
 Extensive experience leading complex scientific IT projects and project teams 
 Passion for technology & science with a desire to stay up to date on the state-of-the-art in your field 
 Excellent communication skills and the demonstrated ability to build rapport with both external clients and internal team members 
 Organizational and time management skills with exceptional follow-through 
 Proactive and innovative, able to adapt to change quickly 
 Ability to quickly assess and adapt to the various needs of a diverse stakeholder population 
 Experience and desire to work remotely with approximately 25% overnight travel 
 Must be currently authorized to work in the United States and have or be able to qualify for government and customer security clearance 
 
 
 
  Work Environment 
  This job operates in an office environment, both in shared and home locations. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines. 
 
 
  Physical Demands 
  This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to move files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand as necessary. 
 
 
  The Company does not seek salary history information from applicants.  The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

60efc93cad757cb1.title: Senior Manager - Project Management, CPG Analytics experience
60efc93cad757cb1.desc:
Company Description
   Location: US-Remote 
  #REFID686316 
 
 
 
 Job Description
   In 100 countries around the world, NielsenIQ provides clients the most complete understanding of how the FMCG market evolves and what consumers buy. As a global leader in measurement and information, we believe providing our clients a precise understanding of the consumer is the key to making the right decisions - decisions that can lead to profitable growth. At NielsenIQ, we’re always innovating to keep pace with emerging market trends and the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer. 
  The primary role of the RTM (Route to Market Americas) Senior Manager is to lead client engagements which deliver analytics solutions for NielsenIQ client organizations. This includes delivering insights, recommendations and tools to our clients related to pricing, promotion, distribution and/or merchandising strategies and executional tactics. The RTM Senior Manager will collaborate closely with account teams and the modeling COE to share project requirements and ensure success project delivery with powerful insights and recommendations. RTM projects include, but not limited to Forecasting, Test/Control analysis, Localization, Penetration, Trial Generation and Custom models. 
  The RTM Senior Manager will be responsible for all aspects of executing analytic engagements including conducting analysis of results, simulating client plans, creating deliverable materials, and supporting presentation/training/tool deliveries. This position is off-site and occasional travel may be required. 
 
  Responsibilities: 
 
  Lead the execution and delivery of analytic engagements to meet clients’ research objectives 
  Ensure pro-active insights and action-oriented solutions are delivered to the client by being an expert in your solutions and data/insight storytelling, with an ability to explain methodology behind all key analytical consulting to client 
  Manage timelines and priorities both internally and externally, sometimes consisting of moving targets and conflicting deadlines 
  Creatively find ways to enhance the capabilities of our team through process improvements, best practices, skills development/coaching or cross-functional initiatives 
  Drive client value through the successful implementation and ongoing usage/integration of analytic solutions 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications
  
 
  Expertise in manufacturer sales functions (Category Management, Key Account Analytics, Headquarters Sales, etc.) 
  Strong logic, deductive reasoning, problem solving and critical thinking skills 
  Skilled communicator, including group presentations and storytelling 
  Demonstrated mastery in data analysis & application to client business issues 
  Demonstrated strength in maintaining positive client relationships in complex situations & resolving client issues with the ability to interface with client executives (VPs, Directors, Account Leads, etc.) 
  Strong project management skills 
  People management skills to promote a positive work environment and associate skills development 
  Able to work collaboratively with internal & external teams 
  Strong sense of urgency and accountability to drive client outcomes 
  CPG industry knowledge, experience and acumen 
 
 
  Background and Technical Skills: 
 
  Bachelor's degree required 
  MBA or advanced/analytics degree preferred 
  8-10 years of relevant experience in Market Research, Consumer Packaged Goods, Consulting, Analytics, and/or Category Management 
  Strong analytic background and knowledge of statistical or data science methodologies and applications 
  Strong Marketing/Research background 
  Knowledge of NielsenIQ data assets desirable 
 
  Additional Information
  
  About NIQ 
  NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. 
  NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com. 
  Want to keep up with our latest updates? 
  Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook 
 
 
  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 
  NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. 
  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. 
  Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/ 
  NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

c9011a2799eaad19.title: Principal Product Manager - Consumer
c9011a2799eaad19.desc:
Job Profile: 
  
  Vista Tech  plays a vital role in the Vista group operations by delivering and accelerating comprehensive technology solutions across all brands. Vista’s end-to-end and click-to-flight solutions offer the industry's only comprehensive flight booking platform, seamlessly integrating global operations, and leveraging AI and machine learning to optimize pricing and fleet movement. Comprised of the Product Management, Engineering, and IT teams, Vista Tech’s mission is to enhance transparency and accessibility in private aviation through the development of the world's largest digital private aviation marketplace. In achieving this, Vista Tech always ensures the utmost safety and efficiency for FLIGHT CREW, EMPLOYEES and Members, while fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
  
 
 
  About the team 
  The Product Management team at VistaGlobal is a centralized function that includes Product, Data Science, And Analytics. We take ownership and are accountable for getting things done. Through curiosity, learning, and coaching, we grow as individuals and teams. As one of our product leaders says, We are a problem solving club. #One team
    This role sits close to the Sales growth and Lifecycle business team. This team is the heart of VistaGlobal working on membership growth, retention of the most demanding clients on the planet. As a Tech enabled business, we rely on technology to provide scalable solutions to future needs of the Sales & Client Services team to help delight our customers.
  
 
 
  What’s in it for you 
  We will never box you in a role - if you are hungry to solve problems, we have ample opportunities for you to grow. You will be working on some really challenging problems of the private aviation industry right from refining the customer journey with the client services team to launching internal platforms to enable the sales team. You will be working with Design, UX, Data Engineering, Data Science Team, Engineering, Product teams, Leaders from Sales & Marketing to convert ambiguity into structure. 
  Your Responsibilities: 
  
 Define strategies, develop product roadmap, write one pagers and Product Requirement documents to align stakeholders and lead successful execution of initiatives to enable lifecycle initiatives and Increase in Consumer engagement.  
 Partner with business teams to identify their pain points, convert into requirements, and collaborate with UX, Business, Data team to define an iterative solution to the problem statement.  
 Create user stories and provide other required input and direction to the engineering team; own the backlog and keep the team fully engaged building the highest priority features and enhancements. 
  Perform build vs buy analysis for critical tooling, and develop, integrate platforms to enable the Sales, and marketing team to delight our clients, fuel membership growth, increase customer retention.  
 Collaborate with the Data Engineering team to define data models, analytics reports, and Data Science team to answer questions to business problems. 
  Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience: 
  
 Minimum 5 years as a Product Manager at a technology enabled business company, ideally in a Growth focused role - you have a bias towards action.  
 Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets using SQL and experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI and Tableau. In short you are a data junkie and speak SQL as your second language.  
 Collaboration and teamwork with empathy and compassion is a must to Partner with various business teams and multi-functional analytics & reporting teams (Engagement & Retention, Finance, Engineering, Product, and Marketing) to understand the business use cases and help with product prioritization.  
 You are metric influenced and you have phenomenal communication and storytelling skills with data, with the ability to optimally navigate, mediate and cultivate partnership and consensus. 
  Experience building a product roadmap and working with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver exceptional business impact.  
 Analyze, quantify, and articulate trade-offs of product roadmap features Strong verbal communication and presentation skills to senior leaders and Business stakeholders. 
  Strong analytical skills with ability to query data from various systems to solve problems  
 Have written one pagers and PRDs to convert ambiguity into structure and align stakeholders. You excel at go to market strategies. 
 
 
 
  Bonus Points:  
 
 
 Know how of AI/ML  
 If you have worked at a growth role before MBA Preferred or Mathematics or Statistics or Engineering as one of your degrees 
  Experience working on: Braze, Marketing Cloud, SFDC Sales and opportunity management , SAP order to cash process, Tableau, Oracle BI, Segment.io, Snowflakes  
 Experience working at a consulting company such as McKinsey, BCG, Bain, PWC, KPMG etc.

88219cdd22c768c4.title: Senior Program Manager, Instructional Systems Design (remote)
88219cdd22c768c4.desc:
This is a remote position. 
  Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our teams use modern, agile methods to meet the needs of our users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government. 
  Work on things that matter 
  Our teams connect Veterans with services designed for their needs, help millions of people access affordable health care, and support important programs like Head Start. As we work with agencies to deliver critical services, we're also changing how the government thinks about and uses technology. 
  Built for a remote life 
  Ad Hoc is remote-first and remote-always. We've designed our culture, communications, and tools to support a nationwide team. Being remote allows Ad Hoc to bring the best people onto our teams and give them the freedom to create a work environment that fits their lives. Maybe you need to adjust your schedule to care for your family or take a bike ride. At Ad Hoc, that's welcomed. 
  Committed to high expectations and a welcoming culture 
  Ad Hoc values acceptance, accountability, and humility. We aren't heroes. We leave our egos at the door to learn from our mistakes and improve the process for the next time.. We build small, inclusive teams to bring the best of consumer technology to the problems of government. 
  The  Federal Civilian  business unit supports a wide range of customers that span the federal, commercial, and nonprofit space. Our customers include the General Services Administration, Office of Personnel Management, PAN Foundation, Library of Congress, Social Security Administration, Health and Human Services, and the USDA Forest Service. We partner with these agencies to build new capabilities, deliver products, establish data as a strategic asset for informed decision-making, modernize legacy systems, and build the digital service infrastructure necessary to scale their mission impact. 
  At Ad Hoc, Program Managers are responsible for end-to-end management of a program and/or a suite of projects. This includes client relationship management, high quality and on time delivery, personnel management, financial management, contract management and organic program growth. You'll ensure that the assigned program has everything it needs to be successful. 
  Primary Responsibilities: 
  As a Senior Program Manager, you are the primary decision maker for the program or portfolio of programs. You will collaborate with business unit leadership in shaping the strategic direction of the program/portfolio and managing customer relationships. A Senior Program Manager is a people manager, leader and mentor that effectively manages team members in support of delivery success. You will have extensive experience in implementing structured project management/process methodologies in order to meet scope, schedule and budget requirements. You will successfully lead through direct reports, and effectively communicate and execute against program and organizational objectives. A Senior Program Manager must exhibit strong communication skills, with the ability to lead and resolve conflict in order to meet revenue goals, while ensuring contractual compliance. Primary expectations of a Senior Program Manager include: 
 
 Manages all aspects of program performance (i.e. technical, contractual, administrative, financial) and coordinating program activities across multiple projects 
 Experienced in the ability to manage planned contract revenue, billable utilization, and gross margin achievement 
 Cultivates strong customer relationships to understand needs, maximize customer satisfaction, and communicate overall project status, as well as drive innovation 
 Communicates with stakeholders to address changes to program scope, timeline, or budget. Advanced experience with change management best practices. 
 Exhibits extensive influential skills to translate customer vision and drive project activities to successful outcomes. Extensive ability to shape customer success outcomes and metrics. 
 Employs a "big picture" strategic vision; organizing people, technology, culture, and operations to drive solutions to significantly complex business problems 
 Extensive ability to manage contractual obligations and oversee and manage output of sub contracting partners 
 Proactively recognizes issues and conflicts and problem solve solutions, strategically turning barriers into opportunities 
 Manages effective communication work flows, leveraging Project Managers (if applicable) to communicate information effectively 
 Negotiates outcomes and agreements that benefit the project and company 
 Extensive ability to partner with practice and growth leaders to identify and drive organic and new growth opportunities. Extensive ability to develop strategic program plans that benefit the organization over the long term. 
 Effectively identifies program risks, implements, and manages mitigation techniques in a timely manner 
 Extensive knowledge of and adherence to ISO and CMMI quality standards 
 Trusted ability to achieve CPARS ratings above Satisfactory 
 Superior organizational and time-management skills, as well as communication skills 
 Extensive ability to earn trust and respect from team members, and influence decisions that need to be made to make the project successful 
 Extensive experience with Agile project management methodology and project management tools and software 
 Prior government or government contracting experience 
 Responsible for hiring, performance management, timecard reviews, PTO management and team development 
 
 Basic Qualifications:   
 
 Active or ability to obtain a Secret Clearance 
 Bachelor's Degree 
 Minimum of 10 years of experience with technical training, instructional design, or training facilitation 
 Minimum of 5+ years of people management experience 
 Experience implementing Enterprise Project Management COE to help instill and institutionalize Project Management processes and reduce project risks across an entire portfolio 
 Proven ability to introduce Project Management processes including Issue Management, Change Management, Change Control, Quality Assurance, and other industry best practices 
 Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or ITIL certified 
 Agile certification required (PMI-Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), AgilePM Foundation, ICAgile Certified Professional (ICP), Certified Scrum Master, SAFe Agilist, etc.) 
 Prior government or government contracting experience 
 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
 Data Analytic Training Curriculum Development, Delivery and Evaluation 
 Agile Project Management 
 Data Analysis 
 Data Engineering 
 Data Science 
 Databricks 
 Decision analysis and support 
 Microsoft Azure or AWS Cloud environments 
 Python, Spark, an/or Presto/Trino 
 Experience with Columnar-Oriented Formats (e.g., Avro, Parquet) in cloud storage. 
 
 
 
  To learn more about working at Ad Hoc, please visit:  https://adhocteam.us/join/ 
  Benefits 
 
 Company-subsidized Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance 
 Use What You Need Vacation Policy 
 401K with employer match 
 Paid parental leave after one year of service 
 and much more! 
 
 Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, pregnancy, disability, work-related injury, covered veteran status, political ideology, marital status, or any other factor that the law protects from employment discrimination. 
  Ad Hoc job descriptions feature the starting range we reasonably expect to pay to candidates who would join our team with little to no need for training on the responsibilities we've outlined above. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide range of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and responsibility. The range of starting pay for this role is $120,000.00 - $150,00.00 and information on benefits offered is here. Our recruiters will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements. 
  Job Reference 2109

b3125c86c36a6dfb.title: Clinical Research Associate II, Cardiovascular Internal Medicine, East USA, IQVIA Biotech
b3125c86c36a6dfb.desc:
I
  
 
   QVIA Biotech, a global full service CRO providing flexible, tailored, integrated clinical solutions to smaller biotech companies, is seeking an experienced Senior Clinical Research Associate on the East Coast, US with:
  
 
 
  3+ years of field monitoring experience 
  Cardiovascular, Renal, Metabolic experience required 
  Obesity experience preferred 
 
 
 
    BASIC FUNCTIONS:
   
 
 
    Participates in the preparation and execution of Phase I-IV clinical trials. Oversees the progress of clinical investigations by conducting site evaluation, initiation, and interim close out visits to sites. Monitors clinical trials in accordance with Good Clinical Practices and procedures set forth by IQVIA Biotech and sponsors. Works closely with the Clinical Trial Manager (CTM) and/or Lead CRA t0 ensure all monitoring activities are conducted according to study requirements. The Senior CRA may also serve in the Lead CRA role.
   
 
 
    ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
   
 
  Participates in the investigator recruitment process. Performs site evaluation visits of potential investigators. Evaluates the capability of the site to successfully manage and conduct the clinical study. 
 
 
  Collaborates with the ISS department to coordinate activities with the site in preparation for the initiation of the study. Obtains regulatory documentation for successful implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of clinical trials. Works with ISS and site staff to obtain regulatory (IRB/IEC) approval of study specific documents 
 
 
  Performs study initiation activities, reviewing with the site personnel the protocol, regulatory issues, study procedures, and provides training on completion of the eCRF; monitoring activities and study close-out activities. 
  Trains site staff on the EDC system and verifies site computer system. 
  Assists in resolving any issues to ensure compliance with site file audits in conjunction with ISS. 
  Assures adherence to Good Clinical Practices, investigator integrity, and compliance with all study procedures through on-site monitoring visits. Performs validation of source documentation as required by sponsor. Prepares monitoring reports and letters per the timelines defined in IQVIA Biotech SOPs by using approved IQVIA Biotech/sponsor templates and reports. 
  Documents accountability, stability and storage conditions of clinical trial materials as required by sponsor. Performs investigational product inventory. Ensures return of unused materials to designated location or verifies destruction as required. 
  Reviews the quality and integrity of the clinical data through (1) in house review of electronic CRF data and (2) on-site source verification. Works with sites to resolve data queries. 
  May review protocols, eCRFs, study manuals and other related documents, as requested by the Clinical Trial Manager and/or Lead CRA. 
  Serves as primary contact between IQVIA Biotech and investigator; coordinates all correspondence; ensures timely transmission of clinical data with the study site and technical reporting, as requested. 
  Performs study close-out visits per the study specific Clinical Monitoring Plan including final investigational product reconciliation and disposition, site study file reconciliation, data query resolution through to database lock and resolution of outstanding action items. 
  Assists with, and attends, Investigator Meetings for assigned studies. 
  Authorized to request site audits due to data integrity concerns. 
  Attends study-related, company, departmental, and external meetings, as required. 
  Ensures internal and study-related trainings are completed per IQVIA Biotech and/or study timelines; CTMS should always be current with the pertinent site updates/contacts. 
  Ensures all study deliverables are completed per IQVIA Biotech and study timelines 
  Conducts Field Evaluation Visits and field training of CRA Is, IIs and other Sr. CRAs. 
  Serves as mentor for junior CRAs and those new to the company and/or study. 
  Performs other duties, as requested. 
 
 
 
    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
   
 
  Strong knowledge of clinical research process, including working knowledge of all functional areas of clinical trials and medical terminology. 
  Four+ years of oncology experience and/or medical device. 
  Experience in monitoring and/or coordinating clinical trials required. 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to express complex ideas to study personnel at research and clinical institutions. 
  Demonstrated ability to form strong functional relationships. 
  Excellent, presentation, organizational and interpersonal skills. 
  Ability to interact with all levels of staff to coordinate/execute study activities. 
  Ability to handle several priorities within multiple, complex trials. 
  Ability to reason independently and recommend specific solutions in clinical settings. 
  Ability to work independently, prioritize, and work within a matrix team environment. 
  Ability to mentor other CRAs and co-monitor, as required. 
  Knowledge of electronic data capture including basic data processing functions. 
  Knowledge of current GCP/ICH guidelines applicable to the conduct of clinical research. 
  Able to qualify for a major credit card, rent an automobile 
  For the Technical CTM role, the CRA must have a deep understanding of IQVIA Biotech systems with the ability to learn even more. 
 
 
 
    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
   
 
  Very limited physical effort required to perform normal job duties 
  Extensive use of telephone and face-to-face communication requiring accurate perception of speech 
  Extensive use of keyboard requiring repetitive motion of fingers 
  Regular sitting for extended periods of time 
 
 
 
    MINIMUM RECRUITMENT STANDARDS:
   
 
  BS/BA/BSc (or equivalent) in one of the life sciences or health care background (RPh, RN, etc) and a minimum of four (4) years of monitoring/site management experience is required; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience. 
  Prior Clinical Research Organization (CRO) experience preferred. 
  Prior project team leadership experience preferred. 
  Working knowledge of budget management preferred. 
  Must be able to travel domestically and internationally approximately 65%-85%. 
  Valid driver’s license 
  Computer skills including proficiency in use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and use of a laptop computer 
 
 
 
    #LI-Remote
   
 
    #CRAIBAJD
   
 
 
 
   IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at 
   
   https://jobs.iqvia.com
   
 
 
 
   We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. 
   
   https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe
   
 
 
 
   As the COVID-19 virus continues to evolve, IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding vaccination status. 
   
   https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status

9abde35df377ecc2.title: Senior Program Manager, Instructional Systems Design (remote)
9abde35df377ecc2.desc:
This is a remote position. 
  Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our teams use modern, agile methods to meet the needs of our users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government. 
  Work on things that matter 
  Our teams connect Veterans with services designed for their needs, help millions of people access affordable health care, and support important programs like Head Start. As we work with agencies to deliver critical services, we're also changing how the government thinks about and uses technology. 
  Built for a remote life 
  Ad Hoc is remote-first and remote-always. We've designed our culture, communications, and tools to support a nationwide team. Being remote allows Ad Hoc to bring the best people onto our teams and give them the freedom to create a work environment that fits their lives. Maybe you need to adjust your schedule to care for your family or take a bike ride. At Ad Hoc, that's welcomed. 
  Committed to high expectations and a welcoming culture 
  Ad Hoc values acceptance, accountability, and humility. We aren't heroes. We leave our egos at the door to learn from our mistakes and improve the process for the next time.. We build small, inclusive teams to bring the best of consumer technology to the problems of government. 
  The  Federal Civilian  business unit supports a wide range of customers that span the federal, commercial, and nonprofit space. Our customers include the General Services Administration, Office of Personnel Management, PAN Foundation, Library of Congress, Social Security Administration, Health and Human Services, and the USDA Forest Service. We partner with these agencies to build new capabilities, deliver products, establish data as a strategic asset for informed decision-making, modernize legacy systems, and build the digital service infrastructure necessary to scale their mission impact. 
  At Ad Hoc, Program Managers are responsible for end-to-end management of a program and/or a suite of projects. This includes client relationship management, high quality and on time delivery, personnel management, financial management, contract management and organic program growth. You'll ensure that the assigned program has everything it needs to be successful. 
  Primary Responsibilities: 
  As a Senior Program Manager, you are the primary decision maker for the program or portfolio of programs. You will collaborate with business unit leadership in shaping the strategic direction of the program/portfolio and managing customer relationships. A Senior Program Manager is a people manager, leader and mentor that effectively manages team members in support of delivery success. You will have extensive experience in implementing structured project management/process methodologies in order to meet scope, schedule and budget requirements. You will successfully lead through direct reports, and effectively communicate and execute against program and organizational objectives. A Senior Program Manager must exhibit strong communication skills, with the ability to lead and resolve conflict in order to meet revenue goals, while ensuring contractual compliance. Primary expectations of a Senior Program Manager include: 
 
 Manages all aspects of program performance (i.e. technical, contractual, administrative, financial) and coordinating program activities across multiple projects 
 Experienced in the ability to manage planned contract revenue, billable utilization, and gross margin achievement 
 Cultivates strong customer relationships to understand needs, maximize customer satisfaction, and communicate overall project status, as well as drive innovation 
 Communicates with stakeholders to address changes to program scope, timeline, or budget. Advanced experience with change management best practices. 
 Exhibits extensive influential skills to translate customer vision and drive project activities to successful outcomes. Extensive ability to shape customer success outcomes and metrics. 
 Employs a "big picture" strategic vision; organizing people, technology, culture, and operations to drive solutions to significantly complex business problems 
 Extensive ability to manage contractual obligations and oversee and manage output of sub contracting partners 
 Proactively recognizes issues and conflicts and problem solve solutions, strategically turning barriers into opportunities 
 Manages effective communication work flows, leveraging Project Managers (if applicable) to communicate information effectively 
 Negotiates outcomes and agreements that benefit the project and company 
 Extensive ability to partner with practice and growth leaders to identify and drive organic and new growth opportunities. Extensive ability to develop strategic program plans that benefit the organization over the long term. 
 Effectively identifies program risks, implements, and manages mitigation techniques in a timely manner 
 Extensive knowledge of and adherence to ISO and CMMI quality standards 
 Trusted ability to achieve CPARS ratings above Satisfactory 
 Superior organizational and time-management skills, as well as communication skills 
 Extensive ability to earn trust and respect from team members, and influence decisions that need to be made to make the project successful 
 Extensive experience with Agile project management methodology and project management tools and software 
 Prior government or government contracting experience 
 Responsible for hiring, performance management, timecard reviews, PTO management and team development 
 
 Basic Qualifications:   
 
 Active or ability to obtain a Secret Clearance 
 Bachelor's Degree 
 Minimum of 10 years of experience with technical training, instructional design, or training facilitation 
 Minimum of 5+ years of people management experience 
 Experience implementing Enterprise Project Management COE to help instill and institutionalize Project Management processes and reduce project risks across an entire portfolio 
 Proven ability to introduce Project Management processes including Issue Management, Change Management, Change Control, Quality Assurance, and other industry best practices 
 Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or ITIL certified 
 Agile certification required (PMI-Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), AgilePM Foundation, ICAgile Certified Professional (ICP), Certified Scrum Master, SAFe Agilist, etc.) 
 Prior government or government contracting experience 
 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 
 Data Analytic Training Curriculum Development, Delivery and Evaluation 
 Agile Project Management 
 Data Analysis 
 Data Engineering 
 Data Science 
 Databricks 
 Decision analysis and support 
 Microsoft Azure or AWS Cloud environments 
 Python, Spark, an/or Presto/Trino 
 Experience with Columnar-Oriented Formats (e.g., Avro, Parquet) in cloud storage. 
 
 
 
  To learn more about working at Ad Hoc, please visit:  https://adhocteam.us/join/ 
  Benefits

 Use What You Need Vacation Policy 
 401K with employer match

 and much more!
