26a6f6ee16624836.title: PBM Campaign Strategist (New Client Disruption Analysis SQL)
26a6f6ee16624836.desc:
Optum is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start   Caring. Connecting. Growing together. 
  You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. 
  This position supports Disruption Analysis, Medicare Part D analysis, Specialty Transition reports and letters, as well as, continuation of therapy for new implementing and existing health plan complex clients within OptumRx. The Campaign Strategist handles disruption projects and will build quality control, execute campaigns, set timelines, assists in strategic direction, handle issue migration and technical design as well as participate in client meetings to gather requirements and advise on disruption analysis. 
 
 
  Primary Responsibilities: 
 
 Executing and tracking member formulary communications 
 Executing and tracking outbound communications, utilizing the Unica technology platform 
 Anticipates customer needs and proactively develops solutions to meet them 
 Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues 
 Solves moderately complex problems and develops innovative solutions 
 Translates concepts into practice 
 Identifies solutions to non-standard requests and problems 
 May lead functional or segment teams or projects 
 Provides explanations and information to others on difficult issues 
 Follow best practices for outbound communications 
 Work within cross - functional teams, using data and analytics and technologies to drive decisioning 
 Utilize excellent organizational skills to manage multiple projects, under quick deadlines and be able to respond quickly and accurately to change 
 Generally, work is self - directed and not prescribed 
 Works with less structured, more complex issues 
 Serves as a resource to others with less experience 
 Coaches, provides feedback, and guides others 
 
 
  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. 
  Required Qualifications: 
 
 Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience 
 2+ years of experience with Marketing automation or Campaign execution 
 2+ years of experience with SQL (intermediate/advanced SQL skills) 
 1+ years of experience with Unica and other business intelligence tools 
 Experience working with business requirements to drive data analysis/ interpretation/application 
 Experience communicating with Marketing and Business leaders 
 Experience working with standard business applications, Microsoft Office Suite 
 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications: 
 
 Associates Degree, Bachelor's Degree or higher education 
 Experience in Customer Segmentation and Campaign Design 
 Experience with Azure environment 
 Experience with healthcare system and healthcare claims data 
 Experience with pharmacy benefits 
 Possess a balance of analytical and strategic problem-solving skills, while being focused on producing and executing high quality outbound communications 
 
 
 California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only:  The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island or Washington residents is $67,800 to $133,100. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. 
 
 
 
 All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy 
 
 
 
  At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes - an enterprise priority reflected in our mission. 
 
    Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. 
 
 
  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

7639fae6db6a227d.title: Financial Planning and Analysis Consultant - Pharmacy (Remote)
7639fae6db6a227d.desc:
Resp & Qualifications   
 PURPOSE:  The Financial Planning & Analysis Consultant will play a critical role in the analysis of pharmacy-related financials and successful execution of financial implementation and oversight of CareFirst's pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) contract. The role is part of the FP&A corporate finance team; supports leaders by reporting on, reviewing, and projecting financial performance; partners with business stakeholders to gather and vet data, projection assumptions and underlying rationale.      ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 
  Responsible to partner with and support pharmacy and finance leaders for development and analytical review of quarterly forecasting, annual planning, and multi-year business plan development. Partner with business stakeholders, including Pharmacy Management, Actuarial and FP&A teams, to gather and vet projection assumptions and underlying rationale. 
  Advises business unit leaders on strategic fiscal matters related to pharmacy financial management throughout the organization. Participate in regular meetings with leadership to review financial results in their area and act as an internal consultant on interpreting financial results, analyzing variances and improving performance. 
  Storyboard presentations and develop decks related to project outputs and other relevant topics for executive level presentation. Produce monthly financial reports for leadership audiences summarizing key financial drivers for the month at both a consolidated and segment-level. 
  Support the development of strategies and tools for re-engineering of financial processes including developing new performance metrics and profitability measurements while creating detailed driver-based financial models for new business opportunities. Informs strategic financial planning by performing and evaluating financial, utilization and benchmark analytics. 
  Conduct ad hoc financial analysis and market research to support projects. Develop financial models related to cost models and business decision making. Critically examine the opportunities, alternatives, and financial investment to make a recommendation for the best course of action that will create business value. 
  Supports the development of work plans to meet business priorities and deadlines; ensuring team follows all procedures and policies; collaborating cross-functionally to make effective business decisions; escalating high priority issues and risks as appropriate; and recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities. 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS:     Education Level:  Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Business Administration or related field. In lieu of a Bachelor's degree, an additional 4 years of relevant work experience is required in addition to the required work experience.     Experience:  8 years experience in a finance or analytical role within the finance sector or quantitative analysis.     Preferred Qualifications: 
 
  MBA/MS, preferably in a quantitative and analytical discipline. 
  Specific experience building Excel-based financial models. 
  Understanding of healthcare marketplace dynamics and healthcare financial and operational reporting. 
 
  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs) 
 
  Ability to manage long-term projects meeting deadlines and ensuring compliance. 
  Ability to prepare ad-hoc analysis, experience studies and reports. 
  Must demonstrate flexibility, innovation and problem-solving skills and resourcefulness. 
  Ability to express technical and financial analysis in a clear, concise manner on both written and oral form. 
  Strong mathematical acumen with a solid understanding of financial and accounting principles. 
  Excellent communication and influencing skills, able to interface with senior leaders in the business 
  Proficient in Excel, VBA, PowerPoint, and data analysis software (e.g., SAS, Access). 
  Good analytical skills, highly detail oriented and a thorough understanding of general economic theory as it relates to the lending and business environment. 
  Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging. 
 
  Salary Range: $93,456 - $185,614

 Salary will be based on education, location, experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, CareFirst offers benefits such as a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).

Designing and producing datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools. Performing research and analyzing data related to the division*s strategic initiatives and broader research needs. Interfacing between the business and divisional data teams to design and generate tools to be leveraged in building analysis and reports which are actionable within the business environment. Working closely with customers to build strategic relationships; and continuously gaining a deeper understanding of the division*s data in order to meet business needs. Analyzing complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide strategic business insight to decision-makers. Identifying and interpreting trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.

db4886ff15e55ef3.title: Clinical Research Coordinator-Remote
db4886ff15e55ef3.desc:
Under the supervision of the Associate Director of Clinical Research Operations., the Remote Clinical Research Coordinator (RCRC) will perform entry-level duties related to the support and coordination of clinical studies, primarily related to cardiovascular health studies.   
  The RCRC will have the opportunity to contribute to research projects including:  
 1) a clinical trial of digital blood pressure and heart rate monitoring in patients 
  2) real time auscultation of blood pressure values using advanced technology 
  3) Other human studies aimed at validating cardiovascular based Software as a Medical Device (SaMD)    May be responsible for the coordination of one or more single or multi-site, active or follow-up clinical trials; help prepare protocols for study initiation; help design flow sheets, data forms and source documents; gather and interpret medical history and vital signs data regarding clinical trial subjects; may apply understanding of inclusion/exclusion eligibility criteria for protocols; help recruit, enroll, register, schedule and retain study subjects; record protocol specific treatments and assure collection of study data; assist research personnel to keep patients on study schedules; complete study forms; collect, enter and clean data into study databases, maintaining data quality; assist with data analysis; assist with preparation of reports and tables; attend team meetings; and perform other duties as assigned. 
  The RCRC is responsible for ensuring study activities are conducted appropriately and accurately based on the IRB approved clinical study protocol. 
  MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
  Review and auscultation of cardiovascular data to determine blood pressure measurements 
  Screen for potential subjects based on protocol specific inclusion and exclusion protocol eligibility requirements.  
  Actively discuss research studies with potential study participants including possible risks and benefits of study participation, required study visits and procedures, and the participants’ rights as a research subject.  
  Assist the principal investigator in obtaining informed consent form potential study participants. 
  Collect data on study participants including direct subject communication, collecting data from medical records and documenting data in electronic or paper case report forms. 
  Attend meetings as needed 
  Manages conduct of experimental tests and procedures, per study protocol 
  Ensure procedural adherence to the study protocol 
  Other duties and projects as assigned. 
 
   
 Qualifications for Remote Clinical Research Coordinator 
 
  HS graduation/AA/Medical/Technical School or 3 years of research and/or healthcare experience recommended 
  Demonstrated skills to successfully preform the assigned tasks and responsibilities or equivalent combination of experience and training 
  Attention to details 
  Previous experience obtaining vital signs specifically manual blood pressure measurements and calculations 
  Working knowledge of computers and software-based applications including proficiency with Microsoft Word and power point. 
  Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team-based environment 
  Ability to prioritize tasks and meet multiple deadlines on concurrent projects 
  Experience conducting clinical research trials and following study protocols 
  Ability to assess a specific study protocol requirements and develop tactical study procedures. 
  Ability to use and navigate with electronic data capture (EDC) systems 
 
   
 Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

5b243673f1ddb451.title: Academic Research Analyst (Remote)
5b243673f1ddb451.desc:
EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. 
  
 
 Academic Research Analyst 
 
 
 
    Job Summary:
   
 
    The Academic Research Analyst will be responsible for analyzing, presenting, and interpreting data on research published within the disciplines of economics, political science, philosophy, law, and history. This individual has data literacy, the ability to recognize patterns, analytical and critical thinking skills, and knowledge of the Academy.
   
 
 
 
    Supervisory Responsibilities:
   
 
 None. 
 
 Duties/Responsibilities: 
 
 Evaluating and collecting data on IHS programs (funding, conferences, seminars) to understand their efficacy. 
 Being customer-focused by developing products that meet customer needs, communicating research outcomes, and maintaining communication with them throughout the process. 
 Utilize new data tools to conduct retrospective analysis on different metrics. 
 Innovate with new data sources to increase our ability to assess multiple parts of the academic impact story. 
 Innovate with our present tools to find new uses and to continually improve data utilization in organizational decision-making. 
 
 
 
 
    Required Skills/Qualifications:
   
 
 A BA or BS degree in social science, data science, or a comparable field. 
 
 Additional training or education is a plus. 
 
 Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills. 
 A demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, and handle and prioritize simultaneous requests. 
 Demonstrable ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing with all levels of the organization. 
 Ability to critically evaluate and prioritize information gathered from multiple sources and reconcile conflicts. 
 A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex processes. 
 A curious nature with a strong drive to learn and grow. 
 
 
   Desirable Skills/Qualifications:
   
 
 Able to effectively compose analyses and reports. 
 Data literacy with statistics knowledge a plus. 
 Familiarity with Salesforce (or comparable CRM system) and Excel. 
 Basic knowledge of classical liberal ideas. 
 Basic knowledge of Academic Research. 
 Willingness to learn additional data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R. 
 
 
 
 
 About the Institute for Humane Studies at George Mason University: 
 
 
   The Institute for Humane Studies (IHS) supports and partners with university professors working within the classical liberal intellectual tradition. Our vision is that higher education becomes a place where the open exchange of ideas flourishes, and where ideas within the classical liberal tradition are regularly taught, discussed, challenged, and developed so that they inform scholarly and public discourse on the key challenges facing a free society.
   
 
 
   
 
 
   Each year, IHS provides thousands of aspiring and established professors graduate student fellowships, career development support, research funding, and support for on-campus student programs. Most importantly, through its scholarly convenings IHS connects these scholars to one another to form a diverse and growing community of thought leaders advancing ideas essential to the good society—a pluralistic and tolerant society in which individuals and communities flourish in a context of openness, dignity, equality, and freedom.
    
 
 
 
 
 Benefits: 
 
 
   We have a flexible, professional, open office environment that encourages innovation and entrepreneurship and provides substantial opportunity for professional growth. Salary is competitive and will be commensurate with experience. IHS provides exceptional benefits to all employees, including health and dental insurance coverage (which includes paying 100% of the health and dental insurance premium for individuals), health savings accounts, long-term disability and life insurance, a 403(b) retirement savings program, a parking permit and 12 free tuition credit hours annually at George Mason University.

9bf00990dc7d9ce2.title: Mining Operations Specialist
9bf00990dc7d9ce2.desc:
Mining Operations Specialist 
 ABOUT US BITCOIN CORP 
 Imagine the ultimate destination for those who want to work at the cutting edge of technology, energy, and infrastructure. An industry leader in bitcoin mining, US Bitcoin Corp (USBTC) builds and operates some of the world’s largest data centers for next-generation computing workloads. We are proud to offer interesting and challenging opportunities for individuals who want to build teams, solve problems, and make an impact from day one. If you’re an ambitious individual looking for a career that is as rewarding as it is challenging, you’ve come to the right place. 
 ABOUT THE ROLE 
 As a Mining Operations Specialist at US Bitcoin, your primary responsibility is to oversee and optimize the performance of our mining facilities, ensuring maximum hashrate efficiency. This role encompasses a wide range of digital and mining-related tasks, including network management, cybersecurity, system monitoring, configuration, and reporting. 
 In this position, you will act as a central hub for the company, diligently monitoring multiple data streams to identify and resolve issues. Your role is critical in supporting and enhancing the overall operational efficiency of our mining infrastructure by developing and implementing systems to further increase hashrate efficiency. 
 Some of the key responsibilities you should expect are the following: 
 
 Utilizing the company's miner monitoring and management system to supervise mining operations effectively 
 Analyzing multiple data sources to identify factors that may negatively impact operational efficiency 
 Designing and refining processes related to the deployment, management, and maintenance of mining equipment in order to boost hashrate 
 Training onsite teams to effectively use established processes and tools for optimal mining performance 
 Gathering data and generating reports to support informed decision-making within the company 
 Designing and implementing solutions related to networking, cybersecurity, and software architectures to enhance the overall mining infrastructure 
 And other duties as assigned 
 
 ABOUT YOU 
 
 A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, or a related field. Relevant experience in the field may be considered in lieu of a formal degree 
 Demonstrated problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues 
 Strong knowledge of networking, cybersecurity, and software architectures 
 Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation, with experience in using data visualization tools or monitoring systems 
 Prior experience in cryptocurrency mining, blockchain technology, or working with mining hardware and software preferred 
 Familiarity with process development, deployment, and management of technical equipment 
 Excellent communication skills to effectively train and guide onsite teams and collaborate with various stakeholders within the company 
 
 ABOUT THE WORK ENVIRONMENT 
 This role is remote or in office at our corporate headquarters in the Brickell area of Miami, Florida. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

a71ced44121656c7.title: Healthcare Technical Engineer
a71ced44121656c7.desc:
PRACTICE OVERVIEW 
 Radiology Partners is the largest and fastest growing on-site radiology practice in the US. We are an innovative practice focused on transforming how radiologists provide consistently exceptional services to hospitals, imaging centers, referring physicians and patients. With our state-of-the art clinical technology, specialized expertise, access to capital, and retention of top physician talent, Radiology Partners reliably exceeds the expectations of our clients, patients, and partners. We serve our clients with an operational focus, and, above all, a commitment to quality patient care. Our mission is To Transform Radiology. 
 POSITION SUMMARY 
 Radiology Partners is seeking a Technical Engineer II to develop Billing and Interface Integrations that manage and develop data processes for multiple sites within the revenue division. This role is responsible for requirements gathering, data analysis, system configuration and interface development using a business rules engine and technical tools. This role is also responsible for having a strong knowledge of processes and troubleshooting technical issues. This position works closely with both the IT and RCM teams to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and alignment across the practice. 
 POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
 Manage billing system configuration for new and existing billing clients. 
 
 
 Setup, Troubleshoot and Support the Interfaces process both legacy and Decisions based . 
 
 
 Develop customized interfaces using the Decisions Rule Engine to ingest multiple data feeds and formats (HL7, .txt, .pdf) and output clean, standardized data for billing. 
 
 
 Responsibilities for assigned integrations and interface projects include, but are not limited to: 
 
 o Work with project managers to develop go live plans for system integrations and interfaces 
 o Gather, document, and verify requirements and specifications for the go live 
 o Build and maintain data dictionaries; source to target mappings 
 o Analyze, identify, and resolve data issues related to integrity, accuracy, and uniqueness of data 
 o Work directly with management, project managers, IT, and other teams on integrations 
 o Interface with clients and vendors 
 
 Monitor current data feeds into the billing application(s) and evaluate regularly for opportunities to increase automation, optimization, and throughput of additional data elements 
 
 o HL7 Feeds 
 o Flat File Feeds 
 
 Evaluate and implement the appropriate requirements, design, development, testing and troubleshooting process with internal teams, partners, providers, and external technology vendors. 
 
 
 Other tasks that relate to processes and supporting the overall Mission Control Team. 
 
 DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE 
 
 Experience in implementation of interfaces in healthcare for billing systems highly desired 
 
 
 3+ years of related Revenue Cycle experience; Radiology Billing experience highly preferred 
 
 
 Working experience with HL7 messages: ADT, ORM, ORU, and DFT 
 
 
 Familiarity with healthcare application environments (clinical EHR, RIS systems, healthcare billing and accounting applications) including data structures and hosting environments, and ability to use this knowledge to integrate and map fields to published HL7 standards 
 
 
 Experience with database integration and working in SQL Server along with appropriate tools to complete the tasks assigned. 
 
 
 Experience with establishing monitoring, logging, and alerting tools, and infrastructures for messaging systems 
 
 
 Experience analyzing and optimizing already deployed interfaces between internal and partner systems 
 
 
 Demonstrated capabilities in organizing and training support persons on tools related to managing the interface environment 
 
 
 Demonstrate understanding of data exchange protocols, security measures and industry standards relative to health data exchange 
 
 
 Highly knowledgeable of current integration methods, patterns, and best practices, with a history of delivering highly available, scalable, and supportable integration solutions with HL7 standards, interfaces, and integration engine technologies 
 
 
 Understanding of clinical workflows and exposure to clinical settings with experience in PACS, DICOM and RIS data and workflow 
 
 
 Self-motivated, quick learner who works well in a team 
 
 
 Well organized and detail oriented; must be able to handle multiple tasks concurrently 
 
 
 Strong interpersonal communicator across all levels of internal and external customers 
 
 
 Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment 
 
 
 Performing in a cross functional multi-organization environment. 
 
 
 Strong analytical and independent problem-solving skills and systems analysis 
 
 
 Works successfully in both independent and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 
 
 
 Ability to resolve conflict, communicate effectively and work collaboratively across organizations 
 
 
 Experience with working in Decisions Applications tool. 
 
 
 Excellent language skills, both written and oral and proficient in use of Microsoft Office Products: Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint 
 
 Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in creating and celebrating a culture of belonging and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all teammates. 
 CCPA Notice : When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History. 
 Radiology Partners participates in E-verify. 
 Job Type: Full-time 
 Benefits: 
 
 401(k) 
 Dental insurance 
 Health insurance 
 Life insurance 
 Paid time off 
 Vision insurance 
 
 Schedule: 
 
 Day shift 
 
 Work setting: 
 
 Remote 
 
 Experience: 
 
 HL7: 1 year (Required) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

bc307d1240e52516.title: Public Health Research Coordinator I (Part-Time/Remote) - Palliative Medicine
bc307d1240e52516.desc:
Scheduled Hours  20
  
  Position Summary  Position assists investigators as coordinator of a basic to moderately complex public health research study; may be responsible for multiple research studies simultaneously, acting as a liaison with the school, sponsoring agency, community, and study participants; may be responsible for managing and recording all phases of study protocol as required by sponsoring agency to ensure compliance.
  
  Job Description 
  Primary Duties & Responsibilities 
 
  Routinely implements and manages all phases of study/protocol; ensures compliance with protocol guidelines and requirements of regulatory agencies; may establish record-keeping systems; makes assessments and determinations of participants’ progress in the study and records progress into database; may analyze, investigate, and report adverse events; may make decisions as when to notify investigator of emergent issues, when to recommend stopping participant inclusion, and/or to make and/or recommend adjustment of the protocol of particular participants; works with investigator and HRPO to resolve IRB/protocol management issues and recommends corrective action as appropriate; may serve as liaison with funding or sponsoring agency. 
  Routinely recruits and enrolls study participants; makes and/or participates in making determinations of eligibility based on diagnostic criteria, medical record review, and/or observations/analysis in participant interviews; develops and prepares informed consent packets for study participants; and confers with participants to explain purpose of study and obtain completed informed consent packets; explains study processes and procedures to address participant/family concerns; administers/scores tests and/or evaluates all assessments to ensure they are completed in a timely manner. 
  Routinely ensures timely completion of all protocol requirements (assessment, testing, procedures and treatments), including scheduling and facilitating the participant’s timely completion of protocol requirements; may evaluate, analyze, and interpret qualitative and/or quantitative data of low complexity in conjunction with investigator as applicable and appropriate; in conjunction with the investigator, may prepare oral or written presentations or reports and analyses setting forth progress trends and/or provide recommendations or conclusions of the same. 
  May conduct literature reviews under the supervision of the investigator. 
  May assist Investigator with grant and manuscript preparations 
  Routinely collects public health data under public health research protocols. 
  Performs other duties incidental to the work described herein. 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications 
 
  One year experience in public health, epidemiological, behavioral medicine, psychological, sociological, anthropological, clinical, or urban planning research. 
  Working knowledge of qualitative and/or quantitative data analysis software. 
  Working knowledge of computer programs and systems. 
  Communication, organizational and interpersonal skills. 
  Data management and analytic skills, particularly experience managing or analyzing large data sets. 
  Solid communication organizational and interpersonal skills. 
 
 
  Required Qualifications 
 
  Bachelor’s degree; prior work or practicum experience, preferably in clinical or public health research support, is highly preferred; a combination of relevant work and education equaling four years may substitute for this requirement. 
 
  Grade  C09-H
  
  Salary Range  $22.33 - $33.53 / Hourly
   The salary range reflects base salaries paid for positions in a given job grade across the University. Individual rates within the range will be determined by factors including one's qualifications and performance, equity with others in the department, market rates for positions within the same grade and department budget.
  
  Accommodation 
  If you are unable to use our online application system and would like an accommodation, please email CandidateQuestions@wustl.edu or call the dedicated accommodation inquiry number at 314-935-1149 and leave a voicemail with the nature of your request. 
 
  Pre-Employment Screening  All external candidates receiving an offer for employment will be required to submit to pre-employment screening for this position. The screenings will include criminal background check and, as applicable for the position, other background checks, drug screen, an employment and education or licensure/certification verification, physical examination, certain vaccinations and/or governmental registry checks. All offers are contingent upon successful completion of required screening.
  
  Benefits Statement  Washington University in St. Louis is committed to providing a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to our employees. Benefits eligibility is subject to employment status, full-time equivalent (FTE) workload, and weekly standard hours. Please visit our website at https://hr.wustl.edu/benefits/ to view a summary of benefits.
  
  EEO/AA Statement  Washington University in St. Louis is committed to the principles and practices of equal employment opportunity and especially encourages applications by those from underrepresented groups. It is the University’s policy to provide equal opportunity and access to persons in all job titles without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.
  
  Diversity Statement  Washington University is dedicated to building a diverse community of individuals who are committed to contributing to an inclusive environment – fostering respect for all and welcoming individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. Individuals with a commitment to these values are encouraged to apply.

b3e7edec03693311.desc:
Global restaurant brands run their operation on the Crunchtime platform. Delivering a consistent guest experience across every location and managing food and labor costs are at the core of how Crunchtime's software is used today in over 100,000 locations across 100+ countries by the world's top restaurant and foodservice operators. Customers including Chipotle, Culver's, Domino's, Dunkin', Five Guys and P.F. Chang's rely on our top-ranked platform which now includes Zenput to manage inventory, staff scheduling, learning and development, food safety, operational tasks and audits. 
 
  About the role 
  Crunchtime's Operations Management solutions support food service operators at scale to optimize their restaurant Cost of Goods Sold while managing profitability at scale across their business. CrunchTime is looking for a Solutions Specialist to join the Professional Services team working on the inventory and labor management solutions. As a Solutions Specialist, you will begin your journey supporting implementation teams through execution of critical data and configuration tasks while taking the initiative to learn more of the customer process to eventually drive efficient implementations individually. You will be able to explore new technology and develop processes to help other team members, grow within our company and make a huge impact from day one. 
  What you'll do as a Solutions Specialist 
 
 Support customer implementation critical tasks to ensure overall success for the team and customers 
 Drive successful implementation for customers with minimal guidance. 
 Become an expert user so that you can deliver training to customers and provide credible guidance on how best to apply the tool to their specific operational processes and business challenges. 
 Using a consultative approach, help customers optimize product value by teaching them how to leverage the solutions. 
 Advocate for customers internally by collaborating with our Product team to translate customer feedback into product requirements. 
 
 What we're looking for 
 
 Know basic Excel (formula entry & troubleshooting, shortcuts, data analysis, data clean-up) 
 High level of English proficiency with excellent communication and presentation skills 
 Organized, self-driven and process-oriented individuals who enjoy uncovering opportunities to improve efficiency, both for yourself and your customers. 
 Ability to concentrate on your efforts by focusing on the most important priorities, moving quickly through issues, and driving for completion. You know how to find the optimal balance between speed, accuracy, and quality in the work you deliver. 
 Not afraid to ask for help, listen well to clients, ask the right questions, and know when more information is needed.

63989a15ce8cc581.title: Director, Technical Customer Service
63989a15ce8cc581.desc:
The U.S. Green Building Council (USGBC) is a global, nonprofit organization based in Washington, D.C., working to improve human health, sustainability, and resilience in the built environment through its programs and standards including LEED, the most widely used green building rating system in the world. Today, people in over 150 countries and territories live, work and learn in LEED certified buildings, communities and cities that protect health, climate and natural resources and enhance quality of life.
   
 
 
 
 
  Green Business Certification Inc. (GBCI) is the premier certification body responsible for global delivery and quality oversight of green building and green business sustainability standards. Its integrated team of green building specialists administers credentials and certifications for the U.S. Green Building Council (LEED), the International WELL Building Institute (WELL Building Standard), International Finance Corporation (EDGE), PEER, SITES, TRUE Zero Waste, and IREE.
   
 
 
 
 
  The Technical Customer Service (TCS) team provides customized and technical support for all of USGBC and GBCI’s certifications and credentials, including LEED, WELL, SITES, EDGE, PEER, ParkSmart, and TRUE to current and potential project teams and stakeholders. This is a dynamic, integrated team of architects, engineers, building scientists, landscape architects, planners, and sustainable development professionals with a combined 250 years of green building expertise. Together, we respond to approximately 3,000 inquiries per month across most of the USGBC and GBCI’s programs and products, including certifications, credentials, and education.
   
 
 
 
 
  The Director, Technical Customer Service leads the group that supports our customers' journey throughout the entire LEED certification process as well as other rating systems and programs. As part of the TCS leadership team, this individual will set and ensure performance against key performance indicators and collaborate across departments to continuously improve our products.
   
 
 
 
 
  Responsibilities 
 : 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Data Management, Analysis & Reporting
    
 
 
 
  Establish key performance metrics for customer service in collaboration with TCS leadership, and develop tools and processes for analyzing, tracking, and reporting performance against these metrics 
  Create customer service reports and dashboards to provide insight into our customers experience including improvement recommendations for leadership and stakeholder groups within the organization 
  Serve as a key stakeholder in customer research and outreach initiatives 
  Lead customer service data analysis and reporting functions for the team 
  Provide the organization with insight in advance of new initiatives and feedback following events and milestones 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  CRM Infrastructure Management
    
 
  Manage our CRM system (Salesforce) infrastructure for customer service in order to share customer feedback with leadership with ever-increasing effectiveness, resulting in deeper and broader market adaptation 
  Engage internal stakeholders to incorporate improvements to Salesforce infrastructure 
  Establish customer service best practices, create and deliver trainings 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Team Management & Collaboration
    
 
 
 
  Ensure team success through positive leadership, direction setting, and oversight 
  Collaborate with TCS leadership and other USGBC and GBCI teams to optimize the success of the USGBC and GBCI’s products 
  Continually improve the team’s quality standards and the infrastructure that supports the team’s ability to respond quickly to customer questions through information management 
  Lead the implementation of strategic planning and development efforts 
  Collaborate with TCS leadership to select, on-board, train, and integrate new staff 
  Maintain currency of expertise by staying abreast of new and developing industry issues and trends 
  Within the TCS Team, with our colleagues throughout the organization, and with our customers, communicate with a spirit of mission-driven teamwork and professionalism 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Requirements 
 : 
 
 
 
 
  3-5 years of experience working in a client-facing role, directly interacting, and communicating with customers in a field related to sustainability education, and/or green design, consulting, construction, operations, and maintenance 
  Bachelor’s degree in a related field of study, such as sustainability, architecture, engineering, landscape design, building management, environmental science, environmental education, etc 
  Experience assisting with LEED project applications, green building consulting on LEED projects or other rating systems 
  A current USGBC or GBCI credential, or a commitment to earn one within the first year of employment 
  Experience interacting directly with professionals in the design, construction, and/or real estate industries through both written and verbal communication 
  Experience managing direct reports 
  A strong focus on customer experience, customer success, and team orientation, and excellent communication skills 
  Familiarity with Salesforce and/or other CRM platforms and willingness to learn new technology applications 
  Experience in market research, data analysis, and reporting 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Other Required Skills and Qualifications 
 : 
 
 
 
 
  Self-starter, committed to creating a more sustainable world, and the desire to make big-picture visions actionable in the day-to-day 
  Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and quickly adapt to new circumstances or juggle multiple daily tasks 
  A strong commitment and passion to advance USGBC’s mission 
  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Details: 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Full Time, permanent, salaried, benefits-eligible, exempt status 
  Location: 2101 L Street NW, Washington, DC or remote 
  Hours: Monday through Friday, 9:00 am to 5:30 pm EST, 40 hours per week, including occasional evenings and weekends 
  Travel – upon request and approval 
  USGBC is an equal opportunity employer, committed to advancing social equity in our work and fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  Benefits: 
 
 
 
 
    Employees work for an established mission-based and member-driven nonprofit organization with a compelling vision, nonprofit competitive compensation that includes 401k matching, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive health insurance, employer sponsored Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) and pre-tax Flexible Spending Account (FSA), generous paid leave, in addition to a renewal leave of six weeks for employees celebrating a monumental employment anniversary.
   
 
 
 
 
  The headquarters office is a LEED Platinum commercial interior space in a LEED certified building in the LEED Platinum certified central business district in the first LEED Platinum certified city, Washington, DC. The office serves as an example for green design and construction products and practices. It is close to public transportation and incorporates many healthy and environmentally friendly features, including an on-site gym, rooftop lounge and healthy snacks for staff.

823eca1a971e04d7.title: Scientific Report Associate
823eca1a971e04d7.desc:
About us 
  Champions Oncology is a technology-enabled research organization that leverages an end-to-end range of research and development solutions to improve the productivity of oncology drug development. Using computational and experimental testing platforms, Champions Oncology improves decision making for effective therapeutic development. Our team is passionate and self-motivated working together to accelerate the challenges of oncology drug development and ultimately improve patients’ lives around the world. 
 
  REPORTING LOCATION :  Rockville, MD/Hybrid / Full-Time Remote 
 
  Job Overview 
  The report associate serves as a resource for Champions Oncology to contribute with the writing team in preparing/reviewing final scientific reports to pharmaceutical partners as a deliverable at the conclusion of pharmacology studies. The associate will contribute internally to the Champions writing team and external clients to analyze and report results. They will collaborate with the writing team and Project Leadership groups to meet client needs for ongoing and future studies, provide excellent internal and external customer service, and mitigate miscommunications that occur in preparing and delivering final reports. Duties and responsibilities: 
 
  Produces and assists in developing, editing, and reviewing high-quality scientific reports provided to pharma partners summarizing pharmacology studies conducted at COI. 
  Works directly with the Scientific Writing/Project Leadership team in coordinating report scope and content. 
  Performs statistical analyses appropriate for the data sets provided. 
  Meets deadlines and works within project scope and objectives. 
  Acquires and effectively understands relevant therapy areas and objectives in oncology. 
 
 
  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 
 
  Bachelor’s Degree or higher in the scientific field, preferably cancer biology, immunology, or a related field. 
  1-2 years of Medical or Scientific writing experience, including data analysis. 
  Knowledge of  ex vivo  and  in vivo  pharmacology study; oncology experience a plus 
  Advanced oral and written communication skills. 
  Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. 
  Scientific writing competency with strong proofreading and editing skills. 
  Ability to acquire and apply oncology and immuno-oncology knowledge rapidly. 
  Effective interpersonal skills and relationship-building competency. 
  Experience in using GraphPad Prism, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Word 
  Ability to interact professionally with team members. 
 
  Physical Demands and Work Environment 
 
  Must be able to sit for long periods of time using a computer in a typical home office environment. 
 
 
  This job description may be changed to include new responsibilities and tasks or change existing ones as management deems necessary. Champions Oncology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

75519108ebefd0fe.title: Finance Controller
75519108ebefd0fe.desc:
Eon 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
             At Eon, our mission is to make patients healthier and healthcare affordable. Eon Patient Management, or EPM as we like to call it, identifies patients with disease risk and streamlines clinical decision analysis so clinicians can work at the top of their licenses. With unique solutions across multiple disease states, we drive unprecedented adherence to care pathways, so that more patients are seen and more survive. When patients win, healthcare systems win - both clinically and financially.
             
 
 
             As a market leader in incidental tracking and patient management, Eon is pioneering the use of Artificial Intelligence to enable healthcare enterprises, ranging from small health systems to large, national-scale IDN’s. We have a unique and dynamic team that is focused on results, and employment opportunities both local to our Denver office, and remote based.
             
 
 
 The Opportunity 
 
 
             The Finance Controller at Eon is a senior level position responsible for financial management, reporting, and payroll oversight. This includes supervising accounting team members, ensuring compliance with financial regulations and standards, preparing financial statements, and providing strategic financial guidance to senior management. The Finance Controller plays a crucial role in optimizing financial performance, managing risk, and ensuring the organization's financial health.
             
 
 
 
 
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
 
 
 Financial Management 
 
 
 Manage relationships with banks, financial institutions, and external auditors. 
 Oversee the day-to-day accounting, payroll, and financial operations of Eon. 
 Develop and implement financial policies, procedures, and internal controls to ensure accuracy and compliance. 
 Monitor cash flow, budgeting, and forecasting to maintain financial stability and liquidity. 
 
 
 
 Financial Reporting 
 
 
 Provide insightful analysis of financial results and trends to support decision-making. 
 Prepare and analyze consolidated financial statements, including balance sheets (along with supporting schedules), income statements, and cash flow statements. 
 Ensure timely and accurate financial reporting to management, stakeholders, and regulatory bodies. 
 
 
 
 Budgeting and Forecasting 
 
 
 Monitor budget adherence and provide recommendations for cost control and efficiency improvement. 
 In collaboration with the CFO, lead the annual budgeting process with Eon leaders and department heads. 
 Develop accurate financial forecasts and variance analyses to guide resource allocation and strategic planning. 
 
 
 
 Compliance and Risk Management 
 
 
 Ensure compliance with financial regulations, accounting standards, and taxation laws. 
 Manage internal and external audits, addressing findings and implementing corrective actions. 
 Identify and mitigate financial risks through sound risk management practices. 
 
 
 
 Strategic Financial Analysis 
 
 
 Provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic planning and decision-making. 
 Evaluate investment opportunities and business initiatives. 
 Participate in cross-functional teams to assess financial implications of organizational strategies. 
 
 
 
 Process Improvement 
 
 
 Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation to increase efficiency and accuracy. 
 Foster a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement within the finance department. 
 Implement best practices in financial reporting, data analysis, and information systems. 
 Support the implementation of a new ERP system. 
 
 
 
 
 
 REQUIREMENTS 
 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field. A Master's degree (e.g., MBA) or relevant professional certification (e.g., CPA, CMA) is preferred. 
 Proven experience (10+ years) in financial management, accounting, and analysis, with progressive responsibility. 
 Strong knowledge of accounting principles, financial regulations, and reporting standards. 
 Significant experience with the SaaS business model and related accounting and reporting principles and metrics. 
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
 Proficiency in financial software and ERP systems, particularly Sage Intacct and/or Oracle NetSuite 
 Advanced Excel skills are essential. 
 Effective communication and interpersonal abilities, with the capability to explain complex financial concepts to non-financial stakeholders. 
 Leadership and team management skills, with a track record of developing and motivating a team. 
 Strategic thinking and the ability to contribute to overall business strategy discussions. 
 
 
 
 “So what’s in it for me,” you ask? 
 
 
             We pride ourselves for being a culture-based company buzzing with high-energy. Aside from the enthusiastic environment, you’ll enjoy:
             
 
 Competitive salary 
 Health insurance 
 Referral bonuses 
 Generous vacation time 
 Paid Maternity and Paternity leave 
 Professional development and career growth opportunities 
 Awesome team members 
 
 
 Check us out at eonhealth.com! 
 
 If we still have your attention, don't delay, send us your resume. 
 
 
             The pay range for this position in Colorado is $140,000 - $170,000 (yr base pay); however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base (CEPA) pay information is based on market location.
             
 
 
 EON is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Our culture celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.

20d676c78a58d15e.title: EOHSS Project Coordinator
20d676c78a58d15e.desc:
Working with Us  Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible. 
 
  Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us. 
 
  The primary focus of this position is to support Bristol Myers Squibb (BMS) as the Project Coordinator of EOHSS for the Devens Facility within the Department of Environmental, Occupational Health, Safety and Sustainability (EOHSS). As the Project Coordinator you will play an active role in supporting the company’s environmental, occupational health, safety, and sustainability (EOHSS) efforts within the Devens Facility to drive long-term company and stakeholder value. 
 
  The individual in this role will be responsible for providing administrative support and developing, planning, organization, and executing EOHSS programs, policies, procedures, and training to ensure that the site maintains a safe, healthy, and environmentally compliant facility in accordance with company and regulatory requirements. This position plays a key role in aligning corporate and local policies and procedures and will enable and foster a proactive and integrated EOHSS culture that promotes a positive, proactive approach throughout all operations. 
 
  Major Duties and Responsibilities : 
 
  Function as Incident Coordinator including internal notifications and reports, database maintenance, and tracking of EHS events, investigations, and action items. Assist with coordinating daily department Tier meetings. 
  Manage a wide range of communications and preparation / distribution of Site EOHSS communications. 
  Develop, create, and manage site platforms, databases, and SharePoint for documentation of procedures, forms, SOPs, investigations, communications, and other management system platforms and their outcomes in line with all EOHSS and Site requirements. 
  Develop, create, and maintain, and distribute EOHSS reports, and records as assigned. 
  Assist with coordination of group meetings, audits, and Site EOHSS events as needed. 
  Perform data analysis, trending, and deep data dives within EOHSS management system(s). Be familiar with the DMAIC process and assist with those continuous improvement activities. 
  Manage the EOHSS training schedule and help with coordination of assignments. Administer and review training reports, assignments, and work with Learning & Development Team on both submitting forms and implementing new initiatives. Independently assigns/determines training components for job classifications based upon existing guidelines. Exercises strong judgment when assigning qualifications. 
  Assist with document control process, including submitting documents for review and approval, submitting appropriate forms in document control system, and working with EOHSS Team on any periodical reviews required. Maintain a schedule for those periodic reviews to ensure timely completion. 
  Executes, tracks, and manages P.O.s, check requests, financial reports, and assists with purchases as needed. 
  Key contact for internal customers, researchers, facilities, management, and other cross functional groups, building strong relationships by handling EOHSS inquiries and managing central EOHSS e-mail box for the Site. 
  Challenges the status quo and brings new approaches to continually improve the effectiveness of workflows and processes (learn and apply new concepts). 
  Review and ensure accurate and complete resolution of issues as they arise and escalates concerns, resource constraints, needs, with urgency to appropriate leaders within the organization. 
  Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local environmental, safety, medical surveillance and sustainability laws, regulations, codes, rules, and consensus guides. 
 
 
  Qualifications 
  Minimum Requirements 
 
  Minimum education of a B.S. degree is required. 
  Prior EHS Incident, Administrative, and/or Project Coordinator experience is required. 
  Experience with incidents and/or learning systems database (e.g., Enablon, Success Factors) 
  Previous experience with financial/purchasing systems (e.g., SAP, Ariba) preferred. 
  Proficient with Microsoft Suite (e.g., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint). 
  Experience with document control systems (e.g., DCA, BMSDocs) preferred. 
  Prioritizes work and thinks independently, analyzes, and solves complex problems with excellent judgment, quality, and detail in an urgent manner. 
  Excellent transparent verbal and written communication skills. 
 
 
  #LI-Remote #LI-Onsit 
 
  If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn’t perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career. 
 
  Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers  With a single vision as inspiring as “Transforming patients’ lives through science™ ”, every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues. 
 
  On-site Protocol  Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is a necessary job function of this role, which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and it enhances the Company culture. 
 
  BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visit careers.bms.com/eeo-accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement. 
 
  BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters. 
 
  BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area. 
 
  Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

672b3bb6c0912703.title: Senior Enterprise Analyst
672b3bb6c0912703.desc:
**US citizenship is required for this position** 
 
  Applicants must have 8 years of experience working as a business/systems/interface analyst and ideally some experience working with 
  Momentum Financials  or similar COTS financial ERP systems like SAP Oracle etc.
   Responsibilities includes but not limited to interface analysis, integration design, requirements development, data analysis and validation, software QA testing, and interfacing with clients to troubleshoot or research issues.
   We are looking for candidates with strong analytical skills and a desire to enhance those skills in a challenging, high visibility environment. Analysts will have the opportunity to learn various analytical and testing tools. Due to contract requirements, US citizenship is required.
  
 
 Required Qualifications and Skills 
 
 
 Lead elicitation of requirements from end-users for interface, data conversion, and/or data cleanse activities. 
 Conduct design reviews. Establish acceptance criteria. Understand business processes and create process maps as required. 
 Provide functional support and assist with documenting requirements, detailed design specifications and/or data conversion and cleanse plans, business processes, and user stories based on requirements. 
 Analyze legacy and target system data. Conduct reconciliation activities. Coordinate across multiple development efforts to ensure system interfaces and/or data conversion and cleanse decisions are consistent with requirements/expectations/regulations. 
 Work directly with programmers, database administrators, and other technical specialists. Collaborate with other analysts to understand the organization’s business processes and legacy system data and processes. Under the guidance of more senior subject matter experts, develop expertise in the COTS tool, Federal financial Management business processes, and ERP implementation best practices. 
 Lead functional testing. Develop test scenarios and documentation and perform validation testing for interfaces and/or conversion requirements. Monitor, track, and troubleshoot application operation and data, analyzing incidents and working with the technical team to resolve issues. 
 Develop materials, and train end users on interface, data conversion, and/or data cleanse requirements. 
 Implement quality assurance standards and processes for validation and verification efforts. Implement software development best practices. Seek out and implement process improvement initiatives. 
 May manage and mentor other more junior resources. 
 
 
 Must Have: 
 
 
 Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum 8 years of relevant experience. Additional experience may be substituted in lieu of education. 
 Must have the ability to pass a Tier 2 MBI background investigation. 
 Experience working with Front-End & Database of  Momentum Financial   
 Strong analytical and written and oral communication skills. 
 Ability to work both independently and with a team to solve problems. 
 Quick to learn and put new skills to use. 
 Flexibility to put in hours needed to meet tight deadlines. 
 
 
 Nice to Have: 
 
 
 Experience supporting the development of interfaces and/or a large-scale data conversion. 
 Understanding of Agile methodologies. 
 Experience supporting the development of interfaces and/or a large-scale data conversion. Ability to write and execute SQL statements. 
 
 
 This is a remote position.

19deba98b5dbb4db.title: Sr. Product Manager
19deba98b5dbb4db.desc:
At Wisetack, we're building financially responsible consumer lending products that help service-based businesses thrive. 
  Wisetack is a well-funded growing startup founded in 2018 with a leadership team that comes from Lending Club, Affirm, Varo Money and other top FinTech companies. We're backed by leading VCs, including Insight Partners, Greylock, and Bain Capital Ventures, (investors in Airbnb, LinkedIn, Instagram, Dropbox, and many more). 
  We raised a $45M Series B and have invested in our people and technology while growing our partnerships. We grew 10x in 2021, and exceeded the goal of growing 4x in 2022. This is a fun stage in any company's lifecycle where we've got the core foundation built, a healthy growth rate, and a clear path to success, but you'd still be joining early enough to help shape the future of the company. 
  Most recently, we were recognized as the Best Consumer Lending Solution by Finovate Awards and have been selected by LendIt as a 2022 winner in the Best Emerging Lending Platform category for their Fintech Industry Awards. The external recognition is great, but we're equally — if not more — happy with the recognition from our customers. Our current NPS rating is a sky-high 78 (industry average hovers around the 40s or 50s, depending on who you ask). We're proud that we're building a product that customers love as well as being recognized as a Great Place to Work by our team members. 
  The Role 
  We are looking for a customer-obsessed Product Manager to join our Product and Design team at Wisetack, where we're working to build financial products that empower our customers. We're looking to expand our team focused on large-scale, high-impact product lines - core product & banking platform. 
  As a Senior Product Manager of core product, you'll partner cross-functionally with capital markets, treasury, risk, analytics, and operations to shepherd features and integrations critical to the business from ideation through scale. Example product lines owned by this team include the issuance of loans which require multiple payouts, maintenance and improvement of our suite of APIs to support platform integrations, and the integration with and scale of banking partnerships. 
  This role has high impact and visibility that will own the roadmap from ideation to launch and iteration. You will drive decision-making through customer insights, quantitative analysis, and collaborating with other stakeholders. You are comfortable with ambiguity and work well cross-functionally and have an owner's mentality. 
  Responsibilities 
 
 Assist and drive the product roadmap for our core team to support the integration of additional banking partners 
 Launch functionality critical to the support increasingly large and complex businesses 
 In partnership with engineering, identify critical pieces of our codebase which may require revisiting, and rebuild for scale 
 Lead the ideation, design, technical development, and iteration towards MVP products that validate our hypotheses. 
 Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to impactful outcomes 
 
 Requirements 
 
 Ability to partner effectively with a broad range of teams, including engineering, design, risk management, operations, sales, and others. 
 Strong business, analytical, data, and troubleshooting skills. Creatively solve problems by identifying root causes and viable solutions. 
 Exceptional analytical curiosity, and experience with tools for conducting data analysis. 
 Experience conducting research to inform product strategy and solution design 
 Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and effectively simplify and communicate them to a non-technical audience. 
 4+ years experience as a product manager or performing similar work 
 
 
 
 The range of base salary for the position is between $145,800 - $189,600, plus equity, and  benefits . Please note that the base salary range is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level and competencies. 
  Spend a little time on our About Us page researching our team and our values, and check out our Press page and our blog for more background on what we do. If you think this might be a fit, we'd love to hear from you!

76012cd84cbf957d.title: Associate Campaign Manager, New Stream Media
76012cd84cbf957d.desc:
About the job 
 
 
 
 The Associate Campaign Manager for a retail media network plays a crucial role in supporting the development, and success of advertising campaigns across multiple retail platforms. We ask that you are a dynamic and organized person with an understanding of digital advertising, retail marketing, and campaign management. Reporting into the Associate Director, the Associate Campaign Manager will work with the Sr. Campaign Manager and the broader sales and media teams to ensure seamless campaign implementation, optimization, and reporting. 
 
  Main Responsibilities: 
 
  Campaign Planning and Strategy:
        
  Collaborate with the Sr. Campaign Manager and media planning team to understand client goals and develop campaign strategies aligned with advertisers' goals. 
 
  Client Coordination and Communication:
        
  Support the Campaign Manager in engaging with advertisers to gather campaign requirements, assets, and approval processes. 
  Guide communication between the retail media network and 3rd party vendors, ensuring communication throughout the campaign lifecycle. 
 
  Creative and Content Management:
        
  Ensure that all creative assets are delivered on time and meet the necessary technical specifications for different retail media channels. 
 
  Campaign Execution and Optimization:
        
  Support the end-to-end campaign setup and launch across retail media platforms, such as in-store displays, websites, mobile apps, and email newsletters. 
  Monitor campaign performance metrics, conduct data analysis, and make data-driven recommendations for optimizations. 
 
  Collaboration:
        
  Collaborate with the sales, media, and analytics teams to ensure smooth campaign implementation and understanding of our goals. 
  Work with retail partners to maintain relationships, explore new opportunities, and resolve any issues related to campaigns. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications 
 
 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or a related field. 
  1-3 years of experience in digital advertising, retail marketing, or campaign management. 
  Familiarity with retail media networks, platforms, and digital advertising trends. 
  Proficiency in campaign management tools, analytics platforms, and Excel (can maintain spreadsheets). 
  Project management skills, with the ability to handle simultaneous campaigns. 
  Proficiency in data analysis to optimize campaign performance. 
  Contribute to campaign brainstorming and improvements. 
  Knowledge of retail industry trends, consumer behavior, and retail-specific marketing strategies. 
 
 
 
 
 
 Additional Information 
 
 
 The anticipated salary range for this position is  $51,000-$80,000 . Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and geography. A range of medical, dental, vision, 401(k) matching, paid time off, and/or other benefits also are available. For more information regarding dentsu benefits, please visit dentsubenefitsplus.com 
  Employees from diverse or underrepresented backgrounds encouraged to apply.
