822c02ec380766ea.title: Strategic Sourcing Manager
822c02ec380766ea.desc:
Title:  Sourcing Manager - Government Subcontracts/Resale Location:  Ashburn, VA *or* Alpharetta, GA *or* Irving, TX -- Hybrid --1 day per week onsite 
 Duration: 12+ months 
 Sourcing Manager - Government Subcontracts/Resale Location Options: Supply Chain Services is transforming the Global Strategic Sourcing Group and seeks a dynamic Sourcing Leader to join our world class Strategic Sourcing Organization. This position will be part of a team that exclusively supports the procurement and resale of products and subcontract of services under contracts with US Federal Government customers. 
 A key aspect of the Sourcing Manager role is building collaborative relationships with our internal business partners as well as strategic relationships with our suppliers. This single contributor manager must prioritize time-sensitive requests, effectively interface with all levels of management, and efficiently ensure the sourcing process is completed consistent with processes, policies and goals. 
 Responsibilities: 
 * Drives all aspects of the complex strategic sourcing process. Navigate standard commercial business procedures while mitigating the additional risks of public sector related contracting and subcontracting. 
 * Takes the lead on pre-proposal submission engagement with suppliers and subcontractors as well as post-award contract negotiations of business and pricing terms and conditions with suppliers and subcontractors. 
 * Earns the business partner's respect and serve as a trusted advisor. Collaborates closely with key business partners to understand their priorities and challenges; assess their needs on an ongoing basis; and manage their expectations regarding important key sourcing deliverables and deadlines as indicated by the internal business partners and government customers. 
 * Manages supplier relationships, effectively maintaining positive and ethical working relationships. 
 * Leads various cross functional project teams to develop requirements and to reach consensus on supplier agreement terms. This includes working with the internal business partners and legal counsel to determine appropriate prime contract flow down terms, identify the most efficient contract path, develop negotiations strategies, objectives and plans. This may also include drafting necessary language to translate business needs into specific requirements for contract-related documents, e.g. Master Agreements, Statements of Work (SOW), Teaming Agreements, etc. 
 * Manages business clients' expectations and escalations to effectively prioritize the work. 
 * Reviews upcoming government related projects to determine Sourcing impact and prioritize work accordingly. 
 * Stays current with business trends as well as Sourcing Best Practices. 
 Required Skills: 
 * Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience * 5+ years related experience in a contracts/subcontracts management and/or sourcing position: 
 o Strong experience in government-related purchasing and compliance/risk issues o Experience with competitive bids and RFPs and determining appropriate flowdowns o Knowledge of strategic sourcing processes, policies, procedures, category strategy, supplier segmentation and supplier risk. 
 o Experience in contract negotiations to include business, price and technical terms o Experience in drafting contract documents o Experience leading and/or participating in cross functional teams * Strong analytical skills. Experience in data analysis & supplier assessment * Experience developing resolutions to complex problems that require the frequent use of creativity * Strong interpersonal and client service skills * Self-motivated /self-starter with ability to work independently * Strong oral and written communication skills with experience in influencing others Desired Skills and Experience: 
 * * Certification(s) from the National Contract Management Association (NCMA): 
 o Certified Professional Contracts Manager (CPCM) o Certified Federal Contracts Manager (CFCM) o Certified Commercial Contracts Manager (CCCM) * Certified Professional in Supply Management (CPSM) or Certified Purchasing Manager (CPM) from the Institute of Supply Chain Management (ISM) 
 Job Types: Full-time, Contract 
 Pay: $55.00 - $65.00 per hour 
 Schedule: 
 
 8 hour shift 
 
 People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply 
 Experience: 
 
 Sourcing manager: 4 years (Required) 
 
 Work Location: Remote

8ff803b8adc6ca56.title: Strategic Account Manager, Partner Success - Data Co-op (NY, NY / Remote, US)
8ff803b8adc6ca56.desc:
Bombora provides a global B2B intent platform powered by the world's largest publisher data co-op. Our data allows publishers to meet their advertising and marketing goals by understanding which companies are visiting their sites and what kinds of products are they looking to buy. We process billions of content interactions daily to detect intent signals from companies around the world, and use that data to support publisher sales planning, activation and measurement for their advertising partners. 
  Bombora is growing and we need you to help us succeed! 
  The Data Co-op team showcases what is possible with intent data, and delivers on that promise directly to our Data Co-op publisher partners. We serve as the trusted data expert for an endless number of publisher use cases. 
  As a Strategic Account Manager, you will be on the front lines of client success, managing direct communication with our publisher partners via daily outreach, client meetings and driving strategic initiatives through in-depth data storytelling. 
  You will…. 
 
 Work directly with publisher partners, and grow deeper relationships across a variety of departments; sales, media planning, marketing, content and research 
 Tell stories with data and innovate publisher capabilities for advertising, content marketing, events, and yield optimization 
 Operates as primary support resource to partners in various ways including product training, consultation, audience data analysis, data integration, and 3rd party platforms 
 Liaise with various internal departments to drive adoption, innovation, product development and audience activation 
 Support revenue achievement objectives with commercially successful partners 
 
 You have… 
 
 3-6 years in media and advertising, including working at a publishing company 
 3-6 years in client-facing roles in business development, account management, customer success 
 Passion for "storytelling" with data 
 Tools: Looker, Powerpoint, Excel, Sheets, Slides, Google Analytics, MOAT, Hubspot, Salesforce, Marketo, Eloqua, Outreach, Adobe Analytics, Lytics, DSPs, SSPs, CDPs, DMP 
 
 Perks and Benefits 
 
 Health / Dental / Vision 
 Flexible Spending / Health Spending Accounts 
 Unlimited Vacation / Paid Holidays / Summer Fridays 
 Education / Tuition Assistance / Annual Learning Stipend 
 401K / Match 
 Generous Parental Leave (16 weeks primary/12 secondary) 
 Commuter Benefits 
 On Demand Learning (Udemy) 
 Team Lunches / Outings / Events (Yes! We found a way to do it virtually!) 
 Offices (for when you want one) 
 
 Compensation Package 
 
 The salary range for this position is $125,000. to $140,000. plus a variable compensation target of $10,000. Actual compensation may vary and will be based on a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and location. 
 Equity 
 
 
 
  At Bombora, we embrace diversity because it breeds innovation.  Bombora is an equal opportunity employer and participates in E-Verify. Employment offers are contingent upon completion of successful background checks.

5e75e826c94ae9e5.title: #11132 - Software Test Engineer
5e75e826c94ae9e5.desc:
Are you interested in working with the World’s leading AI-powered Quality Engineering Company?  
 Qualitest is looking for a  Software Test Engineer  to join our growing Healthcare team. 
 
  Position Overview 
  The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for writing test procedures, test automation scripts, test reports, executing test plans and filing bugs. The candidate must be comfortable working with complex electro-mechanical systems, deploying new software releases and running the test protocols on the systems. The candidate will work in close relationship with the software team and other stakeholders to improve the test infrastructure, data collection, data analysis and measure software product quality and performance throughout the software development lifecycle. We are looking for a candidate that can work independently but also function well within a team and with other functional groups, is detail-oriented, highly motivated, and willing to take responsibility & ownership. 
 
  Key Responsibilities and Essential Functions 
 
 
 Writes thorough test plans/test protocols, test cases, test scripts and test scenarios.  
 Executes test protocols, test cases, test scripts and scenarios and log/follow-up on defects. 
 Creates test automation scripts in python. 
 Perform thorough review of test plans/test protocols, test cases, test scripts and test scenarios. 
 Analyzes application specific software and performs ambiguity reviews of business requirements and technical functional specification documents.  
 Works with development teams to understand and review technical design to devise effective test strategy and is flexible enough to source out this information even without formal requirements. 
 Works with other functional groups, and stakeholders. 
 
 Requirements 
 
 Bachelors in software engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or related field 
 4+ years of progressive experience in software testing 
 Must have experience writing test protocols, test cases, test scenarios. 
 Must have experience with python coding. 
 Strong understanding of test methodologies such as performance, load, stress, functional, regression, unit, etc. 
 Thorough understanding of SQA process; should have experience in implementing SQA process(es) previously. 
 Strong analytical/communication skills, capable of uncovering anomalies in robust software. 
 Experience with Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence. 
 Experience with JIRA or any similar bug tracking tools. 
 Experience with JAMA or any similar test management tools. 
 Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Shell, Batch, Bash and Linux commands 
 
 Benefits 
  Why Qualitest? 
 
 Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences. 
 Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career. 
 Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since Jan 2021 – added more than 2000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us. 
 Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers. 
 Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan. 
 Take care of health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits. Qualitest will match towards your HSA if you choose to participate. 
 Never stop experimenting and learning with Qualitest Tech academy: Tuition Reimbursement Program, 3000+ training courses, mentorship programs, technical tribes, sponsored certifications, leadership programs and much more 
 Stay active and get rewarded with our Corporate Wellness Program. We pay your Gym membership and giving you opportunities to Earn additional vacation times for attendance the gym! 
 We invest in our Senior Engineers and leaders with our Equity program 
 Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth. 
 Planning a vacation? Looking for car insurance? Get access to Qualitest Employee Perks for discounts on anything from travel to electronics. With so many offerings the savings are endless! 
 A Competitive pay, the salary range for the role is  $80,000 - $100,000   
 
 Intrigued to find more about us? 
 
 Visit our website at www.qualitestgroup.com  
 Check out our Career page: https://qualitestgroup.com/careers  
 
 If you like what you have read, send us your resume and let’s start talking! 
  Apply for this job

e0b87e3f64bf7e5c.title: Deputy Director – Energy Policy
e0b87e3f64bf7e5c.desc:
Do you have a passion for driving regulatory policy change to fuel tomorrow’s economy? Are you skilled at research and policy analysis in a fast-moving environment, with an ability to effectively communicate complex ideas in compelling ways? Do you have the technical experience to comprehend and translate the complex regulatory processes of state and federal agencies? If you’re looking for an opportunity to apply your skills and talent to protect affordable energy in one of the largest energy-producing states in the country, this might be the role for you. 
  The Commonwealth Foundation is seeking a Deputy Director focused on energy and regulatory policy. This role will be responsible for conducting and leading research and analysis, including a vision for Pennsylvania’s energy future and developing effective products to advance those ideals and persuade key audiences to achieve policy victories. 
  The Deputy Director has the potential to be a remote position, with a strong preference for candidates based in/near Pennsylvania or the Washington, DC area. 
  Responsibilities 
 
  Position Commonwealth Foundation as the leading source of energy policy expertise in Pennsylvania and a nationally recognized though leader on energy and regulatory matters. 
  Maintain intellectual expertise by staying current on state, and federal regulatory proposals, policy developments, media coverage, and legislation. 
  Conduct and oversee research on energy policies, including the creation of a vision for Pennsylvania’s energy future, by working with internal staff and outside fellows. 
  Produce rapid research and analysis to identify and seize opportunities, working with our policy, communications, and government affairs teams. 
  Track trends related to energy production, infrastructure, grid reliability, energy affordability, regulatory restrictions, and permits. 
  Cultivate allied relationships to identify opportunities for the Commonwealth Foundation to fund research or partner with allies to provide timely analysis, and to communicate updates to a robust network of energy industry leaders and allies ready to share stories and information to fuel legislative change. 
  Regularly update executives and staff on the status of key projects in conjunction with allied groups, including energy industry leaders. 
  Represent the organization in public speaking, meetings with key legislators, and in media appearances. 
  And other duties as assigned. 
 
  Key Qualifications 
 
  Minimum of 5 years of experience in an energy-related agency, engineering, energy policy research, or related field. 
  Strong analytical and quantitative skills, including experience with Microsoft Office suite of products and statistical / data analysis software. 
  Proven track record of success conducting and overseeing policy analysis, reports and other related products. 
  Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex policy issues in a clear and compelling manner. 
  Comfort navigating ambiguity, with the ability to work effectively – both independently and collaboratively - in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. 
  Some knowledge of the Pennsylvania policy is preferred. 
  Excellent project management and organizational skills. 
  A strong commitment to individual freedom, personal responsibility, and economic prosperity. 
 
  The Organization 
  The Commonwealth Foundation is among the most effective and influential state-based think 
  tanks in the country. With a top-notch team of policy analysts and communication experts, CF 
  transforms free-market ideas into public policies, so  all  Pennsylvanians can flourish. Our work is 
  driven by our core values of: 
 
  Integrity 
  Treating everyone with dignity 
  Stewardship of our investors’ time and treasure 
  Pursuing productive solutions to problems 
 
  Benefits 
 
  Salary will be competitive and commensurate with experience. 
  Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance with an 80 percent employer contribution. 
  4% company contributions towards a retirement plan 
  Unlimited PTO 
  Short-term and long-term disability insurance 
  Stipend for needed mobile technology and home office Wi-Fi.

2b32ab7a4d24e20a.title: Senior Engineer (Open to US Remote)
2b32ab7a4d24e20a.desc:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s agricultural supply chain business, where we seamlessly connect farming customers with food, feed and industry. 
 Job Purpose and Impact 
 
  The Senior Engineer will apply engineering techniques to improve complex manufacturing processes and products. In this role, you will provide technical support, operations experience, continuous improvement and project management skills and be a contributing member of a team on complex issues related to the operational domain area. You will provide oversight of external third parties that are utilized at the site and improve the stability, capability and availability of processes while reducing variability and mitigating risks in the operational area. You will provide insights to enable the operational area to achieve variable and fixed cost and operating efficiency targets, while protecting our people, communities, the environment and assets and honor our business obligations. Key Accountabilities 
 
  Collect and analyze complex operational data and trends and provide recommendations and plans to improve the performance and reporting process of manufacturing equipment and processes and ensure consistent monitoring and early warning indicators. 
 Collaborate with maintenance leadership to plan, recommend and schedule maintenance of complex plant systems using reliability models and predictive technologies. 
 Partner with internal technology and finance operations stakeholders to monitor and manage variable and fixed costs at the site. 
 Plan and monitor production shutdowns and ensure legal and preventive maintenance compliance of manufacturing equipment. 
 Partner with manufacturing technology engineers to analyze capital expenditures and complex project designs to find more efficient, cost effective approaches and promote higher quality and reliable outcomes. 
 Provide oversight to third party personnel and set priorities, monitor safety and improve their skills over time. 
 Partner with relevant personnel from other departments within the site or across the business to recommend benchmark practices and create strategies. 
 You will work under minimal supervision and independently handle complex issues while referring only the most complex issues to higher-level staff. 
 Qualifications 
 Minimum Qualifications 
 Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience 
 Possesses comprehensive knowledge of engineering subject matter 
 Minimum of four years of related work experience Preferred Qualifications 
 Understanding of operational data portfolio of technologies 
 Lean certification 
 Strong project management aptitude and experience 
 Strong data analysis capabilities including continuous improvement experience or certifications 
 
  #LI-AL1 
 #Remote Compensation Information 
 
  The expected salary for this position is $110,000 to $123,582 with a 10% annual target bonus. Compensation varies depending on a wide array of factors including but not limited to the specific location, certifications, education, and level of experience. The disclosed range estimate may be adjusted for any applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. This position is eligible for a discretionary incentive award. The incentive award amount is dependent upon company performance and your personal performance. 
 At Cargill we put people first. As part of your overall rewards, we offer a comprehensive benefit program including medical and/or other benefits dependent on the position offered and hours worked. Visit: https://www.cargill.com/page/my-health/mh-health-and-wellness to learn more (subject to certain collective bargaining agreements for Union positions) 
 Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet 
 
  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

c1c57335e290c5f7.title: Marin Country Mart Team Leader [Associate Leader]
c1c57335e290c5f7.desc:
At Outerknown, we're making every decision with the highest regard for the hands that build our clothes and the world we call home. From seed to suppliers to a circular design, our mission is to protect our natural resources, empower the people crafting our clothes, and inspire change within the industry and beyond. We believe you shouldn't have to sacrifice style for sustainability - the two should be synonymous. 
 
           Consider joining the team at Outerknown. We exist to find your Outerknown, which can be described as the furthest reaches of what we know possible in design and development to build clothing in harmony with this planet while taking care of the people we work with and the precious resources we utilize along the way. A community where we value all people equally and are passionate about respecting our planet
           . 
 
 
 
  A place for community and product discovery, both paying homage to those that came before and continuing the legacy. We’re looking for great people to represent Outerknown and be part of our retail team. The people chosen for this role should have connections to the local community and a passion for sustainability. Our location in the Marin Country Mart is our first in Northern California, and for a reason we're looking for someone experienced in this arena focused on people and the planet to carry the torch.
          
 
 
  Outerknown is seeking a Team Leader to join our team and help us expand into brick & mortar retail. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for leading the team, opening, and closing the store, providing unrivaled customer service, and styling, maximizing sales opportunities, and maintaining a welcoming environment for clients. Your primary focus will be on achieving store business objectives, managing human resources, and driving associate development. Additionally, you will ensure compliance with operations and loss prevention regulations and maintain visual merchandising standards. You are a leader who possesses excellent relationship-building skills with both external and internal partners., you will represent the brand values and promote its ambitions within the marketplace.
          
 
 
  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: 
 
 
 
  Sales and Team Leadership: 
 
 
 
 
  Set a clear vision and goals: Work with the Store Leader to establish a clear vision and set achievable goals for your team including Key Leader's [Assistant Manager's] and support teams. 
  Lead by example: Your team will look up to you as their leader, so it's important that you lead by example. 
  Communicate effectively: Communication is key to successful sales leadership. You should be able to communicate your vision and goals clearly and concisely to your team and be able to listen to their feedback and concerns. 
  Empower your team: Give your team the tools, resources, and support they need to succeed. Empower them to take ownership of their work and give them the freedom to make decisions. 
  Recognize and reward success: Celebrate your team's successes and acknowledge their hard work. This will motivate them to continue performing at their best and foster a positive team culture. 
  Drive and maximize sales performance: Work with the Store Leader to identify opportunities for sales growth and develop initiatives in line with our brand values 
  Embraces the opportunity to attend and/or initiate events outside the four walls of our stores to showcase the brand and either operate a short-lived pop-up shop or host an event like a beach cleanup 
  Provide feedback to associates to assist in their growth and development within the company. 
 
 
 
  Inventory and Operational Excellence: 
 
 
 
 
  Assist in maintaining accurate inventory levels by overseeing all aspects of inventory control, such as regular cycle counting, monitoring stock movements, and executing inventory audits. 
  Leading and mentoring team members: You will lead and motivate the team of ensuring that they are well-trained and equipped to carry out their tasks effectively 
  Ensuring safety and compliance: You will maintain a safe working environment, ensuring compliance with all safety regulations and procedures 
  Analyzing data and making strategic decisions: You will use data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and customer demand to make informed business decisions that improve inventory management and operations efficiency. 
 
 
 
  Business and Product Knowledge: 
 
 
 
 
  Train and communicate current collection knowledge: This will allow you to build trust, enhance customer experience, and increase sales. Your team needs to be fully educated on product knowledge, seasonal strategy all with a focus on sustainability. 
  Assist the Store Leader in creating a qualitative end-of-month report, including sales figures, product performance and team performance. 
 
 
 
  Networking and Community: 
 
 
 
 
  Encourage the team to attend local networking events and build relationships with potential clients. This will help to establish a positive reputation for your company and increase word-of-mouth referrals. 
  Implement a customer service training program for the team that focuses on creating a personalized and memorable experience for customers with a focus on sustainability and our core values. 
  Implement events that are brand aligned that focus on the client/community 
  Assist in leading your team to consistently establish client relationships, execute unrivaled customer service, and grow your business through effective client outreach. 
 
 
 
  QUALIFICATIONS :
          
 
  Outgoing personality that can interact openly with others 
  Demonstrated ability to achieve individual selling goals and metrics 
  Customer Service experience required 
  Demonstrated sales accountability 
  Strong personal leadership skills and desire to succeed 
  Exceptional interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills 
  Ability to work in a team environment with peers and supervisors 
  Skilled at delivering thoughtful and appropriate positive and developmental feedback. 
  Seeks feedback from business partners and cultivates an environment that encourages open conversation around opportunities to personally develop 
  Genuinely values a circular fashion economy, sustainability, and the importance of fair labor standards. 
  Passionate about Outerknown and a strong believer in our mission and values 
 
 
 
  REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: 
 
 
  5+ years of experience in retail leadership 
  Strong styling capabilities with an eye for current fashion and trends 
  Exemplary communication and customer service skills 
  Excellent time management skills and a sense of urgency 
  Ability to recognize and react to changing work demands 
  Goal-oriented: the ability to stay focused on creating winning results 
 
 
 
  PHYSICAL CAPABILITIES: 
 
 
  Ability to work a flex schedule (which includes nights, weekends, and holiday availability) 
  Ability to lift at least 20 lbs. 
  Ability to climb ladders 
  Ability to stand/walk for long periods at a time 
  Ability to travel (auto/airplane/train), visit stores, and attend HQ meetings 
 
 
 
  COVID-19 Vaccinations: Outerknown requires all employees to demonstrate proof of receiving all COVID-19 vaccinations that they are eligible for, as a condition of their employment.
          
 
  This position will be based in our store in the Marin Country Mart, in Larkspur, CA.
          
 
 
  Outerknown assigns pay ranges to a job based on the location specific to the market median of similar jobs in accordance with 3rd party benchmark surveys, individual pay within the range can vary for several reasons including skills, capabilities, experience, and available budget.

9e10adb1f4b4c23e.title: Senior Manager, Website - Remote
9e10adb1f4b4c23e.desc:
LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a leading customer engagement company, creating digital experiences powered by Curiously Human AI. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month. 
  You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself. 
  Overview: 
  We are looking for an experienced digital marketing professional to join the Growth Marketing team to fill a critical role as Senior Manager, Website. You will leverage data analysis, SEO, CRO, and new initiatives to increase traffic, conversions and the overall website experience. You will work cross-functionally to optimize the website to ensure KPIs are tightly aligned with marketing objectives. You will manage a small team and lead the vision to create a best-in-class marketing website. 
  You will: 
 
 Provide leadership and strategy for all things web-related. Work cross-functionally to optimize the website experience for existing customers and prospects. 
 Manage a small team consisting of a web developer and SEO specialist to prioritize projects & growth initiatives to best align with our goals. 
 Build an SEO strategy to steadily increase our organic traffic for key terms related to our business and product & campaigns roadmap. 
 Manage expectations and the relationship with our SEO agency to drive performance and key outcomes. 
 Develop a holistic view of the customer journey for each of our products, apply data and insights to inform the development of a website experience that engages and converts. 
 Identify, build, execute and champion on A/B and multivariate tests to support business objectives. Analyze and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps. 
 Run regularly scheduled web analytics reports that contribute meaningful analysis and actionable insights. Conduct ad-hoc analysis and reporting as needed. 
 
 You have: 
 
 7+ years of experience optimizing a website for B2B or B2C SaaS companies, with experience driving conversions through CRO. 
 Experience hiring, managing and growing teams is required. 
 A proven history of success in implementing an extensive SEO strategy including technical components, backlinking, etc. 
 Considerable working knowledge of website standards and best practices. 
 A background working with industry-standard tools (MAPs, Salesforce, Google Ads, Google Analytics, etc.) and can extract actionable insights 
 Experience with the full B2B lead lifecycle 
 Strong understanding of analytics and optimization 
 A great communicator and can actively lead planning discussions 
 Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize responsibilities. 
 Bonus points if you have light experience with web development 
 
 Benefits: 
  The salary range for this role will be between $140,000 to $170,000. Final compensation will be determined by a variety of factors, including but not limited to, your location, and your skills, experience, education, and/or certifications. During the phone screening, the recruiter will provide the location-specific salary range for this role. The compensation package also includes the following benefits, which may be updated from time to time: 
 
 Health: medical, mental, dental, and vision 
 Time away: Discretionary PTO and 11 public holidays 
 Financial: 401K, ESPP, Basic life and AD&D insurance, long-term and short-term disability 
 Family: parental leave, maternity support, fertility services 
 Development: tuition reimbursement, native AI learning 
 Additional: 24/7 access to professional counselors, voluntary ins. coverage, exclusive perks and discounts 
 
 Why you'll love working here: 
  Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces. At LivePerson, the option to work remotely has helped shape who we are today: a collective of innovators and industry leaders working toward the same vision. While we maintain hubs in NY and Seattle as well as WeWork locations across the globe, our employees choose the environments that work best for them from anywhere in North America. 
  Belonging at LivePerson: 
  At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. 
  We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection. 
  #LI-Remote

4f5d39901e52d163.title: Associate Client Director
4f5d39901e52d163.desc:
Company Description
   Location: US-Remote 
  #REFID845194 
 
 
 
 Job Description
   The Associate Client Director is responsible for creating and growing client relationships, understanding unique client priorities and identifying which NIQ solutions are best aligned, and delivering on the client’s strategic priorities. This position will be closely connected with business development and the revenue management process. 
  You’re the first to recognize a client need, then turn it into a client solution. You are flexible and easily adapt to a dynamic work environment. You confidently manage data, and you care about the people behind every number. In fact, you’re a person who feels energized by successful collaboration. You manage relationships and expectations as well as you manage projects, and your experience speaks for itself. You are creative in leveraging existing data sources to answer tough client questions. You are comfortable explaining complex topics to people with varying levels of experience/understanding. You understand that your success is based upon your clients’ success. 
 
  Responsibilities 
 
  Drive improved relationships with key client contacts across all client teams, increase client penetration, and improve awareness of NielsenIQ products and services to drive increased revenue sales growth 
  Build collaborative relationships with cross-functional NielsenIQ Client Business Partners, Client Teams and Practice Areas across all NielsenIQ teams (POS, Panel, Innovation/BASES, Analytics, Technology, Retail, Consumer Insights, Spectra, Connect Partners, Big Data, etc.) 
  Consult with clients to understand strategic business priorities and opportunities for engagement, identify potential revenue opportunities with customers, and handoff to Sales Leaders to enable them to achieve sales goals 
  Work collaboratively with clients to identify and deliver analytical insights that translate into actionable strategies and tactics to improve performance and deliver value against our products 
  Drive high customer satisfaction and willingness to recommend NielsenIQ to others in the industry 
  Understand and leverage NielsenIQ solutions and apply industry knowledge to conduct advanced issue-based analyses with clear proactive insights and action-oriented recommendations 
  Drive strategic thought leadership with customers leveraging NIQ tools and assets 
 
 
 
 
 Qualifications
  
 
  5-10+ years of experience in the CPG industry and/or related sales, category management, market research/analytics space, including POS/Panel data 
  Prior experience with NielsenIQ (or similar) solutions preferred 
  Experience working with a CPG or retailer, specifically in roles related to retail media, digital marketing, retail marketing, or advertising 
  Consultative client skills and innovative problem-solving skills 
  Polished, persuasive communication skills with experience in presenting data analysis to stakeholders and decision-makers 
  Strong analytical aptitude and proficiency in a range of software and digital tech 
  Proven experience in successfully leading complex client relationships 
  Proven track record of building client engagement 
  Experience building relationship and consensus with clients 
  Proven track record in market research and project management 
 
  Additional Information
  
  About NIQ 
  NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. 
  NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com. 
  Want to keep up with our latest updates? 
  Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook 
 
 
  Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion 
  NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. 
  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. 
  Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/ 
  NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

44355d7839aaabad.title: Enterprise Project Management Office Pillar Consultant (Remote)
44355d7839aaabad.desc:
Overview: 
  
   Fairview Health Services is looking for an EPMO Pillar Consultant to join our team!
  
 
 
  The Pillar Consultant has primary responsibility for supporting project progression in adherence with central Enterprise Project Management Office (EPMO) processes and guidelines. The Pillar Consultant will provide day-to-day support to the Pillar Lead and Pillar Project Owners, acting as the primary liaison between EPMO and the Pillar Lead. They will partner with the EPMO to ensure consistent and standard processes, including project reporting and documenting requirements for project progression.
  
 
 
  This opening is eligible for benefits such as: PTO, dental/medical insurance, and more. Check out the benefit link here: https://www.fairview.org/benefits/noncontract
  
 
 
 Responsibilities/Job Description: 
  
 Serve as the primary EPMO representative within the Pillar 
  Accountable to the EPMO for ensuring pillar and project structures and reporting are in line with the EPMO guidelines, practices, tools and processes 
  Accountable for sharing of information as well as required education and training of revised guidelines, practices, tools and processes 
  Serve as an SME on EPMO tools/tracking mechanism(s) 
  Accountable for issue escalation and issue resolution and deliverable/product maintenance and storage/recording aligned with standard process expectations 
  Partners with other key players in the EPMO including OCM Practitioner, Associate Consultants and Shared Services Liaisons to coordinate project requirements/resources, achieve outcomes and ensure success at the project level 
  Support EPMO meetings (weekly) 
  Before the meeting: Pull EPMO trackers, Write EPMO comments, Issue meeting materials and print trackers, brief EPMO Lead on issues/update (as needed) 
  During the meeting: Take follow-up actions, serve as thought partner in probing problem rationale (e.g., questions to push problem solving, clarifications) 
  After the meeting: Send out action trackers and update actions in selected tool, follow-up with team on actions and provide guidance on small issues, summarize key takeaways from EPMO meetings, communicate in a structured, top down manner, produce documents of the highest presentation quality 
  Support Pillar Lead, project delivery, and reporting 
  Continuously identify project roadblocks or delays, define actions needed to unblock and follow-up to ensure “course correction” problem solving as needed to drive value 
  Act as a problem-solving partner for Pillar Lead as they seek to identify new projects and generate greater impact, faster 
  Break down organizational barriers to collaboration to ensure maximum value delivered 
  Attend and actively participate in Pillar meetings and support Pillar Lead in creating and driving agenda content 
  Support Pillar Lead with day-to-day management and execution against the overall project plan and ensuring standard EPMO processes and guidelines are followed 
  Support Project Owners and Organizational Leaders in partnership with Associate Consultants, project delivery, and reporting 
  Support high priority projects and Project Owners in driving productive project meetings and project progression 
  Support high priority projects and Project Owners with execution against the overall project plan and ensuring standard EPMO processes and guidelines are followed 
  Partner with organizational leaders in a consultative nature to provide leadership to project resources in a manner that ensures timely delivery on commitments/tasks in support of broader project deliverables 
  Work effectively with business partners, vendors and staff to develop agendas and project plans that include agreement/adoption of project objectives/deliverables by affected constituencies 
  Serve as a resource partner for required data/analysis needs, presentations and reports 
  Serve as key resource, working closely with the finance analyst and IT/analytics on data reporting, data analysis, and data interpretation for projects ensuring standard EPMO guidelines/processes are followed 
  Develop reports: Understand business need and data sources to provide answers to the relevant questions; structure and automate reports to minimize the time required to repeat the analysis 
  Maintain reports and data: Ensure adherence to central guidelines and processes; modify and reconcile reports when underlying data structures change; use judgment to exclude outlier projects that skew reporting 
  Design and prepare presentations and reports that provide leadership and key partners with summarized data trends and progress toward achieving goals 
  Problem-Solve ad-hoc issues 
  Provide ad-hoc problem solving and work with key partners to drive issues to resolution in: Development of targets, development of EPMO rules 
  of engagement, reconciliation with actual financials or other sources, identifying communication needs and developing communications drafts 
 
  Organization Expectations, as applicable:  
 
 Demonstrates ability to provide care or service adjusting approaches to reflect developmental level and cultural differences of population served 
  Partners with patient care giver in care/decision making 
  Communicates in a respective manner 
  Ensures a safe, secure environment 
  Individualizes plan of care to meet patient needs 
  Modifies clinical interventions based on population served 
  Provides patient education based on as assessment of learning needs of patient/care giver 
  Fulfills all organizational requirements 
  Completes all required learning relevant to the role 
  Complies with and maintains knowledge of all relevant laws, regulation, policies, procedures and standards 
  Fosters a culture of improvement, efficiency and innovative thinking 
  Performs other duties as assigned 
  Qualifications: 
  Qualifications: 
  Required 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in work-related field/discipline from an accredited college or university 
  5 years experience of defining, leading and delivering business change programs and/or related project progression 
  Positive and proactive process management with an eye for detail and a strong challenger mentality 
  Adept at problem solving, with sound business judgment and strong analytical skill 
  Ability to work effectively in a high pace environment 
  Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills 
  Insatiable curiosity for more value (how do I get more, faster) 
  Expertise in Microsoft Office applications (i.e., Excel, PowerPoint) 
  Possess positive interpersonal skills, and ability to work comfortably with staff, leaders and physicians at all levels of the organization 
  Ability to work effectively as a team player 
 
  Preferred 
 
  Advanced degree 
  3-5 years external consulting experience with national or regional firm 
  Extensive experience and proven track record working in highly matrixed organization 
  Extensive experience working on projects that represent transformational changes touching a majority of departments in a complex health care system 
  Relevant content expertise relevant to Pillar to support Project development and realization 
  PMP or other program management certification 
 
 
   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

f44dba13ce7c8a55.title: Territory Manager, Atlanta
f44dba13ce7c8a55.desc:
THE COMPANY: 
 
 Juul Labs' mission is to impact the lives of the world's one billion adult smokers by eliminating combustible cigarettes. We have the opportunity to address one of the world's most intractable challenges through a commitment to exceptional quality, research, design, and innovation. Backed by leading technology investors, we are committed to the same excellence when it comes to hiring great talent. 
  We are a diverse team that is united by this common purpose and we are hiring the world's best engineers, scientists, designers, product managers, operations experts, and customer service and business professionals. If the opportunity to build your career at one of the fastest growing companies is compelling, read on for more details. 
  Must live in the Atlanta-Sandy Springs-Alpharetta, GA area

 Must be 21 years of age or older 
 Previous experience in a marketing-focused role - preferably in sales, field market, or business to business

 Physical Requirements

 Juul Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment for all employees and job applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. c3ee597282353b23.title: Operational Technology Cybersecurity Technologist, Mid - REMOTE
c3ee597282353b23.desc:
Your Impact: 
  Do you enjoy implementing and maintaining operational technology solutions which create a more secure, connected and sustainable world? 
   
 If so, please explore the Jacobs Operational Technology Services Team - we provide Operational Technology services domestically and globally for internal and external clients across multiple critical infrastructure sectors. 
   
 We focus on operational technology, cybersecurity and industrial controls –  this is NOT an IT position. 
   
 This is a remote position in which work can be performed anywhere in the United States; travel to client sites is required. 
   
 Successful candidate will support projects to achieve client expectations for quality, schedule and budget 
   
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Participate in project decisions regarding technical approaches, cost and scheduling performance 
 Interact with clients, business groups, vendors and subcontractors 
 Help us implement and maintain Jacobs OT cyber standards both internally and externally 
 Travel to project sites to provide support of ICS networks, manage and maintain converged platforms, virtualization, networks, security platforms and various other OT/IoT technologies 
 Provide detailed network, cabling, server, rack elevation, and logical architecture diagrams for design and as-built submittals 
 Develop acceptance testing procedures and user manuals as needed 
 
 #dvstis #divergent 
  Here’s What You’ll Need: 
  What You Will Need: 
 
 Advanced knowledge and understanding of three main disciplines we follow: 
    
 ICS Systems (Automation/SCADA) 
 Networking (as it applies to ICS) 
 Cybersecurity (OT) 
 
 Minimum 3 years of OT experience with Microsoft Windows Server design and administration, virtualization and converged platform technology design, implementation, and troubleshooting 
 Minimum 3 years OT network experience with LAN and WAN design, implementation and troubleshooting for switches, routers, firewalls, and various other network equipment. 
 Cisco CCNA, Fortinet NSE-4, JNCIA or equivalent network certification 
 Ability to lead single technical hands-on implementation in an OT environment 
 
 Desired Skills: 
 
 Bachelor’s in science (B.S) in Computer Science or similar field 
 Excellent oral and written communication, team-oriented work practices, strong data analysis skills, technical problem-solving ability, organizational skills, multitasking ability, and excellent computer skills 
 Experience with the development of technical design documentation and technical reports 
 Experience with network analysis and penetration testing tools as; BackTrack, Metasploit, Rapid 7 Nexpose, NMAP and/or Wireshark 
 Familiarity with OT monitoring technologies such as: Claroty, Nozomi, Microsoft Defender for IoT (both OT and Enterprise), Armis, SCADA fence, Dark Trace, etc.  
 OSHA 10 training 
 Experience in leading OT design, integration or remediation teams.  
 One or more of the following Professional Certifications: 
 
 GIAC Certifications: 
 
 Global Industrial Cyber Security Professional (GICSP) 
 Penetration Tester (GPEN) 
 Response and Industrial Defense (GRID) 
 Certified Penetration Tester (GPEN) 
 Security Leadership Certification (GSLC) 
 GIAC Security Expert (GSE) 
 
 Other desired certifications: 
 
 Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) 
 Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) 
 Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) 
 Certified Cyber Forensics Professional (CCFP) 
 Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) 
 Project Management Professional (PMP) 
 VMware Certified Professional – Data Center Virtualization (VCP-DCV) 
 Microsoft Certifications (MCP, MCSE, MCITP) 
 
 
 
 By joining the Jacobs team as an Operational Technologist Senior professional we'll help you grow professionally by having you participate in the design, documentation, implementation, and maintenance of ICS networks. You will handle complex technical challenges during design, installation and maintenance for ICS systems and networks and engage in the installation and configuration of network switches, routers, firewalls, virtualized servers, converged platforms, client workstations and various OT cybersecurity platforms and tools.

3e7ad569f69d2b4d.title: Account Manager - Central
3e7ad569f69d2b4d.desc:
Who We Are 
  We're Chomps, the fastest growing all-natural meat snack brand reimagining best-for-you snacking. Made from the highest quality, humanely raised proteins, no sugar, and only natural ingredients, we make snacking simple, delicious, and nutritious. Chomps can be found in over 20,000 stores nationwide with a strong e-commerce presence. Our mission is to inspire, educate, and fuel our community with accessible, sustainable, and real food that tastes great. 
  Traits of a Chompian 
  If you've been called scrappy, resourceful, and persistent, then you might just be a Chompian. You're a team player who's self-motivated and action-oriented. You're committed to delivering efficiency and accuracy, and you happen to be great at proactive cross-functional communication. You're a critical thinker and a natural problem solver who enjoys details, research, and data. You take initiative and complete ownership of everything you do, and you'll go the extra mile for your team, consumers, and audience. You're hungry to learn with a passion to grow and improve every day. You also take a keen interest in health, fitness, and nutrition. Sound like you? Then we want to meat you. 
 
  What You Will Do 
  We are looking for a high energy, highly motivated, and creative person to join the team as our Account Manager Central. The Account Manager Central is responsible for delivering the revenue, distribution and trade funding objectives for the channels in accordance with company sales plans and budgets. This individual must be an experienced, motivated, inspired, organized, creative, willing to roll up their sleeves with a strong work ethic. 
  Responsibilities 
 
 Total sales and P+L responsibility for key retailers. 
 Manage headquarter responsibility for Central accounts such as Dierberg's, Hy-Vee, Woodman's, Schnucks, Brookshires, and more 
 Work with Business Analytics Team to identify opportunities and direct field sales/merchandising teams to drive growth within customer base 
 Analyze consumption & distributor data to identify headwinds and opportunities quickly 
 Drive new product/category distribution initiatives. 
 Implement retailer promotional plans in line with sales/marketing plans as well as shopper marketing programming tactics where appropriate. 
 Direct distributors, brokers, field sales and internal resources to accomplish sales and distribution objectives. 
 Execute monthly ride-alongs with broker/field sales partners 
 Manage all regional budgets in proportion to sales revenue + be a tight manager of trade spending. 
 Deliver distribution, shelf management, pricing and promotional objectives for accounts 
 Monitors and maintains all expenditures to stay in line with sales revenues. 
 Identify new business opportunities through innovation and price/pack strategies, and lead internal projects with innovation team, OPS, and leadership 
 Responsible for planning a monthly calendar which includes extensive travel such as, retailer appointments, broker meetings, distributor meetings, trade shows, regional shows, corporate office visits, working the market during a visit, etc. 
 Accepts responsibility for the organizational goals by taking ownership of new and different duties and identifying new opportunities within the sales department. 
 Conduct market tours within each quarter covering all major customers 
 
 Who You Are 
 
 
 
 2-4 years of experience in Consumer Packaged Goods industry 
 Knowledge of and history working with customers in region 
 Broker experience preferred 
 Excellent interpersonal, networking and relationship building skills! This person can start conversations with anyone and create a positive association with Chomps brand 
 Very strong team player, ability to work with cross-functional teams to get results 
 Experience in a start-up environment ideal preferred 
 Experience in sales planning, trade management and forecasting 
 Ability to multi-task and work in fast-paced, high demand environment 
 Self-sufficient and highly detailed oriented 
 Passion for natural and organic products 
 Ability to travel for trade shows, sales calls, and meetings - approximately 65% of time (in and out of home region) 
 Bachelor's degree 
 Must be an analytical thinker and data-driven; strong data analysis skills and experience working with SPINS, Nielsen, and Numerator data 
 Have worked with trade management and demand planning software 
 Strong PC skills including online applications, MS Office and Google Docs 
 
 
 
 What You'll Get 
 
 Ability to make an impact: Join a rapidly growing and entrepreneurial-spirited team at a pivotal point to positively impact the food industry. 
 Opportunities to grow: Advance within Chomps quickly based on outstanding performance. 
 Competitive salary ranges: Salaries are based on verified market data and our philosophy of paying competitively for our size and industry. In addition to base salary, full-time team members receive equity in the company. 
 Comprehensive benefits: Health/vision/dental, up to 6% employer 401k match, unlimited time off, monthly wellness and at-home stipends, paid maternity/paternity leave. 
 Unlimited snacks: Enough meat sticks that if you wanted to eat your body weight in them you could (no judgment here). 
 
 **This is a remote position 
 
  Our Commitment 
  Chomps is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. To achieve our mission of making nutritious food more accessible we greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which comes from diversity of all types, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do and the smart thing for our business. 
  We're aware of the research showing that historically underrepresented groups are less likely to apply for a job if they don't believe that they meet all of the criteria. Do you hesitate to submit an application because you believe you need to check every box? Please apply anyway with a thoughtful cover letter! We would love to hear from you to discuss how you can help us build a great team at Chomps.

59479b1e80d1b89e.title: Global BOS Project Manager (Remote)
59479b1e80d1b89e.desc:
Posted 
      
 
      06-Sep-2023 
      
 
 
 
      Service line 
      
 
      GWS Segment 
      
 
 
 
      Role type 
      
 
      Full-time 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Areas of Interest 
      
 
      Construction, Digital & Technology/Information Technology, Project Management 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      Location(s) 
      
 
      Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America 
      
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 About the role 
  The Global Digital Building Audit Lead is responsible for overseeing and coordinating digital building audit projects on a global scale. This role involves managing a team of professionals, including a CBRE Project Manager, and coordinating vendor resources to ensure the successful execution of building audits. The Global Digital Building Audit Lead is also responsible for providing regular status updates and reports to senior leadership. 
  The role is in the US region and is remote. No frequent travel anticipated but may be required on an exceptional basis. 
  What you'll do 
 
  Support all Digital Building Audits supporting client’s Building Operating Systems (BOS). The Digital Building Audit program is a component of BOS, to focus on security. The programs' key objective is to enhance the cyber-security of the Client offices throughout the global portfolio, in compliance with the client’s Digital Building Standards. 
  The BOS REWS PM is responsible for managing relationships and coordinating with the Regional Workplace Service Manager Lead and all local Workplace Managers, Surveyors (for the audit), Controls Subject Matter Experts, and data governance resources, planning, tracking progress and milestones. 
 
  Global Audit Lead responsibilities: 
 
  Project/Program leadership: Lead and oversee all digital building audit projects on a global scale, ensuring they are executed efficiently and in accordance with established standards and guidelines. 
  Team Supervision: Supervise a small team of professionals including a Project Manager based in the EMEA region providing guidance, support and mentorship to ensure project/program success. 
  Vendor Management: Lead and oversee all digital building audit projects on a global scale, ensuring they are executed efficiently and in accordance with established standards and guidelines. Oversight and guidance will also need to be provided to the supporting data governance team. Audit Strategy: Work with the client to develop, implement and support a comprehensive digital building audit strategy that aligns with organizational goals. 
  Quality Assurance: Ensure the quality and accuracy of digital building audits by establishing rigorous quality control processes and reviewing audit reports, this also includes working closely with a data governance team to ensure device data is captured correctly and efficiently. 
  Data Analysis: Analyze audit data to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities to enhance process and efficiency. 
  Reporting: Prepare and deliver regular status updates and reports to senior leadership, summarizing project progress, key findings, and recommendations. 
  Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with various stakeholders, including facility managers, to ensure alignment with audit objectives and outcomes. 
  Innovation: Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in digital building audits and proactively introduce innovative solutions to improve the audit process. 
 
  Regional AMER/BAY Area Project Manager responsibilities: 
 
  Coordinate and work with the relevant stakeholders in determining the priority and order of buildings to be audited. 
  Building identification against priority criteria. 
  Prepare, manage and update the program. 
  Monitor Program timeline escalates if program delays arise. 
  Work with the regional Workplace Service Technical Lead and local Workplace Manager teams to obtain necessary material required before the audits (Building information, O&M Manuals, As-built drawings). 
  Coordinate with the building auditors to ensure on time delivery of execution and reports. 
  Manage surveyors and other stakeholders to ensure compliance and accuracy of the reports (SME partners will provide expertise review of the reports). 
  Partner with other project departments and team members to ensure all deliverables are completed on time. 
  Attend client meetings and assist with determination of project requirements. 
  Coordinate landlord interaction and access needed for any relevant building. 
  Onboard/off board resources and ensure vendors are completing necessary ongoing security training. 
  Monitor and track change management log. 
  Tracking / identifying, evaluating, and preventing or mitigating risks that will impact the program and / or project. 
  Ensure regional projects' status is tracked for Global Dashboard reports. 
 
  What you'll need 
 
  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future. 
  Bachelor's degree (BA/BS/BEng/BArch) from a College or University is required. PMP Certification is preferred.  
 3-5+ years of project / program management experience is required. 
  General knowledge and experience in Building Systems, MEP, Networking and Smart Buildings areas is preferred.  
 Some IoT experience is highly desirable. 
  Experienced in refresh/refurbishment projects on commercial Offices. 
  Be aware of global/regional developments that may affect the audits. 
  Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills. 
  Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills. 
  Strong attention to detail. 
  Problem solving, critical thinking, decision-making, creativity, and information processing skills. 
  Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities. 
  Proven ability to work effectively both independently, proactively and in a team based environment. 
  Flexibility in the working hours as some occasional “out of office hours" time will be required for Global meetings with the team and the client. 
  Languages: Fluent in English. 
 
 
  Why CBRE?  
 
 FORTUNE 500 #126 
  FORTUNE Most Admired Company #1 in real estate for third consecutive year; Ten years in a row on the list! 
  Forbes Named one of the best large employers in America and one of the World's Best Employers! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 California Residents: CBRE carefully considers multiple factors to determine compensation, including a candidate’s education, training, and experience. The minimum salary for the Global BOS Project Manager (Remote) position is $128,010 annually and the maximum salary for the Global BOS Project Manager (Remote) position is $173,190 annually. ffbbaf90f7fb6cf9.title: Senior Cloud Architect – Contract Role, Remote
ffbbaf90f7fb6cf9.desc:
Senior Cloud Engineer Contract Role 
 
 
 
 United States 
 Remote 
 US Citizen or Permanent Resident 
 6-12 month Contract Assignment 
  Precision Talent Group is a leading consulting firm specializing in providing top-notch talent and expertise to organizations across various industries. We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Cloud Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. In this role, you will work remotely from the United States, supporting a Fortune 500 client as a cloud engineer. 
 
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 
 Cloud infrastructure design and deployment: Architect, design, and implement scalable, secure, and highly available cloud infrastructure solutions for data analysis and processing. Utilize cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform to set up infrastructure components, networking, storage, and compute resources. 
 Data ingestion and storage: Implement efficient and reliable data ingestion pipelines from various data sources into the cloud environment. Design data storage solutions, such as data lakes or data warehouses, to accommodate large-scale data sets and facilitate effective data analysis. 
 Data processing and analytics: Develop and optimize data processing workflows and analytics pipelines in the cloud environment. Utilize technologies such as Apache Spark, Hadoop, or cloud-native services to perform data transformation, aggregation, and analysis tasks. 
 Security and compliance: Implement robust security measures to protect data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations. Apply best practices for access control, encryption, and data privacy in the cloud environment. Collaborate with the client's security and compliance teams to meet their requirements. 
 Monitoring and optimization: Set up monitoring and alerting systems to ensure the health, performance, and cost optimization of cloud infrastructure and data processing workflows. Continuously monitor and optimize resource utilization to maximize efficiency and reduce costs. 
 Automation and DevOps: Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) practices using tools like Terraform or CloudFormation to automate cloud resource provisioning and configuration. Collaborate with DevOps teams to integrate cloud infrastructure with CI/CD pipelines and enable smooth application deployment. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 
 Proven experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Cloud Engineer, preferably in a consulting or enterprise environment. Strong understanding of cloud computing principles, architectures, and technologies. 
 Cloud platform expertise: Extensive experience with one or more major cloud platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Proficiency in cloud services, including compute, storage, networking, and databases. 
 Data analysis and processing: Solid understanding of data analysis techniques and data processing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Hadoop, SQL). Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Apache Kafka, Apache Flink) is advantageous. 
 Security and compliance: Knowledge of cloud security best practices and compliance frameworks (e.g., SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR). Experience implementing security controls and data privacy measures in the cloud environment. 
 Infrastructure as code: Experience with infrastructure as code tools and practices, such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible. Familiarity with configuration management tools (e.g., Puppet, Chef) is beneficial. 
 Networking and virtualization: Understanding of networking principles, including TCP/IP, VPN, DNS, and load balancing. Knowledge of virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V) and containerization platforms (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). 
 Certifications: Relevant cloud certifications, such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect, or Google Cloud Certified - Professional Cloud Architect, are highly desirable. 
 Education: Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. 
  Join our team at Precision Talent Group and embark on a rewarding consulting career where you can leverage your expertise to deliver cutting-edge cloud solutions for our Fortune 500 client. This contract position offers the flexibility of remote work, enabling you to contribute your expertise from anywhere in the United States. Apply now and be part of our dedicated team of professionals working on cutting-edge projects in the consulting industry. W2 Contract positions include immediate benefits and 401k opportunities. 
 
  Please note that this is a contract position with an estimated duration of 6-12 months. 
 
  Apply today to be considered for this exciting opportunity.
